sentences.english: He now repents of his past misdeeds.
sentences.chinese: 他现在对自己过去犯下的种种恶行感到懊悔。

sentences.english: She proceeded to recline on a chaise longue.
sentences.chinese: 她开始斜靠在一个躺椅上。

detailed_translations.english: to lie or lean back in a relaxed way

name: belligerent
trans: 好战的， 好斗的； 交战国的； 交战的

sentences.english: a belligerent attitude
sentences.chinese: 敌对的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 交战的；好战的；交战国的
detailed_translations.english: a belligerent country is fighting a war against another country

detailed_translations.chinese: 交战国；参加斗殴的人或集团

sentences.english: Barker was soon supplanted as party leader.
sentences.chinese: 巴克在党内的领导地位很快就被人取代了。

detailed_translations.english: to take the place of a person or thing so that they are no longer used, no longer in a position of power etc

name: abrupt
trans: 突然的， 意外的；  唐突的， 鲁莽的

sentences.english: an abrupt change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的突然改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的
detailed_translations.english: sudden and unexpected

name: oversee
trans: 监视； 检查； 视察

sentences.english: A team leader was appointed to oversee the project.
sentences.chinese: 任命了一位组长来监管该工程。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a group of workers and check that a piece of work is done satisfactorily

name: spontaneous
trans: 自发的， 自然产生的

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自发的， 无意识的； 自然的， 天真率直的
detailed_translations.english: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

name: pretend
trans: 假装；  装扮； 骗…说

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

sentences.english: Tasmania - The island state is one of the world's major suppliers of licit opiate products.
sentences.chinese: 塔斯马尼亚--岛屿之洲。 塔斯马尼亚洲是世界上合法鸦片剂产品的主要产地。

sentences.english: Afghanistan has not one but three economies: the aid economy, the largest one; a second illicit economy centered on drugs and smuggling; and a tiny licit economy, both formal and informal.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗不仅仅有一个而是有三个经济来源：援助经济是最主要的一个;第二个是非法经济集中在毒品和走私活动，第三个则是包括正式的和非正式的小型合法经济。

name: gloomy
trans: 令人沮丧的， 抑郁的； 阴沉的， 阴暗的

sentences.english: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧郁的， 沮丧的； 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that things will not improve

name: warrant
trans: 正当理由；许可证，委任状

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to note that individual situations may warrant including additional characters in the list of special characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要注意可能保证把额外字符包括到特殊字符列表中的个别情况，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: Learning incessantly is the surest way to keep pace with the times in the information age and an infallible warrant of success in times of uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 持续的学习是在资讯时代中跟时代并驾齐驱的最稳当的方法，也是在变动的世代中成功的可靠保证。

sentences.english: At Dean Miller's suggestion, I have allowed her to give the current student organizers the opportunity to propose a program for next semester that might warrant continuation of this event on campus.
sentences.chinese: 根据米勒学监的建议，我允许她给学生机会，让他们给下学期的活动提出一个方案，保证这个活动得以在校园内继续开展。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that something is true

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当理由；许可证，委任状
detailed_translations.english: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

sentences.english: So far, what scanty evidence we have points to two suspects.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我们指向两名嫌犯的证据太少。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的；吝啬的；仅有的；稀疏的
detailed_translations.english: You describe something as scanty when there is less of it than you think there should be

sentences.english: Where do those kids get their energy from?
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？

sentences.english: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
sentences.chinese: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。

sentences.english: kinetic energy
sentences.chinese: 动能

detailed_translations.english: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

sentences.english: "Manners used to be enforced through fear and deference to the Maker, the monarch, and the men, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 他继续说：“礼仪规范过去通过对上帝，君主和男子的畏惧和顺从得以实现。

sentences.english: The second virtue they develop is deference, the willingness to listen and learn from the moral and intellectual storehouses of the people you are trying to elp.
sentences.chinese: 他们发展的第二个美德是顺从敬意，乐意听从其他他们试图帮助的品行端正和智慧的人，并从他们知识宝库中学习。

sentences.english: In practice, each public school is an independent kingdom that pays nominal deference to education authorities.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，每一所公办学校都是一个独立的王国，名义上顺从教育当局。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour that shows that you respect someone and are therefore willing to accept their opinions or judgment

sentences.english: The lake was frozen solid .
sentences.chinese: 湖水冻得结结实实。

sentences.english: It was good to be back on solid ground again.
sentences.chinese: 又能踏上坚实的土地感觉真好。

sentences.english: Is the baby eating solid food (= bread, meat etc ) yet?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝吃固体食物了吗？

sentences.english: The ship’s sonar can detect the presence of solid objects in the water.
sentences.chinese: 船上的声呐能够探测出水中的固体物。

sentences.english: the properties of liquids and solids
sentences.chinese: 液体和固体的特性

detailed_translations.english: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas
a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

sentences.english: evening dresses in opulent fabrics
sentences.chinese: 用华丽织物做成的晚礼服

sentences.english: The novel contains more narrative than dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 这部小说里的叙述比对话多。

sentences.english: If this story must be written, we must have the courage to eliminate all adjectives that tend to excite wonder: they would achieve the opposite effect, of impoverishing the narrative.
sentences.chinese: 如果必须要写这篇故事，我们必须要有勇气剔除易于激发我们想入非非的所有形容词：这些词会使叙述贫瘠无力，起到相反的效果。

detailed_translations.english: a description of events in a story, especially in a novel

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

sentences.english: a circular table
sentences.chinese: 圆桌

sentences.english: a circular bus route
sentences.chinese: 环行公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: shaped like a circle

name: prankster
trans: 顽皮的人， 爱开玩笑的人

sentences.english: Whatever the trick, if the innocent victim falls for the joke the prankster yells, April Fool!
sentences.chinese: 不管是什么样的招数，只要那个无辜的受害者中技了，恶作剧的人就会尖叫：“愚人!”

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱开玩笑的人；顽皮的人；恶作剧的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who plays tricks on people to make them look silly

sentences.english: a caring, compassionate man
sentences.chinese: 有同情心并关爱他人的人

sentences.english: I allowed him to go home on compassionate grounds .
sentences.chinese: 我出于同情让他回家了。

sentences.english: One measure of a civilized and compassionate society is how well it treats its prison population.
sentences.chinese: 衡量一个文明和有同情心的社会的尺度之一，就是看它如何对待囚犯。

detailed_translations.english: feeling sympathy for people who are suffering

name: perspicacity
trans: 聪明； 敏锐； 洞察力

sentences.english: Jo was tired, irritable, and depressed.
sentences.chinese: 乔疲惫暴躁，而且情绪低落。

detailed_translations.english: getting annoyed quickly or easily

name: triple
trans: 三部分的，三方的；三倍的，三重的

sentences.english: a triple murder investigation
sentences.chinese: 对一宗三重谋杀案的调查

sentences.english: a triple bill of horror movies
sentences.chinese: 三部恐怖电影的连续放映

sentences.english: the triple world champion
sentences.chinese: 三连冠世界冠军

sentences.english: a triple bypass heart operation
sentences.chinese: 三重心脏搭桥手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 三部分的，三方的；三倍的，三重的
detailed_translations.english: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

name: reserved
trans: 保留的， 留作专用的； 缄默的， 有节制的， 冷淡的

sentences.english: He was unemotional, quiet, and reserved.
sentences.chinese: 他不动感情、安静而矜持。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is reserved keeps their feelings hidden

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

sentences.english: The tolerance he that old daddy take into to my bug munificence have gets the man sort.
sentences.chinese: 老爸对我的错误加以宽容，他有着男人般的宽宏大量。

detailed_translations.chinese: 慷慨给予， 宽宏大量

sentences.english: Her handwriting was so tiny it was barely legible.
sentences.chinese: 她的字写得这么小，简直都看不清楚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰的；易读的；易辨认的
detailed_translations.english: written or printed clearly enough for you to read

sentences.english: If the interruption cause is water flow system trouble, do not usewater right after supply resumption but keep it running around 2 minutes andmake sure water quality is acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 如因供水管路故障导致的停水，在供水恢复后，应打开水龙头放水2分钟左右，经确认水质合格后，方可使用。

detailed_translations.english: the act of starting an activity again after stopping or being interrupted

sentences.english: resurgent fascism
sentences.chinese: 再次抬头的法西斯主义

detailed_translations.english: growing and becoming more popular, after a period of quietness

sentences.english: A bird had been locked in and was by now quite frantic.
sentences.chinese: 一只鸟被关了起来，到现在它都非常狂躁。

detailed_translations.english: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings

name: grandiloquent
trans: 夸张的， 浮夸的， 华而不实的

detailed_translations.chinese: 夸张的；夸大的；大言不惭的

name: statute
trans: 成文法； 法令， 法规； 章程， 规则； 条例

sentences.english: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute (= established by law ) .
sentences.chinese: 保障消费者权益已有法律明文规定。

detailed_translations.english: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

sentences.english: cardiac surgery
sentences.chinese: 心脏手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 心脏的；心脏病的；贲门的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the heart

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: accessible
trans: 易接近的， 可达到的； 易受影响的； 可理解的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

sentences.english: The number of data is growing day by day, so a great deal of data is described as "data abundance, but information indigence ".
sentences.chinese: 数据量与日俱增，大量的数据被描述为“数据丰富，但信息贫乏”。

sentences.english: For one of the poets has said, 'Application to business is the root of prosperity, but those who ask questions that do not concern them are steering the ship of folly towards the rock of indigence'.
sentences.chinese: 有位诗人说道：心思用在生意上，乃是发财致富的根本； 凡是打听与此无关的问题的人，便是正在把愚蠢的船向贫穷的礁石撞去。

name: notable
trans: 值得注意的； 显著的， 著名的

sentences.english: If there are any notable inconsistencies or discrepancies, think through how you are going to explain the situation.
sentences.chinese: 如果有任何显著的不相符或让人起疑的情况，要想好该如何去解释这个情况。

detailed_translations.english: important, interesting, excellent, or unusual enough to be noticed or mentioned

name: concede
trans: 承认， 承认…为真  ；  承认失败； 允许， 让予

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: unparalleled
trans: 无比的， 无双的， 空前的

sentences.english: an achievement unparalleled in sporting history
sentences.chinese: 体育史上空前的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 无比的；无双的；空前未有的
detailed_translations.english: bigger, better, or worse than anything else

sentences.english: Fresno is close to the midway point between LA and San Francisco.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷斯诺位于接进洛杉矶和旧金山的中间点。

sentences.english: The studio is midway between his aunt's old home and his cottage.
sentences.chinese: 那个工作室位于他姑姑的老房子和他的小屋中间。

detailed_translations.english: between two places, and the same distance from each of them
If something is midway between two places, it is between them and the same distance from each of them

sentences.english: ...venous blood.
sentences.chinese: ...静脉血。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the veins(= tubes that carry blood ) in your body

sentences.english: He has been fined five thousand dollars and given a severe reprimand.
sentences.chinese: 他被罚款5000美元，并且受到严厉的训斥。

detailed_translations.english: Reprimand is also a noun
to tell someone officially that something they have done is very wrong

sentences.english: Violent storms wreaked havoc on the French Riviera, leaving three people dead and dozens injured.
sentences.chinese: 强风暴对法国里维埃拉造成严重破坏，致使3人死亡、数十人受伤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发泄；报仇；造成（巨大的破坏或伤害）
detailed_translations.english: Something or someone that wreaks havoc or destruction causes a great amount of disorder or damage

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: commission
trans: 委任，委托，代办，代理；犯；佣金
委任， 任命， 委托； 委托制作

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

sentences.english: There will be simple tests in addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
sentences.chinese: 将会有加减乘除的简单测试。

sentences.english: a multiplication of the number of forms to fill out
sentences.chinese: 需要填写的表格数量的倍增

detailed_translations.english: a method of calculating in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

sentences.english: The governor does not have the authority to rescind the ruling.
sentences.chinese: 该州长无权撤销这项裁决。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, or change a decision or agreement

name: provocative
trans: 挑衅的； 惹人讨厌的

sentences.english: a provocative act by a terrorist group
sentences.chinese: 恐怖团体的挑衅行为

sentences.english: She was accused of being deliberately provocative .
sentences.chinese: 她被指责故意挑衅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的， 煽动的， 刺激的； 挑逗的
detailed_translations.english: provocative behaviour, remarks etc are intended to make people angry or upset, or to cause a lot of discussion

sentences.english: Now, if the insulin "key" cannot open up the cell to glucose, there is something interfering with it.
sentences.chinese: 现在，如果胰岛素这把“钥匙”无法打开细胞让葡萄糖进入，一定是有东西干扰。

sentences.english: Identifying the presence of brown fat is one thing, but activating it to burn more glucose is another.
sentences.chinese: 确定棕色脂肪的存在是一回事，但激活它让它燃烧更多葡萄糖是另一回事。

sentences.english: But refined carbohydrates, such as white bread and white rice, can be very quickly broken down to glucose, the primary fuel for the body.
sentences.chinese: 但是精制的碳水化合物，例如白面包或白米，可以十分迅速地分解为葡萄糖，提供身体最根本的燃料；

detailed_translations.english: a natural form of sugar that exists in fruit

sentences.english: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
sentences.chinese: 人脑缺氧只需4分钟就会造成永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: Oxygen is a colourless gas that exists in large quantities in the air. All plants and animals need oxygen in order to live.

sentences.english: This might need some salt and pepper.
sentences.chinese: 这里面也许要加点盐和胡椒粉。

sentences.english: a pinch of salt
sentences.chinese: 一撮盐

sentences.english: Could you pass the salt?
sentences.chinese: 递一下盐好吗？

detailed_translations.english: a natural white mineral that is added to food to make it taste better or to preserve it

detailed_translations.chinese: 咸水的；含盐的，咸味的；盐腌的；猥亵的
detailed_translations.english: preserved with salt

detailed_translations.chinese: 用盐腌；给…加盐；将盐撒在道路上使冰或雪融化
detailed_translations.english: to add salt to food to make it taste better

sentences.english: She appeared on television to make an impassioned plea for help.
sentences.chinese: 她在电视上恳切地请求人们帮助。

sentences.english: an impassioned speech
sentences.chinese: 激昂的演讲

detailed_translations.english: full of strong feeling and emotion

detailed_translations.chinese: 使充满激情（impassion的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: The review body has produced a truncated version of its annual report.
sentences.chinese: 这家评论机构出版了一份其年报的删节版本。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩短了的；被删节的；切去顶端的
detailed_translations.english: A truncated version of something is one that has been shortened

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩短（truncate的过去分词）；截去…的顶端

name: artistic
trans: 艺术  的， 美术  的； 有美感的； 风雅的

sentences.english: artistic work
sentences.chinese: 艺术作品

sentences.english: Opinion about the artistic merit of his paintings has been mixed.

sentences.chinese: 投影设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 投射；规划；突出；发射；推测
detailed_translations.english: the act of projecting a film or picture onto a screen

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: preponderate
trans: 占优势， 超过， 胜过

detailed_translations.chinese: （在重量、数量、力量等方面）占优势
detailed_translations.english: to be more important or frequent than something else

sentences.english: small iridescent blue flies
sentences.chinese: 色彩变幻的蓝色小苍蝇

detailed_translations.english: showing colours that seem to change in different lights

name: approval
trans: 赞成， 同意； 认可， 批准

sentences.english: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.english: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.chinese: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.english: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.english: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.english: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.english: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.english: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
sentences.chinese: 需经议会批准的任命

sentences.english: She looked to Greg for approval.
sentences.chinese: 她指望格雷格同意。

detailed_translations.english: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted

sentences.english: Andre Agassi has pulled out of next week's Grand Slam Cup after tearing a cartilage in his chest.
sentences.chinese: 安德烈·阿加西胸部软骨拉伤后已退出了下周的大满贯赛事。

detailed_translations.english: a strong substance that can bend, which is around the joints in your body and in your outer ear

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

sentences.english: I represent all of the children to guarantee : we 'll study hard to requite you !
sentences.chinese: 我代表所有的孩子们保证：我们会努力学习来报答您！

sentences.english: But if any widow have children or nephews , let them learn first to shew piety at home , and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God .
sentences.chinese: 若寡妇有儿女，或有孙子孙女，便叫他们先在自己家中学着行孝，报答亲恩，因为这在神面前是可悦纳的。

detailed_translations.english: to give or do something in return for something done or given to you

name: versatile
trans: 通用的， 万用的； 多才多艺的， 多方面的

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

sentences.english: It's possible to hang a nail from a magnet and then use that nail to pick up another nail.
sentences.chinese: 把一颗钉子挂在一个磁体上再用这颗钉子去吸起另一颗钉子是可能的。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of iron or steel that can stick to metal or make other metal objects move towards itself

sentences.english: He was bemoaning the fact that lawyers charge so much.
sentences.chinese: 他抱怨律师收费太高。

detailed_translations.english: to complain or say that you are disappointed about something

sentences.english: He avowed his commitment to Marxist ideals.
sentences.chinese: 他宣称对马克思主义理想矢志不渝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；公开宣称；坦率承认
detailed_translations.english: to make a public statement about something you believe in

sentences.english: Frozen dog dirt stipples the tundra of the golf course.
sentences.chinese: 冻成冰块的狗屎点缀着高尔夫球场的苔原。

sentences.english: The park contains 150 lakes and 450 miles of streams, plus ecosystems ranging from wetlands to pine forests to montane areas to alpine tundra.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家公园包括150个湖泊和450英里河流以及从湿地到松林、从山丘到高山冻原等各种生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: the large flat areas of land in the north of Russia, Canada etc, where it is very cold and there are no trees

sentences.english: We heard a loud explosion.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

sentences.english: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately causing sth to explode

name: aggrieve
trans: 使委屈； 使苦恼； 侵害

sentences.english: it aggrieved her much that she could not go

detailed_translations.chinese: 使悲痛；冒犯；侵害…的合法权利
detailed_translations.english: to grieve; distress; afflict

name: haggard
trans: 憔悴的， 形容枯槁的； 野性的

sentences.english: Sam looked tired and haggard.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆看起来疲惫而憔悴。

sentences.english: a haggard face
sentences.chinese: 憔悴的面容

detailed_translations.english: someone who looks haggard has lines on their face and dark marks around their eyes, especially because they are ill, worried, or tired
a hawk that has reached maturity before being caught

sentences.english: Brown bears are omnivorous, eating anything that they can get their paws on.
sentences.chinese: 棕熊是杂食动物，抓到什么吃什么。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杂食的；什么都读的；无所不吃的
detailed_translations.english: An omnivorous person or animal eats all kinds of food, including both meat and plants

sentences.english: ...a poignant combination of beautiful surroundings and tragic history.
sentences.chinese: …优美环境与悲怆历史的辛酸结合。

sentences.english: ...a poignant love story.
sentences.chinese: …一个令人感伤的爱情故事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖锐的；辛酸的；深刻的；切中要害的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is poignant affects you deeply and makes you feel sadness or regret

sentences.english: She read the letter and gave us a rough translation (= she did not translate everything exactly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她看了信，给我们大概翻译了一下。

sentences.english: I’ve only read ‘Madame Bovary’ in translation (= not in its original language ) .
sentences.chinese: 我只读过《包法利夫人》的翻译本。

sentences.english: Much of the book’s humour has been lost in translation (= is no longer effective when translated ) .
sentences.chinese: 本书的许多幽默元素已在翻译过程中丢失。

detailed_translations.english: when you translate something, or something that has been translated

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.english: He died of cancer last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

name: personnel
trans: 全体人员， 全体职员； 人事

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

sentences.english: They even bestride the carriage lamps.
sentences.chinese: 他们甚至骑在马车的灯笼上。

sentences.english: The man from the Pru will bestride the continent like a colossal salesman, hoping to convert the aspirations and fears of these new middle classes into sterling.
sentences.chinese: 信诚公司象个优秀的推销员，横跨欧洲大陆，希望把这些新的中产阶层的志向和机遇变成英镑。

sentences.english: ...refractory priests who refused to side with the king.
sentences.chinese: ...拒绝支持国王的桀骜不驯的牧师。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难治的；难熔的；不听话的
detailed_translations.english: a refractory disease or illness is hard to treat or cure

sentences.english: This carton is made of biodegradable plastic.
sentences.chinese: 这盒子是用生物降解塑料做的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 生物所能分解的，能进行生物降解的
detailed_translations.english: materials, chemicals etc that are biodegradable are changed naturally by  bacteria  into substances that do not harm the environment

name: irrelevant
trans: 不相关的， 不切题的

sentences.english: We’re focussing too much on irrelevant details.
sentences.chinese: 我们过于关注不相干的细节。

sentences.english: Students viewed Latin as boring and irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 学生认为拉丁语无聊且无关紧要。

detailed_translations.english: not useful or not relating to a particular situation, and therefore not important

sentences.english: He balanced the plate on the top of a pile of books.
sentences.chinese: 他把盘子在一摞书上放稳。

sentences.english: Ma stacked the cups and piled the plates.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈把杯盘堆叠起来。

detailed_translations.english: a group of several things of the same type that are put on top of each other
to arrange things in a pile

sentences.english: the artistry of dance
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈的艺术技巧

detailed_translations.chinese: 艺术性；工艺；艺术技巧；艺术效果；艺术工作
detailed_translations.english: skill in a particular artistic activity

sentences.english: Can you catalog all these books?
sentences.chinese: 你能给所有这些书编目录吗？

sentences.english: Well. this is our latest catalog.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，这是我们最新的产品目录。 。

sentences.english: Can you send me a catalog?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我寄一份商品目录吗？

sentences.english: The focus is solely on the shirts and the hilarious design.
sentences.chinese: 这些注意力完全放在衣服和欢闹的设计上了。

sentences.english: But I love my awful life so much right now, that I find it hilarious when I am unable to convince anyone else of it.
sentences.chinese: 即时它摧毁了我的家，但现在十分我喜欢我糟糕的生活，当我不能使其他人确信是我发现它是欢闹的。

name: immortal
trans: 不死的； 不会消亡的

sentences.english: Plato believed that the soul is immortal.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图认为灵魂不灭。

sentences.english: ...the players considered to be the immortals of the game.
sentences.chinese: …被认为是该运动项目不朽人物的运动员们。

detailed_translations.english: living or continuing for ever
An immortal is someone who will be remembered for a long time

sentences.english: Getting chilly, isn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 天冷了，是不是？

sentences.english: The bathroom’s a bit chilly.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里有点冷。

detailed_translations.english: chilly weather or places are cold enough to make you feel uncomfortable

sentences.english: What she said was pure conjecture .
sentences.chinese: 她所说的纯属猜测。

sentences.english: There has been some conjecture about a possible merger.
sentences.chinese: 有人猜测公司可能会合并。

detailed_translations.english: when you form ideas or opinions without having very much information to base them on
to form an idea or opinion without having much information to base it on

name: myth
trans: 神话； 虚构的理论， 荒诞的说法

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: cordial
trans: 诚恳的， 亲切的， 热诚的

sentences.english: The talks were conducted in a cordial atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 会谈在友好的气氛中进行。

detailed_translations.english: friendly but quite polite and formal

sentences.english: odorous gases
sentences.chinese: 有气味的气体

detailed_translations.english: having a smell

sentences.english: There seemed to be no logical order to the sections.
sentences.chinese: 这几部分似乎没有逻辑顺序。

sentences.english: Let’s have some order in here.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这里整理一下吧。

sentences.english: The court ordered his release from prison.
sentences.chinese: 法院下令放他出狱。

detailed_translations.english: the way that things or events are arranged in relation to each other, so that one thing is first, another thing is second etc
to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

sentences.english: Proletarian, be aware of the raid to the USSR planned by the carrion crows!
sentences.chinese: 无产者们，要看到由吃腐肉的乌鸦计划的突袭苏联行动！

sentences.english: In India, veterinary use of the drug Diclofenac may be largely responsible for the crash in vulture and other carrion bird populations.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，秃鹫以及其他以腐肉为食的鸟类数量大量减少可能主要归咎于兽医对双氯芬酸的使用。

detailed_translations.english: the decaying flesh of dead animals, which is eaten by some animals and birds

sentences.english: Case: The category of case is prominent in the grammar of Latin, with six distinctions of nominative, vocative, accusative, genitive, dative and ablative.
sentences.chinese: 格范畴在拉丁语语法里是很显著的。它有六种格：主格，呼格，宾格，属格，与格，离格。

sentences.english: The value of Ads lies in the fulfillment of their vocative function, which is closely related to the cultural background and national feelings of target people.
sentences.chinese: 广告的价值在于实现其呼唤功能，这一实现过程与目标人群的文化背景，民族情感密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: a word or particular form of a word used to show that you are speaking or writing directly to someone

sentences.english: Hank looked at her aghast.
sentences.chinese: 汉克惊恐地望着她。

detailed_translations.english: feeling or looking shocked by something you have seen or just found out

name: scurrilous
trans: 说话粗鄙恶劣的； 下流的

sentences.english: a scurrilous attack on his integrity
sentences.chinese: 对他正直人格的恶意诋毁

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；说话粗鄙恶劣的；无礼的

sentences.english: He carefully modulated his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他仔细地调节了自己的声音。

detailed_translations.english: to change the sound of your voice

name: indelible
trans: 去不掉的， 不能拭除的

sentences.english: Her words left an indelible impression on me for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 她的话多年来我都难以忘怀。

detailed_translations.english: impossible to remove or forget

name: felicity
trans: 幸福， 幸运， 福气

sentences.english: domestic felicity
sentences.chinese: 家庭幸福

detailed_translations.english: happiness

name: resonance
trans: 共鸣， 回声， 反响； 共振

sentences.english: a tradition that has little resonance in the 21st century
sentences.chinese: 在21世纪难以引起共鸣的传统

sentences.english: His words will have resonance for many musicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话将在很多音乐家心里产生共鸣。

detailed_translations.english: the special meaning or importance that something has for you because it relates to your own experiences

name: gaiety
trans: 高兴， 快乐； 作乐， 欢庆

sentences.english: Lars enjoyed the warmth and gaiety of these occasions.
sentences.chinese: 拉斯喜欢这类场合温馨而欢乐的气氛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 快乐，兴高采烈；庆祝活动，喜庆；（服饰）华丽，艳丽
detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is cheerful and fun

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

sentences.english: The more people who have the virus, the more virus particles there are for that one, fatal mutation to appear in.
sentences.chinese: 因为如果有越多人感染到病毒，就有越多病毒颗粒可以酝酿出一种致命的突变病毒品种。

sentences.english: Analyzes the factors that influence the stretching changing in the hoisting process and put forward a method that adopting S-curve could reduce the stretching mutation.
sentences.chinese: 分析了提升过程中钢丝绳张力变化的影响因素，提出了采用S曲线速度图是可以减小张力突变的一种方法。

sentences.english: For example, it is hard to say whether an ART baby has died because of the ART technology or because one of its parents had a mutation that mutually contributed to subpar fertility and infant death.
sentences.chinese: 例如，很难说是否一个ART的宝宝会因为ART技术而死亡，或者他父母中的其中一个出现突变，这对于在平均水平以下的受精和婴儿的死亡是互相贡献的。

detailed_translations.english: a change in the  genetic  structure of an animal or plant that makes it different from others of the same kind

sentences.english: They let the land lie fallow for a year.
sentences.chinese: 他们让土地休耕一年。

detailed_translations.english: fallow land is dug or  ploughed  but is not used for growing crops
land treated in this way
to leave (land) unseeded after ploughing and harrowing it

name: malevolent
trans: 有恶意的； 坏心肠的

sentences.english: Her stare was malevolent, her mouth a thin line.
sentences.chinese: 她目光狠毒，嘴唇紧闭。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恶毒的；有恶意的；坏心肠的
detailed_translations.english: a malevolent person wants to harm other people

sentences.english: But thrumming underneath it is a deep layer of culinary funkreminiscent of fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 但敲打底部是深一层的使人想起的厨房的恐怖的发酵。

sentences.english: At that time, any fish caught had to be preserved. The only method possible was by fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 在那个年代，所有捕来的鱼都要被贮存起来，唯一可能的贮存方法就是发酵。

sentences.english: They baited others with CO2 produced by fermentation when yeast is mixed with a sugar solution.
sentences.chinese: 他们用酵母与糖溶液混合后发酵产生的CO2作为另一些陷阱的饵。

sentences.english: The film pays homage to Martin Scorsese’s ‘Mean Streets’.
sentences.chinese: 该影片向马丁·斯科塞斯的《穷街陋巷》致敬。

detailed_translations.english: something you do to show respect for someone or something you think is important

sentences.english: Some banks are risk averse (=  do not like taking a risk  ) .
sentences.chinese: 有些银行不喜欢冒风险。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to do something or not liking something

sentences.english: As we age, the lenses of the eyes thicken, and thus refract light differently.
sentences.chinese: 随着我们年龄的增长，眼睛的晶状体变厚，因此对光线的折射也会发生变化。

detailed_translations.english: if glass or water refracts light, the light changes direction when it passes through the glass or water

sentences.english: He set out several principles that he hopes will guide his successors.
sentences.chinese: 他制定出了几条原则,希望能指导其继任者。

detailed_translations.english: Someone's successor is the person who takes their job after they have left

sentences.english: If I have to stay late at work tonight, it won’t matter because we can go out another night.
sentences.chinese: 如果今晚我必须工作到很晚的话，那也没关系，我们可以改天晚上再出去。

sentences.english: Does it matter what I think?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么想重要吗？

sentences.english: Do you think it matters that the cups and saucers don’t match?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得茶杯与杯托不相配要紧吗？

sentences.english: campaigning on issues that really matter
sentences.chinese: 以重大问题为竞选议题

sentences.english: Money was the only thing that mattered to him.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，钱是唯一重要的东西。

sentences.english: I don’t care what it looks like – what matters is that it works.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎外观——要紧的是它要管用。

sentences.english: At last she was with the man she loved and nothing else mattered .
sentences.chinese: 最终她和她所爱的男人在一起了，其他都无关紧要。

sentences.english: She said very little during the meal. Not that it mattered (= it was not important ) .
sentences.chinese: 她吃饭时话很少，那倒无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

name: irony
trans: 具有讽刺意味的事， 出人意料的事情或情况； 反话， 讽刺， 嘲弄

sentences.english: Life is full of little ironies.
sentences.chinese: 生活中充满了小小的讽刺。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true

sentences.english: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.english: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
sentences.chinese: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

detailed_translations.english: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done

sentences.english: people who suffer from irritable bowel syndrome
sentences.chinese: 患有肠道过敏综合征的人

detailed_translations.chinese: [临床] 综合症状；并发症状；校验子；并发位
detailed_translations.english: an illness which consists of a set of physical or mental problems – often used in the name of illnesses

sentences.english: Net neutrality, or not?
sentences.chinese: 网络中立或不?

sentences.english: Some of the nations declared neutrality.
sentences.chinese: 有的国家宣布中立。

sentences.english: Yet in our view, the notion of “search neutrality” threatens innovation, competition and, fundamentally,your ability as a user to improve how you find information.
sentences.chinese: 但在我们看来“搜索中立”这个概念威胁创新，竞争和本质上的，你作为一个用户去提高你寻找信息的能力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of not supporting either side in an argument or war

name: recumbent
trans: 靠着的， 斜躺着的； 休息的

sentences.english: He looked down at the recumbent figure.
sentences.chinese: 他向下看着躺着的身影。

detailed_translations.chinese: 靠着的， 斜躺着的； 休息的
detailed_translations.english: lying down on your back or side

name: energetic
trans: 有力的， 精力旺盛的

sentences.english: an energetic man
sentences.chinese: 精力旺盛的男子

sentences.english: an energetic drive to get more customers
sentences.chinese: 争取更多客户的十足干劲

detailed_translations.english: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

sentences.english: Falling coffee prices have impoverished many developing economies.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡价格下跌使很多发展中的经济面临困境。

sentences.english: families impoverished by debt
sentences.chinese: 因负债而贫穷的家庭

detailed_translations.english: to make someone very poor

name: hallowed
trans: 神圣的， 奉为神圣的

sentences.english: The bones will be buried in hallowed ground.
sentences.chinese: 尸骸将被安葬在神圣的土地上。

detailed_translations.english: holy or made holy by religious practices

sentences.english: To foreordain or elect by divine will or decree.
sentences.chinese: 预定预先决定、判决或颁布；

sentences.english: To appoint , decree , or ordain in advance foreordain .
sentences.chinese: 预定预先决定，判决或颁布；预先注定。

detailed_translations.english: to determine (events, results, etc) in the future

sentences.english: one of Dublin’s premier hotels
sentences.chinese: 都柏林最好的酒店之一

detailed_translations.english: best or most important
a  prime minister  – used in news reports

sentences.english: After you run, drink plenty of water to stay well hydrated.
sentences.chinese: 跑步后要多喝水，以保持体内水分充足。

detailed_translations.english: to supply someone or something with water to keep them healthy and in good condition
a chemical substance that contains water

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: reclaim
trans: 要求归还， 收回； 开垦

sentences.english: You may be entitled to reclaim some tax.
sentences.chinese: 你也许可以享受一定额度的退税。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开拓；回收再利用；改造某人，使某人悔改
detailed_translations.english: to get back an amount of money that you have paid

sentences.english: These two words are almost interchangeable.
sentences.chinese: 这两个单词几乎可以互换使用。

sentences.english: a camera with interchangeable lenses
sentences.chinese: 可换镜头的照相机

detailed_translations.chinese: 可互换的；可交换的；可交替的
detailed_translations.english: things that are interchangeable can be used instead of each other

sentences.english: The poem's comic allegory was transparent.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗歌的喜剧性讽寓很明显。

detailed_translations.english: a story, painting etc in which the events and characters represent ideas or teach a moral lesson

name: nautical
trans: 船员的； 船舶的； 海上的， 航海的

sentences.english: nautical equipment
sentences.chinese: 航海装备

detailed_translations.english: relating to ships, boats, or sailing

sentences.english: Disengage the gears when you park the car.
sentences.chinese: 停车时要松开排挡。

detailed_translations.english: to move so that you are not touching or holding someone

sentences.english: The Cravens Peak protects unique red sandy dune fields gibber plains semi-permanent waterholes and Coolabah woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 克雷文斯山峰区保留着独一无二的红色沙丘地、三棱石平原、半固定水坑和澳洲胶树林。

name: anecdote
trans: 轶事， 奇闻； 短故事

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

sentences.english: This dear little naked mendicant pretends to be utterly helpless, so that he may beg for mother's wealth of love.
sentences.chinese: 这个可爱的小小的裸着身体的乞丐，所以假装着完全无助的样子，便是想要乞求妈妈的爱的财富。

detailed_translations.english: begging
someone who asks people for money in order to live, usually for religious reasons

sentences.english: When the company went under, tales of his extravagance surged through the industry.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司破产时，有关他的奢靡的传言传遍了整个业界。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢侈，浪费；过度；放肆的言行
detailed_translations.english: Extravagance is the spending of more money than is reasonable or than you can afford

name: cantankerous
trans: 脾气坏的； 好吵架的

sentences.english: a cantankerous old man
sentences.chinese: 爱抱怨的倔老头

detailed_translations.chinese: 脾气坏的；爱吵架的；难相处的
detailed_translations.english: bad-tempered and complaining a lot

name: kudos
trans: 名望； 荣誉； 声誉

sentences.english: He acquired kudos just by appearing on television.
sentences.chinese: 他上电视后就出名了。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being admired and respected for being important or for doing something important

name: irreversible
trans: 不能撤回的， 不能取消的

sentences.english: Fossil fuels have caused irreversible damage to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 矿物燃料已对环境造成了不可挽回的破坏。

detailed_translations.english: irreversible damage, change etc is so serious or so great that you cannot change something back to how it was before

name: coy
trans: 腼腆的， 羞涩的， 忸怩的； 献媚的， 卖弄风情的

sentences.english: She gave him a coy smile.
sentences.chinese: 她对他含羞一笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 腼腆的；忸怩作态的；怕羞的
detailed_translations.english: shy or pretending to be shy in order to attract people’s interest

name: pacify
trans: 使平静， 安慰， 抚慰

sentences.english: ‘You’re right,’ Rita said, in order to pacify him.
sentences.chinese: “你是对的。”丽塔安抚他道。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone calm, quiet, and satisfied after they have been angry or upset
something that protects you from an unpleasant situation

name: identical
trans: 同一的， 完全相同的； 相等的， 恒等的

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

sentences.english: an abject apology
sentences.chinese: 低声下气的道歉

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑鄙的；可怜的；不幸的；（境况）凄惨的，绝望的

sentences.english: Henry looked up, then continued his monologue.
sentences.chinese: 亨利抬起头，然后继续他的长篇独白。

detailed_translations.english: a long speech by one person

name: incontrovertible
trans: 无可争议的， 无疑的， 明白的

sentences.english: CCTV provided incontrovertible evidence that he was at the scene of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 闭路电视提供了案发时他在犯罪现场的确凿证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无可争议的；无疑的；明白的
detailed_translations.english: definitely true and impossible to be proved false

name: ambitious
trans: 有雄心的， 雄心勃勃的

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

sentences.english: a contemptuous glance
sentences.chinese: 轻蔑的一瞥

detailed_translations.english: showing that you think someone or something deserves no respect

name: academic
trans: 学者；大学教师；学会会员

sentences.english: He possessed no academic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学历。

sentences.english: a program to raise academic standards
sentences.chinese: 旨在提高学术水平的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to education, especially at college or university level

sentences.english: Today we’ll have a look at a hadron collider of the Nuclear Physics Institute in Novosibirsk.
sentences.chinese: 今天让我们来看一看位于新西伯利亚市核物理研究所的强子对撞机。

detailed_translations.chinese: [高能] 强子（参与强相互作用的基本粒子）
detailed_translations.english: any elementary particle capable of taking part in a strong nuclear interaction and therefore excluding leptons and photons

name: grisly
trans: 恐怖的， 可怕的， 令人毛骨悚然的

sentences.english: a series of grisly murders
sentences.chinese: 一连串恐怖的凶杀案

name: revere
trans: 尊敬， 敬畏， 崇敬

sentences.english: The Chinese revered corn as a gift from heaven.
sentences.chinese: 中国人将谷物奉为天赐礼物。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something very much

sentences.english: the media’s love of salacious gossip
sentences.chinese: 媒体对传播桃色八卦的热衷

detailed_translations.english: showing too much interest in sex

name: comparison
trans: 比较， 对比； 比喻， 比拟

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

sentences.english: Elected officials ought to obey the law.
sentences.chinese: 民选官员理应遵守法律。

sentences.english: laws passed by Parliament
sentences.chinese: 议会通过的法律

detailed_translations.english: the whole system of rules that people in a particular country or area must obey

sentences.english: We are like two parallel lines that never face up to each other.
sentences.chinese: 我门像是两条平行线永远不能坦白面对面。

sentences.english: Life is a parallel lines, one is the real life, one is the inner world.
sentences.chinese: 人生就是条平行线，一个是真实生活，一个是内心世界。 。

sentences.english: Thee teacher was apparently teaching his geometry students about parallel lines and angles, officials said. He used the example of where to stand and aim if shooting Obama.
sentences.chinese: 这名老师在讲解平行线和角度的时候，以刺杀总统为例，告诉学生如果要行刺，应该如何选择地点和角度。 。

sentences.english: the pernicious effects of poverty
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的危害性

sentences.english: the media’s pernicious influence
sentences.chinese: 媒体的有害影响

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的；恶性的；致命的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: very harmful or evil, often in a way that you do not notice easily

sentences.english: Jackson said her boss became increasingly depressed and reverted to smoking heavily.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊说她的老板变得越来越抑郁，又重新大量吸烟了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回复；重提；返祖遗传；归还
detailed_translations.english: When people or things revert to a previous state, system, or type of behaviour, they go back to it

sentences.english: The meat of the herbivore is, in comparison, far more edible , smellwise.
sentences.chinese: 相对地，食草动物的肉闻起来要好些，更易食用。

sentences.english: I only eat vegetables (scientists call me a herbivore) -- almost always leaves from the tops of trees.
sentences.chinese: 我只吃蔬菜(科学家称我为草食动物)—几乎常常是树梢的叶子。

sentences.english: You probably would call me a vegetarian. But scientists call me a herbivore because I only eat leaves, grass and other plants.
sentences.chinese: 可能你会说我是素食者，但科学家称我为草食动物，因为我只吃叶子、草和其它植物。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that only eats plants

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

sentences.english: They were accused of peddling drugs .
sentences.chinese: 他们被控贩卖毒品。

sentences.english: people who peddle cigarettes to young children
sentences.chinese: 卖香烟给小孩子的人

detailed_translations.english: to sell goods to people, especially goods that people disapprove of because they are illegal, harmful, or of not very high quality

name: violation
trans: 违反， 违背； 妨碍， 侵害

sentences.english: human rights violations
sentences.chinese: 违反人权

detailed_translations.chinese: 违反；妨碍，侵害；违背；强奸
detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, agreement, principle etc

sentences.english: This drug speeds up your metabolism.
sentences.chinese: 这种药物会加快你的新陈代谢。

detailed_translations.english: the chemical processes by which food is changed into energy in your body

sentences.english: King Alfonso XIII abdicated in favour of his eldest son.
sentences.chinese: 国王阿方索十三世把王位让给了长子。

sentences.english: The king was forced to abdicate the throne .
sentences.chinese: 国王被迫退位。

detailed_translations.english: to give up the position of being king or queen

name: emanate
trans: 流出， 发出； 发散， 放射

sentences.english: Intelligence and cunning emanated from him.
sentences.chinese: 聪明和机灵从他身上散发出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 放射（过去式emanated，过去分词emanated，现在分词emanating，第三人称单数emanates，形容词emanative）；发散
detailed_translations.english: If a quality emanates from you, or if you emanate a quality, you give people a strong sense that you have that quality

sentences.english: Endless, of the impenitent and unbelieving.
sentences.chinese: 无止境的，对不知悔改的和不信。

sentences.english: We need to remember that God's wrath does burn against impenitent sinners (Psalm 38:1-3).
sentences.chinese: 我们必须铭记上帝的愤怒曾烧死了不知悔改的恶人（圣歌38：1-3）。

sentences.english: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;
sentences.chinese: 你竟任着你刚硬不悔改的心，为自己积蓄忿怒，以致神震怒，显出他公义审判的日子来到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的人；不知悔改的人

detailed_translations.english: not sorry or penitent; unrepentant

sentences.english: He was a printer by trade and naturalist by avocation.
sentences.chinese: 他在印刷厂工作，同时是个博物学爱好者。

detailed_translations.english: Your avocation is a job or activity that you do because you are interested in it, rather than to earn your living

sentences.english: The exterior walls need a new coat of paint.
sentences.chinese: 外墙需要刷新漆了。

detailed_translations.english: on the outside of something
the outside of something, especially a building

sentences.english: The ethics committee may take a decision to admonish him or to censure him.
sentences.chinese: 道德规范委员会可能决定对他进行警告或批评。

detailed_translations.english: If you censure someone for something that they have done, you tell them that you strongly disapprove of it
the act of expressing strong disapproval and criticism

sentences.english: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.english: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

detailed_translations.english: a special way of doing something

sentences.english: a society in which women are considered to be chattels
sentences.chinese: 视女人为私人财产的社会

detailed_translations.english: a piece of personal property that you can move from one place to another

name: levy
trans: 征税， 税款； 征兵

sentences.english: ...an annual levy on all drivers.
sentences.chinese: …向所有司机征收的年税。

sentences.english: a new tax levied on all electrical goods
sentences.chinese: 对所有电器商品征收的一种新税

detailed_translations.english: an additional sum of money, usually paid as a tax
to officially say that people must pay a tax or charge

name: intimidate
trans: 恐吓， 威胁， 胁迫

sentences.english: Attempts to intimidate her failed.
sentences.chinese: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

detailed_translations.english: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want

name: xenophobe
trans: 畏惧或憎恨外国人 / 事物的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 仇外；害怕生人者；畏惧和憎恨外国人的人
detailed_translations.english: a person who hates or fears foreigners or strangers

sentences.english: Set the timer on the cooker for three minutes.
sentences.chinese: 把炉子上的定时器设定为三分钟。

detailed_translations.chinese: [电子] 定时器；计时器；计时员，记时员；跑表；延时调节器
detailed_translations.english: an instrument that you use to measure time, when you are doing something such as cooking

sentences.english: He accused Frank of malingering.
sentences.chinese: 他指责弗兰克装病逃避工作。

detailed_translations.english: to avoid work by pretending to be ill

name: flux
trans: 流， 流出， 流动； 涨潮； 变迁

sentences.english: Everything is in flux at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 眼下一切都变化不定。

detailed_translations.chinese: [流][机] 流量；变迁；不稳定；流出

name: coincidence
trans: 一致， 符合， 同时发生或同时存在  的事

sentences.english: ‘I’m going to Appleby tomorrow.’ ‘ What a coincidence ! I’m going there too.’
sentences.chinese: “明天我要去阿普尔比。”“太巧了！我也要去那里。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧合， 巧事； 一致， 符合
detailed_translations.english: when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual

name: becalm
trans: 使安静； 因无风而使停航

detailed_translations.chinese: 使安静；使停滞；因无风而使停航

sentences.english: the detrimental effect of pollution on the environment
sentences.chinese: 污染对环境的不利影响

detailed_translations.english: causing harm or damage

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的人（或物）；不受欢迎的求婚者

sentences.english: The prince waved at the crowd of 600 well-wishers.
sentences.chinese: 王子向600名祝愿者挥手致意。

detailed_translations.english: someone who shows by their behaviour that they like someone and want them to succeed, be happy etc

name: capitulate
trans: 有条件投降； 屈服， 停止抵抗

sentences.english: Helen finally capitulated and let her son have a car.
sentences.chinese: 海伦最终让步，同意让儿子买一辆车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 认输，屈服；屈从，停止反抗；有条件投降；让步
detailed_translations.english: to accept or agree to something that you have been opposing for a long time

name: celibate
trans: 独身者， 独身主义者

sentences.english: ...the U.S.A.'s biggest group of celibates.
sentences.chinese: …美国最大的独身宗教群体。

detailed_translations.english: A celibate is someone who is celibate
not married and not having sex, especially because of your religious beliefs

name: vicarious
trans: 代理的； 间接感受到的

sentences.english: She invents fantasy lives for her own vicarious pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 她幻想过着各种奇妙的生活，从这种想象中获得乐趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 替代的；代理的；发同感的

name: satiate
trans: 使充分满足； 享用过度； 使厌腻

sentences.english: The dinner was enough to satiate the gourmets.
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭足够让美食家们吃个够。

detailed_translations.english: to satisfy a desire or need for something such as food or sex, especially so that you feel you have had too much

sentences.english: A lengthy period of training is required.
sentences.chinese: 需要很长一段时间的培训。

sentences.english: An accident is causing some lengthy delays.
sentences.chinese: 一起事故造成长时间的延误。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time, often too long
