detailed_translations.english: the time when something first begins to be widely used

name: medieval
trans: 中世纪的， 仿中世纪的； 老式的， 原始的

sentences.english: These spices were first brought to Italy from the East in medieval times.
sentences.chinese: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。

sentences.english: a medieval castle
sentences.chinese: 一座中世纪城堡

detailed_translations.english: connected with the Middle Ages (= the period between about 1100 and 1500 AD )

name: involve
trans: 使某人卷入， 陷入， 连累； 包含， 含有， 涉及

sentences.english: What will the job involve?
sentences.chinese: 这份工作包括什么？

sentences.english: I didn’t realize putting on a play involved so much work.
sentences.chinese: 我没想到上演一出戏剧需要做这么多的工作。

detailed_translations.english: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

name: requisite
trans: 需要的， 必不可少的， 必备的

sentences.english: He lacks the requisite qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他缺少必要的资历。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必备的，必不可少的；需要的
detailed_translations.english: needed for a particular purpose
something that is needed for a particular purpose

name: elude
trans: 不记得， 不理解； 躲避， 逃避

sentences.english: He eluded his pursuers by escaping into a river.
sentences.chinese: 他逃到河里，甩掉了追踪他的人。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from someone or something, especially by tricking them

sentences.english: The Siberian genseng plant is a shrub of 1 to 3 meters tall, while the ginseng plant is herbaceous.
sentences.chinese: 西伯利亚人参植物是一个1到3米多高的灌木，而人参的植物是草本植物。

sentences.english: Configuration feature: Aquatic or wet unripe herbaceous, or bacterium root nutrition and without chlorophyll.
sentences.chinese: 形态特征： 水生或湿生草本，或菌根营养而无叶绿素。

sentences.english: To their surprise, Ms Sagot and Dr Stevens found that all four of the most sociable species are among those forced to use herbaceous plants, and thus to build ramshackle homes.
sentences.chinese: 令他们吃惊的是，萨戈女士和史蒂文斯博士发现，所有最善群居的四个种群是那些迫使运用草本植物并因此建造摇摇欲坠的巢穴的蝙蝠。

detailed_translations.english: plants that are herbaceous have soft stems rather than hard stems made of wood

name: obsequious
trans: 谄媚的， 奉承的， 拍马屁的

sentences.english: an obsequious smile
sentences.chinese: 谄媚的微笑

detailed_translations.english: very eager to please or agree with people who are powerful – used in order to show disapproval

sentences.english: It is sad that many people have got amnesia when they come out from disasters.
sentences.chinese: 许多人渡过灾难以后都得了健忘症，这是可悲的。

sentences.english: So one explanation is that infant amnesia is simply a result of the natural process of forgetting the things we experience throughout our lives.
sentences.chinese: 因此，就有解释称，婴儿健忘症仅仅是我们一生当中忘记我们所经历过的事情这一自然过程的一个结果。

sentences.english: Postcrash amnesia has robbed him of the vital three or four minutes that preceded the crash in the Pont d'Alma tunnel and its aftermath, when he lay suspended between life and death.
sentences.chinese: 撞车造成的健忘症已抹掉了关于阿尔玛桥隧道里撞车前至关紧要的三四分钟以及事后情况的记忆．那时他正悬命于生死之间。

sentences.english: Trade Union leaders were charged with sedition.
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人被控犯有煽动罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 暴动；煽动性的言论或行为；妨害治安
detailed_translations.english: speech, writing, or actions intended to encourage people to disobey a government

sentences.english: The closure of the factories is seen as a retrograde step .
sentences.chinese: 工厂的关闭被认为是一个退步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒退的；退化的；次序颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: involving a return to an earlier and worse situation

sentences.english: The military initially focused on 'remote viewing', the scientific term for clairvoyance and extrasensory perception (or ESP).
sentences.chinese: 军方最初致力于开发“遥视”能力，这是千里眼和超感知觉的科学术语（或称ESP）。

detailed_translations.english: the alleged power of perceiving things beyond the natural range of the senses

sentences.english: Their map has since been superseded by photographic atlases.
sentences.chinese: 他们的地图从此被摄影地图册取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取代，代替；紧接着……而到来
detailed_translations.english: if a new idea, product, or method supersedes another one, it becomes used instead because it is more modern or effective

sentences.english: One is to see whether you have any worry triggers and to distract yourself when you begin to ruminate.
sentences.chinese: 首先看看你自己是否有担忧的动机，如果当你自己出现“沉思”时，尽量分散自己的注意力。

sentences.english: “Some people prone to ruminate have basic problems pushing things out of consciousness once they get there,” she said.
sentences.chinese: 有些人陷入事情中时，倾向于反刍基本问题来把事情驱逐出脑海。

sentences.english: This is in part because real events can affect us in the real world, and in part because we tend to ruminate about the implications of real-world acts.
sentences.chinese: 原因部分是由于真实事件影响着现实世界中的我们，部分是因为我们倾向反复思考现实世界中行为的影响。

detailed_translations.english: to think carefully and deeply about something

sentences.english: the Sahara Desert
sentences.chinese: 撒哈拉沙漠

sentences.english: This area of the country is mostly desert.
sentences.chinese: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand
to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

sentences.english: We wake every morning to the sound of a finch singing.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨醒来时还能听到燕雀的歌唱。

sentences.english: One species of finch learned to pick up a cactus needle to poke for insects.
sentences.chinese: 有一种雀科小鸟学会捡起仙人掌针去戳得昆虫猎物。

detailed_translations.english: a small bird with a short beak

sentences.english: The course syllabus consisted mainly of novels by African-American authors, male and female.
sentences.chinese: 该课程的教学大纲主要包括了非裔美国男女作家的小说。

detailed_translations.english: a plan that states exactly what students at a school or college should learn in a particular subject

name: pulverize
trans: 研磨成粉； 彻底毁灭

sentences.english: The seeds can be used whole or pulverized into flour.
sentences.chinese: 这些籽可以完整使用，或者磨成粉末。

detailed_translations.english: to crush something into a powder

sentences.english: the local dialect
sentences.chinese: 当地方言

detailed_translations.chinese: 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征
detailed_translations.english: a form of a language which is spoken only in one area, with words or grammar that are slightly different from other forms of the same language

sentences.english: We are not so much testing as proposal-thinning, and we can add rigor such as traceability and other documentation as the leading architectural candidates emerge.
sentences.chinese: 我们不像细化提议那样做太多测试，随着最主要的架构候选的出现，我们可以添加严密，如可溯性和其他文档。

sentences.english: The towers, not only ground the buildings with their visual weight, but they also contribute to the rigor of rhythmic play needed in such expansive internal spaces and environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些塔楼不仅利用其视觉上的厚重感将建筑物固定在地面上，还有助于生成这种开阔的内部空间和环境所需的严谨的韵律感。

sentences.english: a turgid Social Science textbook
sentences.chinese: 一本枯燥乏味的社会科学教科书

detailed_translations.english: full and swollen with liquid or air

name: emergency
trans: 紧急情况， 突然事件， 非常时刻

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

sentences.english: You can bet that would truly paralyze the flow of credit: Does anyone believe Washington can manage banks?
sentences.chinese: 你可以打赌，这会使流动的信贷真正限于瘫痪：真有人相信华盛顿可以经营银行吗？

sentences.english: I think we would all agree that it is well worth it, yet many of us still choose to let this innate fear paralyze us and settle into comfortable, secure positions despite being unhappy in them.
sentences.chinese: 我想每个人都认同这些东西是值得的，但是我们中许多人尽管对目前处境不甚满意，仍然选择麻痹于内在的恐惧，停滞于安逸，保险的职位。

sentences.english: Look at the false police reports that omitted or misstated crucial facts.
sentences.chinese: 看看那些失实的警方报告吧，它们忽略或谎报了关键的事实。

sentences.english: The amount was misstated in the table because of an error by regulators.
sentences.chinese: 由于校准者的失误，图表里的数目是错误的。

detailed_translations.english: If you misstate something, you state it incorrectly or give false information about it

name: gesticulation
trans: 姿势； 做姿势传达； 手势

sentences.english: The essentials of humanistic language include talk, intonation, facial expression and gesticulation.
sentences.chinese: 人性化服务语言要素包括语言、语调、表情和手势等。

sentences.english: Allusive method, use a language more commonly, also can use gesticulation, expression, or use cipher of etc of allusive sex medicaments to undertake.
sentences.chinese: 暗示的方法，一般多采用语言，也可采用手势、表情，或采用暗示性药物及其他暗号来进行。

name: anachronistic
trans: 时代错误的； 过时的

sentences.english: Many of its practices seem anachronistic.
sentences.chinese: 它的很多做法似乎过时了。

detailed_translations.english: You say that something is anachronistic when you think that it is out of date or old-fashioned

sentences.english: a company with an exemplary record on environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 在处理环境问题方面可作为楷模的公司

detailed_translations.chinese: 可作楷模的， 典范的
detailed_translations.english: excellent and providing a good example for people to follow

name: incumbent
trans: 职责所在的， 负有…义务的

sentences.english: In the June elections, Morris easily defeated the incumbent, Tom Smith.
sentences.chinese: 在6月的大选中，莫里斯轻松击败了在任的汤姆·史密斯。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected to an official position, especially in politics, and who is doing that job at the present time

sentences.english: an acceleration in the rate of inflation
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率的加快

detailed_translations.english: a process in which something happens more and more quickly

name: adamant
trans: 坚定不移的， 固执的

sentences.english: She begged me to change my mind, but I remained adamant .
sentences.chinese: 她求我改变主意，但我坚决不肯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 固执的，坚强的；坚定不移的；坚硬无比的
detailed_translations.english: determined not to change your opinion or a decision that you have made

sentences.english: a hydraulic pump
sentences.chinese: 水压泵，液压泵

sentences.english: hydraulic brakes
sentences.chinese: 液压制动器

detailed_translations.chinese: 液压的；水力的；水力学的
detailed_translations.english: moved or operated by the pressure of water or other liquid

sentences.english: The taxi driver, a phlegmatic man in middle age, showed no surprise at this request.
sentences.chinese: 出租车司机是个冷静的中年人，对这一要求毫不惊讶。

sentences.english: The shock of the explosion was felt over a radius of forty miles.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸引起的剧烈震动在方圆40英里内都能感觉得到。

detailed_translations.english: an area that covers a particular distance in all directions from a central point

sentences.english: Winnie is a woman of quiet fortitude who has endured a lot of suffering.
sentences.chinese: 温妮是个坚强寡言的女子，她忍受了许多痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: courage shown when you are in great pain or experiencing a lot of trouble

name: impair
trans: 损害， 损伤； 削弱， 减少

sentences.english: The illness had impaired his ability to think and concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

sentences.english: We must arouse them to fight for their own emancipation.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须唤起他们为其自身的解放而斗争。

sentences.english: The essence of wisdom is emancipation, as far as possible, from the tyranny of the here and now.
sentences.chinese: 智慧的本质在于尽一切可能从“这里”和“现在”构成的暴政中解放出来。

sentences.english: In order to get rid of these agonies, and eventually to win human emancipation in the real sense, all the people should unite and strive to create a society characterized by harmony of the two sexes.
sentences.chinese: 为了摆脱这些不幸与痛苦，也为了人类最终获得真正意义上的解放，共同生活在这一片蓝天下的人们应该团结起来，努力创造一个两性和谐的社会。

sentences.english: a sumptuous feast
sentences.chinese: 盛宴

sentences.english: a sumptuous palace
sentences.chinese: 一座富丽堂皇的宫殿

detailed_translations.english: very impressive and expensive

sentences.english: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.
sentences.chinese: 获得各种资格证书的年轻人的数量一直保持不变或者已经减少。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is static does not move or change
noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

name: cajole
trans: 以甜言蜜语哄骗； 勾引

sentences.english: Do you think you can cajole some money out of your father?
sentences.chinese: 你认为你能从你父亲那里骗到一些钱吗?。

sentences.english: If a person often have lies flow and mouth, thus to cajole others, over time, he would lose the trust of the people.
sentences.chinese: 一个人如果经常有谎言流与口中，从而去哄骗他人，久而久之，他便会失去人们的信任。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually persuade someone to do something by being nice to them, or making promises to them

sentences.english: The donkey brayed and tried to bolt.
sentences.chinese: 这头驴嘶叫着，企图挣脱缰绳。

detailed_translations.english: if a  donkey  brays, it makes a loud sound
the loud harsh sound uttered by a donkey

name: exhaust
trans: 使筋疲力尽，耗尽；抽完，汲干

sentences.english: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
sentences.chinese: 讲一整天课令我精疲力竭。

sentences.english: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
sentences.chinese: 我们面临世界石油储备耗尽的危险。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel extremely tired

sentences.english: soluble aspirin
sentences.chinese: 可溶性阿司匹林

detailed_translations.english: a soluble substance can be  dissolved  in a liquid

name: intriguing
trans: 迷人的， 有迷惑力的； 引起兴趣  的

sentences.english: The magazine carries an intriguing mixture of high fashion, gossip and racing.
sentences.chinese: 这本杂志内容丰富有趣，有关时尚、花边新闻和赛马的内容都有。

detailed_translations.english: something that is intriguing is very interesting because it is strange, mysterious, or unexpected

name: ostentatious
trans: 装饰表面的； 卖弄的

sentences.english: She carried her car keys on an ostentatious gold key ring.
sentences.chinese: 她把汽车钥匙挂在一个夸张的金钥匙圈上。

sentences.english: an ostentatious display of wealth
sentences.chinese: 张扬地炫耀财富

detailed_translations.chinese: 招摇的；卖弄的；夸耀的；铺张的；惹人注目的
detailed_translations.english: something that is ostentatious looks very expensive and is designed to make people think that its owner must be very rich

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

name: diversify
trans: 多样化， 使不同， 使变化

sentences.english: We need to diversify the economy.
sentences.chinese: 我们要使经济多元化。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使多样化，使变化；增加产品种类以扩大
detailed_translations.english: if a business, company, country etc diversifies, it increases the range of goods or services it produces

name: comely
trans: 清秀的， 标致的； 合适的

sentences.english: With his gentle eyes and comely smile, he still leaves a sense of fortitude for his delicate nose and thin lips.
sentences.chinese: 他目光柔和，笑容清秀，精致的鼻子和薄薄的嘴唇却给人一种坚毅的感觉。

sentences.english: Lin jiaxin belongs to temperament melting model belle bingle lets her look resemble a false boy complaisant straight hair can foil more those who give her is melting and comely!
sentences.chinese: 林嘉欣属于气质甜美型的美女，短发让她看上去像个假小子，柔顺的直发更能衬托出她的甜美清秀！

detailed_translations.english: a comely woman is attractive

name: inventive
trans: 善于创造的； 发明的

sentences.english: It inspired me to be more inventive with my own cooking.
sentences.chinese: 它激励我在自己烹饪时更具创造力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明的；有发明才能的；独出心裁的
detailed_translations.english: An inventive person is good at inventing things or has clever and original ideas

sentences.english: a hideous dress
sentences.chinese: 一条很难看的连衣裙

sentences.english: hideous crimes
sentences.chinese: 丑恶的罪行

sentences.english: Dinnertime that day was hideous.
sentences.chinese: 那天的晚餐很不愉快。

detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleasant or ugly

sentences.english: Martin showed me a graph of their recent sales.
sentences.chinese: 马丁给我看了他们最近销售情况的图表。

detailed_translations.english: a drawing that uses a line or lines to show how two or more sets of measurements are related to each other

sentences.english: They feasted well into the afternoon on mutton and corn stew.
sentences.chinese: 他们尽情享用玉米炖羊肉，一直吃到下午。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尽情地吃， 宴饮； 参加宴会
detailed_translations.english: If you feast on a particular food, you eat a large amount of it with great enjoyment
a large meal where a lot of people celebrate a special occasion

sentences.english: Both men imbibed considerable quantities of gin.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人都喝了大量的杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to drink something, especially alcohol – sometimes used humorously

sentences.english: Do you have any vertigo, dizziness etc?
sentences.chinese: 你有眩晕、头昏眼花等症状吗?。

sentences.english: The key to this photograph is the tilted horizon, which exaggerates the feeling of vertigo and adds to the sense of disorientation and suspension that the photo creates.
sentences.chinese: 这张照片的关键是倾斜的地平线，它夸大了人们晕头转向的感觉，并增加了迷失方向和由照片所创造的倒悬的意念。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of sickness and dizziness caused by looking down from a high place

sentences.english: a pretentious film
sentences.chinese: 矫饰的电影

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is pretentious, they try to seem more important, intelligent, or high class than they really are in order to be impressive

name: solvent
trans: 有溶解力的， 溶剂的； 有偿付能力的

sentences.english: They're going to have to show that the company is now solvent.
sentences.chinese: 他们将不得不证明公司现在是具备偿债能力的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有偿付能力的；有溶解力的
detailed_translations.english: having enough money to pay your debts
a chemical that is used to  dissolve  another substance

sentences.english: I did some work as a nude model when I was in college.
sentences.chinese: 我上大学的时候当过裸体模特。

sentences.english: Have you ever posed nude (= been photographed or painted while nude )?
sentences.chinese: 你拍过裸体照吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 裸的，裸体的；无装饰的；与生俱有的
detailed_translations.english: not wearing any clothes
a painting, statue etc of someone not wearing clothes

name: occasion
trans: 场合， 时节， 时刻； 时机， 机会

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

sentences.english: Republics will have voting rights proportionate to the size of their economies.
sentences.chinese: 各共和国将拥有与其经济规模成比例的选举权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成比例的；相称的；适当的
detailed_translations.english: Proportionate means the same as

name: virtual
trans: 虚拟的； 实际上的， 事实上的

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

sentences.english: I was determined when I retired that I wasn’t just going to vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我退休时便下定决心绝不让生活过得单调无聊。

detailed_translations.english: to live without doing much physical or mental activity and to feel bored as a result

name: arraign
trans: 提问； 传讯； 责难

sentences.english: He was arraigned for criminally abetting a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 他因非法怂恿一名叛国者而被传讯。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone come to court to hear what their crime is

sentences.english: Recent events have made his central theme even more apposite.
sentences.chinese: 近期发生的事件使他的主题思想显得更为恰当。

detailed_translations.english: suitable to what is happening or being discussed

sentences.english: They’ve been guzzling beer all evening.
sentences.chinese: 他们整个晚上都在狂饮啤酒。

detailed_translations.english: to eat or drink a lot of something, eagerly and quickly – usually showing disapproval

sentences.english: conjugal love
sentences.chinese: 夫妻之爱

detailed_translations.chinese: 婚姻的；结婚的；夫妻之间的
detailed_translations.english: relating to marriage

sentences.english: The key to success is the combination of transformation optics with another promising new field of science known as plasmonics.
sentences.chinese: 成功的关键是转变的光学与另一个有希望的表面电浆子场组合，被称为新的科学。

sentences.english: But it was, ironically, not until the invention of the laser in 1960 that understanding the quantum nature of optics became crucial.
sentences.chinese: 但是，具有讽刺意义的是，直到1960年激光发明后，认识光学的量子本质才变得至关重要。

sentences.english: One essential tool is adaptive optics technology, which, in effect, takes the twinkle out of the stars, thus providing sharper images from telescopes on the ground than would otherwise be possible.
sentences.chinese: 一个重要的工具就是自适应光学技术，实际上就是通过地面上的望远镜将恒星的闪耀去除，从而比采用其他方法能提供更为明显的图像。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of light and the way we see

sentences.english: He rushed out, hat awry.
sentences.chinese: 他歪戴着帽子冲了出去。

detailed_translations.english: not in the correct position

name: duration
trans: 持久； 期间； 持续时间

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

sentences.english: ...an old Roman aqueduct.
sentences.chinese: ...一条古罗马时代的高架渠。

detailed_translations.english: a structure like a bridge, that carries water across a river or valley

detailed_translations.chinese: 岁差（等于precession of the equinoxes）；先行；优先

name: frenzied
trans: 狂乱的， 激怒的， 疯狂似的

sentences.english: A woman was stabbed to death in a frenzied attack on her home tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚一名女子在家中遭遇疯狂袭击，被刺身亡。

sentences.english: frenzied efforts to find a solution
sentences.chinese: 寻求解决办法的疯狂努力

detailed_translations.english: frenzied activity is fast and uncontrolled, usually because it is done by someone feeling very anxious or excited

sentences.english: He was unbearably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 他的傲慢让人无法忍受。

sentences.english: an arrogant attitude
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的态度

detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people

sentences.english: There’s also the intrinsic pleasure you get from boosting your knowledge and becoming more erudite.
sentences.chinese: 这也有利于你发自内心地努力奋进获得更多学识变得更博学。

sentences.english: The supreme symbol for the author is the word; the erudite Hirst in The Voyage Out has the forename St John recalling the evangelist whose opening line was ‘In the beginning was the Word’.
sentences.chinese: 文字是作家最有力的表达符号，《远航》中博学的赫斯特的教名为圣·约翰，取自感召福音的传教士之名。 他在小说中的开场白为：“语言是世界的初始”。

detailed_translations.english: showing a lot of knowledge based on careful study

sentences.english: Smith denies using abusive language to the referee.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯否认辱骂裁判。

sentences.english: He became abusive and his wife was injured in the struggle.
sentences.chinese: 他动了粗，妻子在扭打中受伤。

detailed_translations.english: using cruel words or physical violence

name: undersell
trans: 以低于市价售出； 抛售

sentences.english: I think he undersold himself at the interview.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他在面试时过于自谦了。

detailed_translations.english: to sell goods at a lower price than someone else

sentences.english: We measured the length and width of the living room.
sentences.chinese: 我们量了客厅的长和宽。

sentences.english: You’ll need several pieces of string of different lengths.
sentences.chinese: 你需要几根长度不等的绳子。

sentences.english: a length of rope/pipe/wire etc
sentences.chinese: 一段绳子/管子/电线等

detailed_translations.english: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

sentences.english: Experts said the plans would likely end of the traditional "one size fits all" advert break.
sentences.chinese: 专家表示，该计划有望打破传统的“一刀切”式的广告播放模式。

sentences.english: For your viewing pleasure we have included a video clip of a Japanese advert for this abomination.
sentences.chinese: 我们剪辑了一段日本广告的视频让您在视觉上感受这份深恶痛绝。

sentences.english: This staggeringly offensive advert is attracting outrage on both the Chinese and wider web, with users blasting it for being racist.
sentences.chinese: 这则令人吃惊的攻击性广告，被认为带为严重的种族歧视，引起了国内外各大媒体的愤怒。

detailed_translations.english: to draw attention (to); refer (to)
an advertisement

name: schedule
trans: 目录， 一览表， 清单； 程序表， 计划表， 时间表， 课程表

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: insurgent
trans: 起义的； 暴动的； 叛乱的

sentences.english: There, she worked as a low-level intelligence analyst helping her unit assess insurgent activity in the area.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，她是一名初级情报分析员，工作内容是帮助所在部队评估该地区的叛乱活动。

sentences.english: But new reports show a sharp rise in insurgent attacks -- including a 55% increase in children being injured.
sentences.chinese: 但有新的报告显示，叛乱者发动的袭击数量大幅上升，儿童受伤人数也上升了55%。

detailed_translations.english: one of a group of people fighting against the government of their own country, or against authority

sentences.english: Achromatic: Without color. Black, white and gray are achromatic, but called colors by artist.
sentences.chinese: 无色：没有色彩。黑色，白色和灰色是无色的，但美术家却称之为颜色。

sentences.english: CCR : Short for Complementary Colour Removal. A method of achromatic separations by Hell Company.
sentences.chinese: 是英文字义“除去补色”的简称。是“海尔”公司所用的一种消色分色法。

detailed_translations.english: without colour

sentences.english: struggles between the different factions within the party
sentences.chinese: 党内的派系斗争

sentences.english: the leaders of the warring factions
sentences.chinese: 交战各派的领导人

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people within a larger group, who have different ideas from the other members, and who try to get their own ideas accepted

sentences.english: ...a long, hot and arduous trip.
sentences.chinese: …一段漫长、灼热、艰难的旅程。

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of strength and effort

name: overwhelming
trans: 势不可挡的， 压倒的

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

name: ludicrous
trans: 可笑的； 滑稽的； 愚蠢的

sentences.english: It is ludicrous to suggest that I was driving under the influence of alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 说我酒后驾车，这真是太荒唐了。

sentences.english: The court granted him the ludicrous sum of £100 in damages.
sentences.chinese: 法院裁定他获得区区100英镑损害赔偿。

sentences.english: That’s a ludicrous idea.
sentences.chinese: 这个想法很荒唐。

detailed_translations.english: completely unreasonable, stupid, or wrong

sentences.english: The judge said he had committed atrocious crimes against women.
sentences.chinese: 该法官称他对妇女犯下了残暴的罪行。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone's behaviour or their actions as atrocious, you mean that it is unacceptable because it is extremely violent or cruel

sentences.english: She appended a note at the end of the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她在信件尾部附加了一个说明。

detailed_translations.english: to add something to a piece of writing

detailed_translations.chinese: 设置数据文件的搜索路径

sentences.english: Let every declamation turn upon the beauty of liberty and virtue, and the deformity, turpitude, and malignity of slavery and vice.
sentences.chinese: 让每一篇演讲都来谈自由和道德之美，都来谈奴役和邪恶之丑陋、卑鄙和恶毒。

name: frigid
trans: 寒冷的； 冷淡的，  缺乏性感的

sentences.english: The guard looked at us with a frigid stare.
sentences.chinese: 守卫冷冷地盯着我们。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is frigid does not like having sex

name: invincible
trans: 不能征服的； 无敌的

sentences.english: an invincible army
sentences.chinese: 无敌的军队

sentences.english: Young athletes think of themselves as invincible.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的运动员自认为是战无不胜的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能征服的， 无敌的
detailed_translations.english: too strong to be destroyed or defeated

sentences.english: What Bracey is saying is tantamount to heresy.
sentences.chinese: 布里斯正在说的无异于异端邪说。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that one thing is tantamount to another, more serious thing, you are emphasizing how bad, unacceptable, or unfortunate the first thing is by comparing it to the second thing

sentences.english: You look absolutely exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 你看上去一副疲惫不堪的样子。

sentences.english: Don't exhaust him.
sentences.chinese: 别让他精疲力竭了。

detailed_translations.english: extremely tired

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽；用尽；使…精疲力尽（exhaust的过去式）
detailed_translations.english: If something exhausts you, it makes you so tired, either physically or mentally, that you have no energy left

sentences.english: Opponents of nuclear energy have deep misgivings about its safety.
sentences.chinese: 反核能人士非常担心核能的安全性。

sentences.english: She eyed the distant shoreline with misgiving.
sentences.chinese: 她担忧地望着远方的海岸线。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of doubt or fear about what might happen or about whether something is right

detailed_translations.chinese: 担忧；使…疑虑；害怕（misgive的ing形式）

sentences.english: They are often available at a discount.
sentences.chinese: 它们经常可以以折扣价买到。

sentences.english: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand.
sentences.chinese: 这已经迫使多家航空公司对机票大幅打折以刺激需求。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the usual price of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…打折扣； 不信； 漠视， 低估
detailed_translations.english: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price

name: verity
trans: 真实； 事实； 真理

sentences.english: the eternal verities of life
sentences.chinese: 生命的永恒真理

detailed_translations.english: an important principle or fact that is always true

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

sentences.english: I relish the challenge of doing jobs that others turn down.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢接受挑战做别人拒绝做的工作。

sentences.english: The three men ate with relish.
sentences.chinese: 那3个人吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen
Relish is also a noun
having cadence; rhythmic

sentences.english: the division sign (÷)
sentences.chinese: 除号

sentences.english: the Computer Services Division
sentences.chinese: 电脑维修部

detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out how many times one number is contained in another

sentences.english: Ecological discourse' can thus be seen as the most productive cultural form for generating and mobilising ideological consensus and dissentious in modern societies.
sentences.chinese: 生态学讨论可被视为最有效的文化形式，它产生和推动现代社会的思想共识和争论。

detailed_translations.english: argumentative

sentences.english: She balanced the cup on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子在膝盖上放稳。

detailed_translations.english: to put your body or sth else into a position where it is steady and does not fall
an instrument for weighing things, with two dishes that hang from a bar

sentences.english: He tried to obtain another material by distillation.
sentences.chinese: 他试图通过蒸馏法获得另一种物质。

sentences.chinese: 此外，传统的黑森林蛋糕中还会加入樱桃酒，这是一种清澈无色的水果白兰地，由欧洲酸樱桃经两次蒸馏后制成。

sentences.english: When carvone begins to distill, the condensation can be seen inside the thermometer adapter, thus the progress of carvone distillation can be readily monitored.
sentences.chinese: 当香芹酮开始蒸馏时，在温度计转接器内可看到有冷凝，因此能够容易地监察香芹酮的蒸馏过程。

sentences.english: It exasperates me to hear comments like that.
sentences.chinese: 听到那样的评论令我恼怒。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone very annoyed by continuing to do something that upsets them

sentences.english: And actually it damages the pancreas itself, after a while.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，一段时间之后它对胰腺本身也会产生伤害。

sentences.english: In people with diabetes, however, the pancreas either produces little or no insulin, or the cells do not respond appropriately to the insulin that is produced.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有糖尿病的人，胰腺要么生成一点或根本没有生成胰岛素，或者是细胞没有正确的反应胰腺分泌的胰岛素。

sentences.english: The scientists claim the rat stem cells grew in the niche left by the absent mouse pancreas and so almost any organ could be produced in this way.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们声称大鼠干细胞刚好在小白鼠缺失的胰腺所在位置生长，所以几乎任何器官都可以通过这种方法生成。

detailed_translations.english: a  gland  inside your body, near your stomach, that produces  insulin  and a liquid that helps your body to use the food that you eat

name: iconoclast
trans: 偶像破坏者； 攻击传统观念和习俗的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶像破坏者；提倡打破旧习的人

sentences.english: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
sentences.chinese: 他能模仿所有老师的口音。

sentences.english: ‘I’m so sorry,’ she mimicked.
sentences.chinese: “很抱歉。”她学着说道。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 效颦者，模仿者；仿制品；小丑

sentences.english: She crumpled up the page and pitched it into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她把那页纸揉成团，扔进了火里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投掷， 扔； 猛然倒下； (船、 飞机)颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 球场；程度，强度；高度，高音；沥青；顶点

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；投掷，扔；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调；架设，搭，营
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

name: feat
trans: 功绩， 伟业， 技艺， 壮举

sentences.english: A racing car is an extraordinary feat of engineering.
sentences.chinese: 赛车是工程学的一项非凡业绩。

detailed_translations.english: something that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength etc to do

sentences.english: The child’s incessant talking started to irritate her.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子喋喋不休，她开始烦躁起来。

sentences.english: incessant rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing without stopping

sentences.english: An inspection was carried out at the school.
sentences.chinese: 有人来学校视察了一遍。

sentences.english: However, on closer inspection, a number of problems emerged.
sentences.chinese: 然而，经进一步检查，很多问题冒了出来。

detailed_translations.english: an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

name: immaculate
trans: 纯洁无瑕的； 完美的

sentences.english: her immaculate stage performances
sentences.chinese: 她完美的舞台表演

detailed_translations.chinese: 完美的；洁净的；无瑕疵的
detailed_translations.english: exactly correct or perfect in every detail

sentences.english: his courage in the face of adversity
sentences.chinese: 他面对逆境的勇气

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you have a lot of problems that seem to be caused by bad luck

sentences.english: The government has said it was an inadvertent error.
sentences.chinese: 政府声称那是无意的过失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疏忽的；不注意的（副词inadvertently）；无意中做的
detailed_translations.english: An inadvertent action is one that you do without realizing what you are doing

sentences.english: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。

sentences.english: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
sentences.chinese: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

detailed_translations.english: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

name: pretension
trans: 借口； 要求， 主张； 自负， 骄傲

sentences.english: the humbleness and lack of pretension of Jordan’s cafe
sentences.chinese: 乔丹的咖啡馆的朴实和低调

detailed_translations.chinese: 自负；要求；主张；借口；骄傲

sentences.english: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

sentences.english: There was menace in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他的语气里带着威胁。

sentences.english: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有危险性的人(或物)；威胁，威吓
detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is dangerous
to threaten

sentences.english: If you can hear my benison.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能听见我的祝祷。

sentences.english: If you are admired by your success, my benison is warmly and hortative contemplation traversing congested crowd.
sentences.chinese: 假若你成功受景仰，那麽我的祝福就是穿越拥挤的人群给你温暖鼓历的注视；

sentences.english: If you are admired by your success, my benison is warmly and hortative contemplation traversing congested crowd.
sentences.chinese: 假若你成功受景仰，那么我的祝福就是穿越拥挤的人群给你温暖鼓历的注视；

detailed_translations.english: a blessing, esp a spoken one

sentences.english: John is the quintessence of good manners.
sentences.chinese: 约翰彬彬有礼，堪称典范。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精华；典范；第五元素（被视为地、水、火、风以外之构成宇宙的元素）
detailed_translations.english: a perfect example of something

name: plethora
trans: 过剩， 过多； 多血症

sentences.english: a plethora of suggestions
sentences.chinese: 一大堆建议

detailed_translations.chinese: 过多；过剩；[医] 多血症
detailed_translations.english: a very large number of something, usually more than you need

name: debunk
trans: 揭穿， 拆穿假面具， 暴露

sentences.english: Historian Michael Beschloss debunks a few myths.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家迈克尔·贝斯切罗斯揭露了一些神话的真相。

detailed_translations.english: If you debunk a widely held belief, you show that it is false. If you debunk something that is widely admired, you show that it is not as good as people think it is.

sentences.english: a view of green fields and rolling hills
sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.english: Fans cheered as the players took the field (= went onto the field ) .
sentences.chinese: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

name: virtuous
trans: 有道德的， 善良的， 正直的， 贞洁的

sentences.english: a virtuous man
sentences.chinese: 品行端正的男子

sentences.english: Sue considered herself very virtuous because she neither drank nor smoked.
sentences.chinese: 休认为自己品行非常端正，因为她既不喝酒也不抽烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 善良的；有道德的；贞洁的；正直的；有效力的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a very honest and moral way

name: invalid
trans: 有病的， 伤残的； 供病人用的； 无效的； 作废的； 无根据的， 站不住脚的
病人， 病弱者， 伤残人

sentences.english: Without the right date stamped on it, your ticket will be invalid.
sentences.chinese: 票上若没有加盖正确日期就是废票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的，作废的；无可靠根据的，站不住脚的
detailed_translations.english: a contract, ticket, claim etc that is invalid is not legally or officially acceptable
someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury

sentences.english: He left the room, returning after a short interval with a message.
sentences.chinese: 他离开房间，过了一会儿就带回来一条消息。

sentences.english: We can get some drinks in the interval.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在幕间休息时喝点什么。

sentences.english: Trees had been planted at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 树已按均距栽种。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time between two events, activities etc

name: legitimate
trans: 正当的， 合理的； 合法的

sentences.english: So all of this is a legitimate source of concern.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这些情况都是引发忧虑的合理根源。

sentences.english: Even though I had legitimate reasons ( bullshit ). You know I have to make them dividends ( bullshit ).
sentences.chinese: 即使我有合法的理由（胡说）。你知道我必须支付利息（胡说）。

sentences.english: Often, as in this case, there is no intentional hoaxing: It is a legitimate, straightforward photograph of something curious.
sentences.chinese: 就像此事一样，它们通常都是无意的闹剧：这是某些稀奇的东西合法的、易懂的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当的， 合理的； 合法的
detailed_translations.english: fair or reasonable

name: cosmopolitan
trans: 世界性的； 全球  的

sentences.english: a vibrant, cosmopolitan city
sentences.chinese: 一个充满活力的国际性都市

sentences.english: a lively hotel with a cosmopolitan atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 一家有着国际化氛围的、热闹的宾馆

detailed_translations.chinese: 世界性的；世界主义的，四海一家的
detailed_translations.english: a cosmopolitan place has people from many different parts of the world – use this to show approval

detailed_translations.chinese: 四海为家者；世界主义者；世界各地都有的东西

sentences.english: Poor mite! You must be starving!
sentences.chinese: 可怜的小家伙！你一定是饿坏了！

detailed_translations.chinese: 极小量；小虫；小孩儿；微小的东西
detailed_translations.english: a very small creature that lives in plants,  carpet s  etc

name: status
trans: 地位， 身份； 情形， 状况

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

sentences.english: He achieved some renown as a football player.
sentences.chinese: 作为足球运动员，他小有名气。

detailed_translations.english: when you are famous and a lot of people admire you for a special skill, achievement, or quality

sentences.english: He received a humiliating rebuff from his manager.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到经理的断然拒绝，十分丢脸。

sentences.english: His proposals have already been rebuffed by the governor.
sentences.chinese: 他的建议已被州长拒绝了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断然拒绝；回绝；漠不关心
detailed_translations.english: an unkind or unfriendly answer to a friendly suggestion or offer of help
If you rebuff someone or rebuff a suggestion that they make, you refuse to do what they suggest

sentences.english: She raised her hand in an imperious gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她傲慢地扬起手。

detailed_translations.english: giving orders and expecting to be obeyed, in a way that seems too proud

sentences.english: She's self-confidence, talking relaxable and make others relaxable and blithesome, let you know life is so lively.
sentences.chinese: 她很自信，说话很放松也让别人放松、愉快，让人觉得生活充满希望。

detailed_translations.english: cheery; merry

name: familiarity
trans: 亲密； 熟悉； 精通

sentences.english: I miss the familiarity of home.
sentences.chinese: 我怀念家的那种亲切感。

detailed_translations.english: a good knowledge of a particular subject or place

sentences.english: Dissemination, as of news; diffusion.
sentences.chinese: 散布，如消息的传开；扩散。

sentences.english: A diffusion method for the preparation of ferrous oxalate in a gel system was presented.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了一种在凝胶体系中用扩散法制备草酸亚铁的结晶方法。

sentences.english: The crack grouting diffusion radius is the basic gist of the grouting construction design and grouting craftwork control.
sentences.chinese: 灌浆扩散半径是进行灌浆结构设计和灌浆工艺流程控制的基本依据。

name: petrify
trans: 使石  化， 使僵硬； 使麻木

sentences.english: a sweeping curve of railroad track
sentences.chinese: 铁轨的大弧线

sentences.english: The car took the curve much too quickly.
sentences.chinese: 那辆汽车拐弯太快了。

sentences.english: The track curved round the side of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 小路弯弯曲曲，依山盘旋。

detailed_translations.english: a line that gradually bends like part of a circle
to bend or move in the shape of a curve, or to make something do this

sentences.english: extraneous noises
sentences.chinese: 外面传来的噪声

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的
detailed_translations.english: coming from outside

sentences.english: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
sentences.chinese: 她的发现已广为传播。

detailed_translations.english: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

sentences.english: A process that is used to liquefy nitrogen.
sentences.chinese: 用来使氮液化的过程。

sentences.english: You can liquefy the carbon dioxide to separate it from the other constituents.
sentences.chinese: 可以将二氧化碳液化，以便和其他成分分开。

sentences.english: The alternative is to liquefy the hydrogen at great expense and transport it in road tankers refrigerated with liquid nitrogen.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的代替方法是花大价钱用液氮作为冷却剂液化氢气，用罐车从公路上运输。

detailed_translations.english: to become liquid, or make something become liquid

name: abomination
trans: 憎恨， 厌恶； 可憎的事物

sentences.english: Slavery was an abomination.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶制令人深恶痛绝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌恶；憎恨；令人厌恶的事物
detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is extremely offensive or unacceptable

sentences.english: ...an attempt to get U.S. legislators to change the system.
sentences.chinese: …让美国立法者改变体制的一次努力。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has the power to make laws or belongs to an institution that makes laws

sentences.english: Thee direct address of an absent or imaginary person or of a personified abstraction, especially as a digression in the course of a speech or composition.
sentences.chinese: 呼语：直接称呼不在场或虚构的人物或称呼拟人的事物，尤指作为演讲或作文过程中的离题话。 。

sentences.english: In that speech in Alexandria, though, Nasser chose to delve back even further into history, in a long digression on the building of the Suez canal a century earlier.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在亚历山大港的那次演说，纳赛尔选择的是远远的向回探究历史，离题很远地谈到了早在一个世纪之前苏伊士运河的修建。

sentences.english: After this digression we return now to our original problem.
sentences.chinese: 在这一段插话以后，现在回到原来的问题。

name: herald
trans: 传达， 通告； 预示…的来临
传令官；使者，报信者；先驱，前锋

sentences.english: A flash of lightning heralded torrential rain.
sentences.chinese: 一道闪电预示着暴雨即将来临。

sentences.english: Flashing blue lights heralded the arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 闪烁的蓝色灯光预示警察就要到达。

sentences.english: I welcome the report as a herald of more freedom.
sentences.chinese: 我欢迎这份报告，认为它预示着更多的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to be a sign of something that is going to come or happen soon

detailed_translations.chinese: 信使； 预示， 预兆
detailed_translations.english: Something that is a herald of a future event or situation is a sign that it is going to happen or appear

name: recur
trans: 再发生， 重现； 重新提起

sentences.english: There is a danger that the disease may recur.
sentences.chinese: 这种病有复发的危险。

sentences.english: Love is a recurring theme in the book.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是这本书中反复出现的主题。

detailed_translations.chinese: (尤指不好的事)一再发生；重现
detailed_translations.english: if something, especially something bad or unpleasant, recurs, it happens again

name: coalition
trans: 合并， 接合； 联合

sentences.english: the centre-right coalition government
sentences.chinese: 政治上中间偏右的联合政府

sentences.english: an emergency meeting of the three coalition parties
sentences.chinese: 三个联盟政党召开的一次紧急会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合体， 同盟； 结合， 联合
detailed_translations.english: a union of two or more political parties that allows them to form a government or fight an election together

name: accumulate
trans: 积累， 堆积， 积蓄

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

sentences.english: An advanced onboard micro-computer ensures the exoskeleton moves in concert with the operator.
sentences.chinese: 一种最先进的机载微型电脑确保了外骨骼与操作器一致移动。

sentences.english: For example, scientists at Raytheon (RTN) have been working on an exoskeleton to give its user super strength like that of the Hulk.
sentences.chinese: 举个例子来说吧，雷声公司的研究人员开发一件外骨骼，可以使用户拥有绿巨人一样的强大力量。

sentences.english: He plans to add regenerative capabilities to the exoskeleton, so that it will require little or no power when moving on level ground.
sentences.chinese: 他计划要为外骨骼添加再生能源的能力，使得平地的运行能耗损很少能源或甚至不耗损能源。

detailed_translations.english: the hard parts on the outside of the body of creatures such as insects and crabs

name: pristine
trans: 纯洁的， 质朴的； 清新的； 原始的

sentences.english: a pristine white shirt
sentences.chinese: 非常干净的白衬衫

name: dwarf
trans: 矮小的， 发育不全的
使显得矮小，使相形见绌

sentences.english: The cathedral is dwarfed by the surrounding skyscrapers.
sentences.chinese: 周围的摩天大楼使得大教堂显得很矮小。

detailed_translations.english: to be so big that other things are made to seem very small
a person who is a dwarf has not continued to grow to the normal height because of a medical condition. Many people think that this use is offensive.
a dwarf plant or animal is much smaller than the usual size

sentences.english: All this, needless to say, had been culled second-hand from radio reports.
sentences.chinese: 不必说，这一切都是从无线电广播报道中搜集来的第二手信息。

sentences.english: In the reserves of Zimbabwe and South Africa, annual culls are already routine.
sentences.chinese: 在津巴布韦和南非的自然保护区，对病弱动物每年所进行的宰杀剔除已成惯例。

detailed_translations.english: If items or ideas are culled from a particular source or number of sources, they are taken and gathered together

detailed_translations.chinese: 剔出来杀掉的动物；拣出的等外品
detailed_translations.english: Cull is also a noun

name: leisure
trans: 空闲， 闲暇； 悠闲， 安逸

sentences.english: Most people now enjoy shorter working hours and more leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 现在大多数人都喜欢工作时间短些，闲暇时间多些。

sentences.english: Watching television is now the nation’s most popular leisure activity.
sentences.chinese: 看电视是当前国民最普遍的消遣活动。

sentences.english: The hotel offers various leisure facilities such as a swimming pool and sauna.
sentences.chinese: 酒店提供游泳池、桑拿浴室等各种休闲设施。

sentences.english: The leisure industry (= the business of providing leisure activities ) is now an important part of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 现在休闲娱乐行业是经济的一个重要组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: time when you are not working or studying and can relax and do things you enjoy

sentences.english: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
sentences.chinese: 他怒视着围住帐篷的那些人。

detailed_translations.english: to be all around someone or something on every side

sentences.english: Atthis juncture, I suggest we take a short break.
sentences.chinese: 此时此刻，我建议大家稍事休息。

sentences.english: The talks are at a critical juncture(= very important point ).
sentences.chinese: 会谈正处于紧急关头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关键时刻， 危急关头； 结合处， 接合点
detailed_translations.english: a particular point in an activity or period of time

sentences.english: In the alcoves on either side of the fire were bookshelves.
sentences.chinese: 凹室内炉火的两侧是书架。

detailed_translations.english: a place in the wall of a room that is built further back than the rest of the wall

sentences.english: All she did was hang around ogling the men in the factory.
sentences.chinese: 她就只会在工厂里四处乱逛，朝男人抛媚眼。

sentences.english: Paula is not used to everyone ogling at her while she undresses backstage.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉还不习惯在后台换衣服时所有人都色迷迷地盯着她看。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that one person is ogling another, you disapprove of them continually staring at that person in a way that indicates a strong sexual interest

sentences.english: Conclusions Thus, it is very necessary to improve mothers knowledge on serious symptom of ARI and CDD and family nursing through multiform health education.
sentences.chinese: 结论通过各种形式的健康教育来提高ARI、CDD重症识别知识及家庭护理知识知晓率是十分必要的。

detailed_translations.english: having many forms or kinds

name: assimilate
trans: 吸收；  消化；  同化

sentences.english: It will take time to assimilate all these facts.
sentences.chinese: 充分掌握所有这些情况需要时间。

detailed_translations.english: to completely understand and begin to use new ideas, information etc
if people assimilate, or are assimilated into a country or group, they become part of that group and are accepted by the people in that group

name: ethical
trans: 与伦理有关的； 道德的

sentences.english: The president must have the highest ethical standards.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须具备最高的道德水准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
detailed_translations.english: relating to principles of what is right and wrong

sentences.english: a zealous preacher
sentences.chinese: 热心的讲道者

sentences.english: zealous political activists
sentences.chinese: 积极的政治活动家

detailed_translations.english: someone who is zealous does or supports something with great energy

sentences.english: Stockman became one of the President’s most trenchant critics.
sentences.chinese: 斯托克曼成了总统最尖锐的批评者之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖刻的；锐利的；苛刻的；锋利的（名词trenchancy，副词trenchantly）
detailed_translations.english: expressed very strongly, effectively, and directly without worrying about offending people

sentences.english: They found him lying prostrate on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现他趴在地板上。

sentences.english: They prostrated themselves before their king.
sentences.chinese: 他们向他们的国王跪拜行礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 俯卧的；拜倒的；降伏的；沮丧的
detailed_translations.english: lying on your front with your face towards the ground
If you prostrate yourself, you lie down flat on the ground, on your front, usually to show respect for God or a person in authority

name: virtuoso
trans: 艺术大师； 音乐名手

sentences.english: violin virtuoso Vanessa Mae
sentences.chinese: 小提琴大师陈美

detailed_translations.chinese: 艺术品鉴赏家；古董收藏家；艺术大师
detailed_translations.english: someone who is a very skilful performer, especially in music

detailed_translations.chinese: 行家里手的；艺术爱好者的

name: glamorize
trans: 使有魔力； 使吸引人

sentences.english: TV has been accused of glamorizing crime.
sentences.chinese: 有人指责电视美化犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem more attractive than it really is

sentences.english: These refugees are very grateful to the government's succor.
sentences.chinese: 这些难民非常感激政府的救援。

sentences.english: It is a stated purpose of the U. N. to succor countries in distress.
sentences.chinese: 联合国有一条公开的宗旨，就是要援助陷于苦难的国家。

sentences.english: Objective: Methods are discussed to safeguard health of international medical-team member in succor.
sentences.chinese: 目的：探讨国际灾害医疗救援队员的健康保障方法。

name: comparable
trans: 可比较的， 比得上的

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

sentences.english: They were made welcome with the usual pantomime of exaggerated smiles and gestures.
sentences.chinese: 他们以那种具有夸张的微笑和动作的一般闹剧受到欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: a method of performing using only actions and not words, or a play performed using this method

name: discreet
trans: 言行谨慎的， 小心的， 慎重的， 审慎的

sentences.english: He assured her that he would be discreet.
sentences.chinese: 他向她保证会谨慎行事。

sentences.english: I stood back at a discreet distance.
sentences.chinese: 我谨慎地保持一段距离站在后面。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you say or do, so that you do not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell secrets

sentences.english: This beatitude is as vast as the Bible itself.
sentences.chinese: 这个祝福，如同圣经本身一样广阔。

sentences.english: This beatitude encompasses the whole message of the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 这个祝福，盖括了整本圣经的信息。

sentences.english: I think that if I were allowed to add one small beatitude as a footnote to the other it might be: Blessed are the courteous .
sentences.chinese: 我想如果允许我在《圣经》中用脚注加上一小句祝福的话，那么这句话就是：“礼貌者有福。”

detailed_translations.english: supreme blessedness or happiness

sentences.english: When the bomb exploded, there was bedlam.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹爆炸以后，现场一片混乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 混乱，骚乱；精神病院，疯人院
detailed_translations.english: a situation where there is a lot of noise and confusion

sentences.english: One cleric resigned over plans to evict the protesters forcibly, arguing that the Church should have been more supportive of their cause.
sentences.chinese: 一位因为计划强行驱逐示威者而辞职的神职人员辩解说国教会应当给予他们更多的支持。

sentences.english: It uses complex network analysis to identify where stealth attacks are taking place and provides the tools organisations need to evict the perpetrators and shore up the network against future threats.
sentences.chinese: 它使用复杂的网络分析，以确定哪些地方正在发生的隐蔽攻击，并提供必要的工具驱逐攻击者，支持网络抵御未来的威胁。

sentences.english: The family saw off attempts by Britain's Royal Navy to evict them and also an attempt in 1978 by a group of German and Dutch businessmen to seize Sealand by force.
sentences.chinese: 但英国海军却多次试图将贝茨家族从“海国”驱逐出去。 1978年，一群来自德国和荷兰的商人曾试图通过武力占领这块“领土”。

sentences.english: The war has affected the country’s economic sufficiency.
sentences.chinese: 战争已经影响到了这个国家的经济富足。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being or having enough

sentences.english: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
sentences.chinese: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

sentences.english: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way

sentences.english: a very stagy manner
sentences.chinese: 非常做作的举止

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is stagy is not natural and is like the way an actor behaves on a stage

sentences.english: Oil is a globally traded and fully fungible commodity making it difficult for a producer to reliably cut off a customer.
sentences.chinese: 石油是全球交易、并完全可替代的大宗商品，产油国很难有效孤立某一家顾客。

sentences.english: Where the depository keeps any other fungible item it may return any item of the same type quality and quantity in accordance with the contract.
sentences.chinese: 保管其他可替代物的，可以按照约定返还相同种类、品质、数量的物品。

sentences.english: Goods which are not fungible shall be deemed fungible for the purposes of this act to the extent that under a particular agreement or document unlike units are treated as equivalents.
sentences.chinese: 为本法的目的，并使在一项特定协议或档中的不相似单位也可被视为相等物，则非可替代货物应被视为可替代的。

sentences.english: a bilingual dictionary
sentences.chinese: 双语词典

sentences.english: The report proposed bilingual education in schools.
sentences.chinese: 报告建议在学校中实行双语教学。

detailed_translations.english: written or spoken in two languages

name: bipartisan
trans: 两党的， 两党成员的

sentences.english: a bipartisan committee
sentences.chinese: 一个由两党代表组成的委员会

detailed_translations.chinese: 两党连立的；代表两党的
detailed_translations.english: involving two political parties, especially parties with opposing views

name: intensive
trans: 加强的； 集中的； 深入细致的

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time
disapproval

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

sentences.english: a fraudulent insurance claim
sentences.chinese: 欺诈性保险索赔

sentences.english: a fraudulent statement
sentences.chinese: 骗人的声明

detailed_translations.english: intended to deceive people in an illegal way, in order to gain money, power etc

sentences.english: What are you trying to insinuate?
sentences.chinese: 你想暗示什么？

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入
detailed_translations.english: to say something which seems to mean something unpleasant without saying it openly, especially suggesting that someone is being dishonest

sentences.english: That is a fair approximation of the way in which the next boss is being chosen.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个挑选下任老板的大体近似方式。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 近似法；接近；[数] 近似值
detailed_translations.english: a number, amount etc that is not exact, but is almost correct

sentences.english: The accent falls on the third syllable.
sentences.chinese: 重音落在第三个音节上。

sentences.chinese: 本文结合人民监督员制度运行的实践，借鉴日本检察审查会制度的经验，就完善人民监督员制度提出构想。

to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

sentences.chinese: 我注意到现在的办公室都配备了工友，这使我们的年轻人不幸丢掉了这个有益的企业教育的一个内容。

sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上意见相左的两个人是乔治·瓦特和鲍勃·马尔。

sentences.chinese: 她的英语、法语和德语都很流利。

sentences.chinese: 运用公路测量学上的切线支距法对线形诱导标在山区高速公路的设置进行了探讨。

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

trans: 呼吁， 要求； 对…有吸引力； 申述， 上诉

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

sentences.chinese: 我整个晚上都在这条路后面的一个沼泽地旁听蛙鸣。

detailed_translations.english: If something swamps a place or object, it fills it with water

sentences.chinese: 他被传唤于第二天出庭，却逃跑了。

sentences.chinese: 这栋房子占地面积很大。

sentences.chinese: 杀虫剂的大量使用

detailed_translations.english: large in size, amount, or degree

sentences.chinese: 舞蹈员随着音乐的节奏疯狂地旋转起舞。

sentences.chinese: 我和奥玛是天作之合，这是命运的安排啊。

name: residential
trans: 住宅的， 适合居住的， 做住家用的

sentences.chinese: 安静的住宅区

sentences.chinese: 单调的饮食

sentences.english: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
sentences.chinese: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

sentences.chinese: 该公司正与海洋工程学院合建这座中心。
