trans: 使显得愚笨； 使变无效， 使成为徒劳

sentences.english: ...a uniformed guard stultified with boredom.
sentences.chinese: ...一名穿制服的闲得无聊的警卫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使变无效；使显得愚笨；使无价值

sentences.english: There's a certain mood of fatalism now among the radicals.
sentences.chinese: 现在极端分子中有种宿命论的情绪。

detailed_translations.english: the belief that there is nothing you can do to prevent events from happening

name: elicit
trans: 得出， 引出， 抽出， 引起

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: relegate
trans: 驱逐， 放逐； 丢弃； 委托； 移交

sentences.english: Might it not be better to relegate the king to a purely ceremonial function?
sentences.chinese: 使该国王降级到一种纯粹礼仪性的职能难道不更好吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 使降位， 使降级； 把…委托给
detailed_translations.english: if a sports team is relegated, it is moved into a lower  division

sentences.english: Despite my qualms, I took the job.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有些疑虑，我还是接受了那份工作。

sentences.english: The manager has no qualms about dropping players who do not perform well.
sentences.chinese: 对于放弃那些表现不好的队员，主教练并无不安。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of slight worry or doubt because you are not sure that what you are doing is right

name: trivial
trans: 琐碎的； 无足轻重的

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

sentences.english: ...a series of misadventures.
sentences.chinese: ...一连串的不幸事件。

detailed_translations.english: bad luck or an accident

name: longevity
trans: 长寿； 寿命； 耐久性

sentences.english: The ancient Chinese claimed that garlic promoted longevity.
sentences.chinese: 中国古人说蒜能延寿。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of time that someone or something lives

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

sentences.english: A little lizard scuttled across the path.
sentences.chinese: 一条小蜥蜴急急地从路上爬过。

detailed_translations.english: a container for carrying coal

sentences.english: A conscientious teacher may feel inclined to take work home.
sentences.chinese: 一个认真负责的教师可能会想着把工作带回家去做。

sentences.english: a conscientious and hard-working student
sentences.chinese: 勤勉刻苦的学生

detailed_translations.english: careful to do everything that it is your job or duty to do

sentences.english: I had to forgo lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我只得放弃午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or have something pleasant or enjoyable

sentences.english: Shake the rope and let the coils unwind.
sentences.chinese: 抖动绳索把绳圈展开。

sentences.english: a coil of wire
sentences.chinese: 一圈金属线

sentences.english: Mist coiled around the tops of the hills.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾盘绕着山巅。

detailed_translations.english: one ring of wire, rope etc in a continuous series
to wind or twist into a series of rings, or to make something do this

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

sentences.english: This is nothing new.We have never been good at foretelling the future, but when the news isfavorable, others forgive our lack of prescience.
sentences.chinese: 像以往一样，我们从来不擅长对未来的预测，但是当都是好消息的时候，别人总是原谅我们缺乏预知。

sentences.english: Muhammad also told his followers to pray facing Jerusalem. He said God, in his "prescience," chose "the children of Israel ... above all peoples.
sentences.chinese: 穆罕默德还告诉他的信徒要面向耶路撒冷祈祷，他在“预知”中称主选择“以色列的子民为万民之首。”

sentences.english: That lack of prescience is hurting.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏先见之明，带来的是伤害。

sentences.english: our venal politicians
sentences.chinese: 我们腐败的政客

detailed_translations.chinese: 贪污的；用金钱买得的；贿赂的；贪赃枉法的
detailed_translations.english: willing to use power and influence in a dishonest way in return for money

sentences.english: She declined the Republican Party's entreaties to run for his seat.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝了共和党让她竞选他的席位的数次恳求。

detailed_translations.english: a serious request in which you ask someone to do something for you

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: alacrity
trans: 敏捷， 轻快； 乐意， 欣然同意的表示

sentences.english: She accepted with alacrity.
sentences.chinese: 她欣然接受了。

detailed_translations.english: quickness and eagerness

sentences.english: This kind of plasticity may play a vital role in evolution as well as during the lifetime of individuals.
sentences.chinese: 这种可塑性不仅贯穿生命个体的一生，也许对进化也产生了至关重要的作用。

sentences.english: Whether we choose to do this or not is a matter of broader social and ethical debate over our growing ability to fiddle with the plasticity of the brain.
sentences.chinese: 我们选择这样做还是不这样做，是个更广泛的社会的和伦理的论辩，这一论辩涉及到我们日益增长的、改变大脑可塑性的能力。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being easily made into any shape, and of staying in that shape until someone changes it

name: anarchy
trans: 无政府状态； 政治混乱

sentences.english: The prison is close to anarchy.
sentences.chinese: 那所监狱几乎一片混乱。

sentences.english: The classroom was in a constant state of anarchy .
sentences.chinese: 教室里永远是一片混乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无政府状态；混乱；无秩序
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is no effective government in a country or no order in an organization or situation

name: carnage
trans: 残杀， 大屠杀； 流血

sentences.english: a scene of terrible carnage
sentences.chinese: 可怕的大屠杀场面

detailed_translations.english: when a lot of people are killed and injured, especially in a war

sentences.english: Stained glass windows, ceramic chimney and floral motifs adorn the house and make it an awe inspiring space for recluse.
sentences.chinese: 彩色玻璃窗户，陶瓷灯罩和花纹图案装饰的房子，让它对隐士来说成为一个令人敬畏的空间。

sentences.english: Nancy: Well, suit yourself. I don't recommend turning down too many invitations or you'll get a reputation for being a recluse.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，随你吧。我不建议你拒绝太多邀请，不然你会被别人当成一个隐居者（孤僻的人）

sentences.english: Terror of the lecher hope of the mad recluse: the sky! Black cover of the great cauldron in which boils vast imperceptible humanity.
sentences.chinese: 纵欲者的恐惧，疯隐士的希望：天空！那口大锅的黑色盖子锅中沸煮着无数渺小的人类。

detailed_translations.english: someone who chooses to live alone, and does not like seeing or talking to other people

sentences.english: Altus is equidistant from Ozark and Cotton Town.
sentences.chinese: 从阿尔特斯到奥沙克和到棉花镇的距离是相等的。

detailed_translations.english: at an equal distance from two places

sentences.english: a man with no moral scruples
sentences.chinese: 一个道德上无所顾忌的男人

detailed_translations.english: a belief about what is right and wrong that prevents you from doing bad things

sentences.english: "It will only be a good idea to know your APOE genotype when there's something we can do about it, " she says.
sentences.chinese: “只有当我们可以做出改变的时候，知道你的载脂蛋白E基因才 会是一件好事”，她说。

sentences.english: A common problem in studies attempting to relate genetics with a particular behavior is that a particular genotype might only confer a very small risk.
sentences.chinese: 在试图将遗传学与特定行为联系起来的研究中，一般的问题是一个特定的基因型可能只造成一丁点风险。

sentences.english: The software analyzes the person’s HIV genotype and his or her current health characteristics against an evolving database of treatment outcomes for more than 33,000 patients and 98,000 therapies.
sentences.chinese: 该软件能够针对超过98 000病人和 33 000治疗不断变化的治疗结果的数据库，以及他或她目前的健康规格参数，分析人的艾滋病毒基因型。

detailed_translations.english: the  genetic  nature of one type of living thing

sentences.english: When I speak to my archbishop in San Francisco and his role is to try to change my mind on the subject, well then he is exercising his pastoral duty to me as one of his flock.
sentences.chinese: 我在旧金山和我的大主教谈话时，他的任务是努力改变我在那个主题上的看法，那时，他是把我当作他的一只羔羊在实践其牧师的职责。

sentences.english: Only once, and then obliquely, were the uncounted mass of Iraqi dead referred to, when the archbishop prayed for "those whose memory we cherish, and those whose names we will never know".
sentences.chinese: 大主教只有一次、而且是拐弯抹角地提到了不可胜数的死去的伊拉克人，他为“那些受我们怀念的人，以及那些我们永远都不知道名字的人”做了祈祷。

detailed_translations.english: a priest of the highest rank, who is in charge of all the churches in a particular area

name: obscure
trans: 暗的，朦胧的；模糊的，晦涩的

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: trove
trans: 被发现的东西， 收藏的东西

sentences.english: But at the stern of the ship, divers found a trove of gold and silver and high-grade ceramics whose significance is more mysterious.
sentences.chinese: 但是潜水人员在船尾部发现了一个由金、银以及高级陶瓷打造的收藏品，这件收藏品的意义更加神秘。

detailed_translations.chinese: 被发现的东西；收藏的东西

sentences.english: noxious fumes
sentences.chinese: 有毒烟雾

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的；有毒的；败坏道德的；讨厌的
detailed_translations.english: harmful or poisonous

sentences.english: I'll bolster you up.
sentences.chinese: 我支持你。

sentences.english: More timbers are needed to bolster the roof of the mine.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的木材支撑矿顶。

sentences.english: If you have a bolster or several pillows, place your lower back onto the support.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一个支撑或者一些枕头，将你的下半身靠在这些支撑上。

detailed_translations.english: a long firm  pillow  , usually shaped like a tube

name: omnipresent
trans: 无所不在的， 普遍存在的

sentences.english: The sound of sirens was an omnipresent background noise in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约，警报声是无处不在的背景噪音。

detailed_translations.english: present everywhere at all times

sentences.english: He had been deceived by a young man claiming to be the son of a millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 他被一个自称是百万富翁之子的年轻人骗了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone believe something that is not true
to make someone believe something that is not true

name: ingenious
trans: 机灵的； 有独创性的； 心灵手巧的

sentences.english: an ingenious device
sentences.chinese: 精巧的装置

sentences.english: an ingenious cook
sentences.chinese: 心灵手巧的厨师

detailed_translations.english: (of an object, a plan, an idea, etc.) very suitable for a particular purpose and resulting from clever new ideas

sentences.english: the effects of the war on the local populace
sentences.chinese: 战争对当地百姓的影响

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in a country

sentences.english: amphibious creatures
sentences.chinese: 两栖生物

detailed_translations.chinese: [生物] 两栖的，水陆两用的；具有双重性的
detailed_translations.english: able to live both on land and in water

name: imprint
trans: 印记； 深刻的印象； 持久的特征、 标志

sentences.english: She could see the imprint of her fingers on his pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她可以看到自己的手指在他苍白的脸上留下的印痕。

sentences.english: As I arrived, the shimmering skyline of domes and minarets was imprinted on my memory.
sentences.chinese: 当我到达时，穹顶和尖塔形成的泛着微光的空中轮廓线铭刻在我的记忆中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 印记；痕迹；特征；版本说明
detailed_translations.english: the mark left by an object being pressed into or onto something
When something is imprinted on your memory, it is firmly fixed in your memory so that you will not forget it

sentences.english: Ellis Island has become one of America's most popular tourist destinations.
sentences.chinese: 埃利斯岛已经成为美国最受欢迎的游览地之一。

detailed_translations.english: the place that someone or something is going to

name: privacy
trans: 隐居； 私事， 隐私

sentences.english: each individual’s right to privacy
sentences.chinese: 每个人的隐私权

detailed_translations.english: the state of being free from public attention

sentences.english: He spoke of the necessity for a reciprocal relationship that would be useful for all sides.
sentences.chinese: 他谈及需要建立对各方都有益的互惠关系。

sentences.english: Such treaties provide reciprocal rights and obligations.
sentences.chinese: 此类协议规定了相互之间的权利与义务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 互惠的；相互的；倒数的，彼此相反的
detailed_translations.english: a reciprocal arrangement or relationship is one in which two people or groups do or give the same things to each other

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 倒数；互相起作用的事物

sentences.english: a vertical line
sentences.chinese: 垂直线

sentences.english: the vertical axis of a graph
sentences.chinese: 图的纵轴

sentences.english: vertical window blinds
sentences.chinese: 垂直百叶窗

sentences.english: The wall is several degrees off the vertical.
sentences.chinese: 这堵墙倾斜了有好几度。

detailed_translations.english: pointing up in a line that forms an angle of 90˚ with a flat surface
a vertical line or position

sentences.english: He picked up the phone expecting to hear the chairman's gruff voice.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起电话等着听主席那粗哑的声音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗暴的；粗哑的；脾气坏的
detailed_translations.english: A gruff voice sounds low and rough

sentences.english: an education system that perpetuates the divisions in our society
sentences.chinese: 使我们的社会持续分化的一种教育制度

sentences.english: A wild game bird, such as a duck, goose, or quail .
sentences.chinese: 野禽，猎鸟一种野生的猎鸟，如野鸭、野鹅或鹌鹑。

sentences.english: The next horizon: GM pigs, ducks, turkeys and quail.
sentences.chinese: 下个目标：转基因猪、鸭子、火鸡和鹌鹑。

sentences.english: Objective: To establish hyperuricemia model of female quail, and to study its pathological feature.
sentences.chinese: 目的：建立雌性鹌鹑高尿酸血症模型并探讨其病理特征。

detailed_translations.english: a small fat bird with a short tail that is hunted for food or sport, or the meat from this bird

sentences.english: ...the processes of diffusion and osmosis.
sentences.chinese: ...扩散与渗透过程。

detailed_translations.chinese: [物] 渗透；[物] 渗透性；渗透作用
detailed_translations.english: the gradual process of liquid passing through a membrane

name: cringe
trans: 畏缩； 阿谀， 奉承

sentences.english: A stray dog was cringing by the door.
sentences.chinese: 一条流浪狗畏缩在门旁。

sentences.english: She cringed away from him.
sentences.chinese: 她退缩着躲开他。

detailed_translations.english: to move away from someone or something because you are afraid

name: puerile
trans: 不成熟的； 孩子气的， 幼稚的

sentences.english: a puerile joke
sentences.chinese: 幼稚的玩笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 幼稚的；孩子气的；未成熟的；天真的
detailed_translations.english: silly and stupid

name: gap
trans: 间隙， 缺口； 隔阂； 不足， 空白

sentences.english: ...the gap between rich and poor.
sentences.chinese: …贫富差距。

detailed_translations.english: a big difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc

name: neology
trans: 新词的使用， 旧词新义

sentences.english: hydrogen gas
sentences.chinese: 氢气

sentences.english: Can you light the gas for me?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我点燃煤气好吗？

sentences.english: I probably spend over 200 a month on gas.
sentences.chinese: 我一个月大概要花200多美元汽油钱。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as air, which is not solid or liquid, and usually cannot be seen

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

sentences.english: I wonder if this letter is overweight.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道这封信是否超重。

sentences.english: If your luggage is overweight, you'll have to pay extra.
sentences.chinese: 假如你的行李过重了， 你得付额外的运费。

sentences.english: Why are so many of us overweight?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我们中的许多人会超重？

sentences.english: They were dragged from their homes, shrieking and weeping.
sentences.chinese: 他们哭喊着被人从家里拖出去。

sentences.english: He shrieked in agony.
sentences.chinese: 他痛苦地尖叫起来。

detailed_translations.english: to make a very high loud sound, especially because you are afraid, angry, excited, or in pain
a loud high sound made because you are frightened, excited, angry etc

sentences.english: a slight improvement
sentences.chinese: 些许的改进

sentences.english: a slight increase
sentences.chinese: 少许的增加

sentences.english: a slight change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的略微变动

sentences.english: a slight pause
sentences.chinese: 稍稍的停顿

sentences.english: a slight problem
sentences.chinese: 小问题

detailed_translations.english: small in degree
to offend someone by treating them rudely or without respect

name: tumultuous
trans: 喧嚣的， 动乱的； 激动的

sentences.english: the tumultuous years of the Civil War
sentences.chinese: 内战的动荡年代

detailed_translations.english: full of activity, confusion, or violence

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: effeminate
trans: 柔弱的； 女人气的， 娇气的

sentences.english: ...a skinny, effeminate guy in lipstick and earrings.
sentences.chinese: ...一个抹口红、戴耳环，骨瘦如柴的娘娘腔男人。

detailed_translations.english: a man who is effeminate looks or behaves like a woman

detailed_translations.chinese: 使柔弱；使无男子汉气概
变得无男子汉气概；变得柔弱

name: zenith
trans: 天顶； 最高点； 顶点

sentences.english: Obama will be the zenith of black America for as long as he lives.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马毕其一生都将成为美国黑人运动成就的顶点。

detailed_translations.english: the most successful point in the development of something

name: arcade
trans: 【建】 拱廊， 有拱廊的街道

sentences.english: The short, squat man in the Dallas Cowboys windbreaker staggers out from the arcade, propping himself against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 身穿达拉斯牛仔风衣的矮胖男人蹒跚的从拱廊走出来，支撑着自己靠在墙上。

sentences.english: No matter how much you think you know about the varied and nuanced spectrum of human sexuality, you realize you don’t know squat until you work in a porn store with a vibrant and active arcade.
sentences.chinese: 无论你认为自己是多么了解人类性行为的多样性和各种细微差别，如果没在色情商店工作过，没见识过店中那条活力四射的拱廊，就不知道半蹲是什么含义。

detailed_translations.english: a covered passage at the side of a row of buildings with  pillar s  and  arch es  supporting it on one side
a speech in a play in which a character, usually alone on the stage, talks to himself or herself so that the  audience  knows their thoughts

sentences.english: This is something I learned as an anthropologist –people love to tell their stories.
sentences.chinese: 这是我作为一名人类学家所理解的----人们喜欢讲述自己的故事。

sentences.english: Fisher, a biological anthropologist, says she wrote her latest book because she wanted to uncover the science behind “why you love who you love and perhaps even help people find the one”.
sentences.chinese: 费舍尔，生物人类学家，说她的最新著作的出发点是缘于她想揭开“为什么你会爱上你的爱人，这也许会帮助人们找到爱人”背后的科学依据。

sentences.english: A data manager, media coordinator, and medical anthropologist will also be arriving over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 一名数据管理员、媒体协调员和医学人类学家也将于周末抵达。

sentences.english: The service pedigree helps to determine the importance of the service in context of all the services provided.
sentences.chinese: 服务家谱可帮助确定服务在所提供的所有服务的上下文中的重要性。

sentences.english: This chart, also known as a pedigree, lists members of each generation of your biological family, with all available health and disease information.
sentences.chinese: 这份家谱关系图会列举出你这个家庭每一代所拥有成员，并附加有成员所有已知的健康和疾病信息。

detailed_translations.english: the parents and other past family members of an animal or person, or an official written record of this
a pedigree animal comes from a family that has been recorded for a long time and is considered to be of a very good  breed

name: ceremonious
trans: 讲究仪式的； 正式的， 隆重的

sentences.english: Putting on a hat can be a ceremonious act, an elegant gesture in the ritual of dressing.
sentences.chinese: 戴帽子被看作一种礼节性的举动， 是着装仪式上一个优雅的举动。

sentences.english: When their bodies arrived in Shanghai, all walks of life in Shanghai held ceremonious funeral service for them.
sentences.chinese: 其灵榇抵达上海后，上海社会各界为之举行了隆重的祭奠活动。

sentences.english: The Spring Festival is the most ceremonious traditional festival, we the Chinese nation is the most festive atmosphere all holidays a festival.
sentences.chinese: 春节是我们中华民族最隆重的传统节日，是所有的节日中最有节日氛围的一个节日。

detailed_translations.english: done in a formal serious way, as if you were in a ceremony

sentences.english: He felt utterly daunted by the prospect of moving to another country.
sentences.chinese: 他一想到要移居别的国家就感到十分害怕。

sentences.english: Don’t be daunted by all the technology.
sentences.chinese: 不要被所有这些技术给吓住。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid or less confident about something

sentences.english: Her pleasant manner belied her true character.
sentences.chinese: 她讨人喜欢的举止掩饰了她真实的个性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩饰；与…不符；使失望；证明…虚假错误
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a false idea about something

name: superior
trans: 优良的，卓越的；较…多的，优于…

sentences.english: She had that superior tone of voice.
sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上级的，较高的；优越的；有优越感的，高傲的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job

name: premature
trans: 未成熟的， 太早的， 早熟的

sentences.english: his premature death due to cancer
sentences.chinese: 他因癌症而早逝

sentences.english: premature ageing of the skin
sentences.chinese: 皮肤的早衰

detailed_translations.chinese: 比预期时间早的； 不成熟的， 仓促的
detailed_translations.english: happening before the natural or proper time

sentences.english: The offender must make restitution for the hurt that he or she has caused.
sentences.chinese: 违法者必须为其所造成的伤害作出赔偿。

detailed_translations.english: the act of giving back something that was lost or stolen to its owner, or of paying for damage

sentences.english: the risks of promiscuous sexual behaviour
sentences.chinese: 不检点性行为的危险

detailed_translations.english: having many sexual partners

sentences.english: The boy sings bass in the choir.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩在合唱团里唱男低音。

sentences.english: You joined the choir, but you don't even like singing. What is your design anyway?
sentences.chinese: 你根本不喜欢唱歌，但是你还是加入了唱诗班。到底你想干什么？

sentences.english: In a window across the street, a boy plays the flute, echoing the choir's songs.
sentences.chinese: 在街对面的一扇窗户里，一位少年吹着长笛，附和着唱诗班的歌声。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who sing together for other people to listen to

name: subsidize
trans: 给补助金 / 津贴 / 奖金

sentences.english: Farming is heavily subsidized (= subsidized a lot ) by the government.
sentences.chinese: 农业得到政府的大量补贴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 资助；给与奖助金；向…行贿
detailed_translations.english: if a government or organization subsidizes a company, activity etc, it pays part of its costs

name: variegated
trans: 杂色的， 斑驳的； 多样化的

sentences.english: variegated grasses
sentences.chinese: 杂色的草

detailed_translations.chinese: 杂色的；斑驳的；富于变化的
detailed_translations.english: a variegated plant, leaf etc has different coloured marks on it

sentences.english: a truculent attitude
sentences.chinese: 凶狠的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 好斗的；野蛮的；言词刻毒的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone is truculent, you mean that they are bad-tempered and aggressive

sentences.english: an accessory to murder
sentences.chinese: 谋杀案的帮凶

sentences.english: the accessory muscles of respiration
sentences.chinese: 副呼吸肌

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
not the most important when compared to others

sentences.english: Some biologists, along with Plato, define hominid as “featherless biped.”
sentences.chinese: 有些生物学家，作为柏拉图的跟随者，定义原始人类为“没有羽毛的两足动物” 。

sentences.english: "It is still difficult for a biped robot to walk on a bumpy surface, even on Earth," the official said.
sentences.chinese: 这位官员说，“即使是在地球上，两足机器人在颠簸的路面行走仍然有困难。”

sentences.english: Whether it's through the forest or across the savanna, it doesn't matter — you're a biped when you're moving, " Jungers says.
sentences.chinese: 无论是穿过森林或是走过热带稀树草原都没关系，当你运动时，你就是一只两足动物，”容格斯说。

detailed_translations.english: an animal with two legs, such as a human

sentences.english: He was about to make a sharp retort .
sentences.chinese: 他正要尖刻地反驳。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry or humorous reply
to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

sentences.english: television antennas
sentences.chinese: 电视机天线

detailed_translations.chinese: [电讯] 天线；[动] 触角，[昆] 触须
detailed_translations.english: one of two long thin parts on an insect’s head, that it uses to feel things

sentences.english: They arehearersof their Origin, but not servants of machination.
sentences.chinese: 人是自身本源的倾听者，然而并非是诡计者的仆人。

sentences.english: This is all a machination!
sentences.chinese: 这一切全都是阴谋！

sentences.english: ...the forest ecosystem.
sentences.chinese: …森林生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals and plants in a particular area, and the way in which they are related to each other and to their environment

sentences.english: a Shakespeare seminar
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚研讨班

detailed_translations.english: a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject

sentences.english: That is because Hamas is a terrorist organisation. Its founding charter claims the Holy Land exclusively for Islam and calls for the complete annihilation of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为哈马斯是一个恐怖组织，它的成立宪章中宣称加沙是伊斯兰独一无二的圣地，号召完全消灭以色列。

name: tempestuous
trans: 有暴风雨的； 暴乱的

sentences.english: For years, the couple's tempestuous relationship made the headlines.
sentences.chinese: 多年来这对夫妻间紧张起伏的关系总是登上报纸头条。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有暴风雨的；暴乱的；剧烈的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a relationship or a situation as tempestuous, you mean that very strong and intense emotions, especially anger, are involved

sentences.english: His respiration grew fainter throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 一天当中，他的呼吸越来越微弱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 呼吸作用；一次呼吸；植物光合作用
detailed_translations.english: the process of breathing

sentences.english: He became a brigadier general before leaving the military in 1966.
sentences.chinese: 他的军人生涯升至准将，随后在1966年退伍。

sentences.english: It says three army officers, including a brigadier-general, were ambushed and killed on Sunday by armed criminal gangs who then mutilated the bodies with sharp tools.
sentences.chinese: 据称，周日，武装犯罪团伙伏击了包括一名准将在内的三名陆军军官，并使用利器将他们的尸体砍断。

detailed_translations.english: a high military rank in the British army, or the person who has this rank

sentences.english: zany comedian Vic Reeves
sentences.chinese: 搞怪喜剧演员维克·里夫斯

detailed_translations.english: crazy or unusual in a way that is amusing

name: repository
trans: 仓库； 学识渊博的人

detailed_translations.chinese: 贮藏室，仓库；知识库；智囊团
detailed_translations.english: a place or container in which large quantities of something are stored

sentences.english: Some claim that the herb has therapeutic value for treating pain.
sentences.chinese: 有些人称这种草药具有止痛的疗效。

detailed_translations.chinese: 治疗的；治疗学的；有益于健康的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the treatment or cure of an illness

sentences.english: I know you, you scoundrel! I have heard of you before. You are Holmes, the meddler.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你，这个恶棍。我以前听过你。你是福尔摩斯，爱管闲事的人。

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems
to make someone who is climbing a mountain etc safe by attaching a rope to them and to a rock

sentences.english: He was behaving like a character in a Victorian melodrama.
sentences.chinese: 他表现得就像维多利亚时代情节剧里的角色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 情节剧；音乐剧；耸人听闻的事件，闹剧
detailed_translations.english: a story or play in which very exciting or terrible things happen, and in which the characters and the emotions they show seem too strong to be real

name: vegetative
trans: 有关植物生长的， 植物的

sentences.english: She was in what was described as a vegetative state.
sentences.chinese: 她处于一种被称为植物人的状态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 植物的；植物人状态的，无所作为的；促使植物生长的；有生长力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to plants, and particularly to the way they grow or make new plants

sentences.english: The November air stung my cheeks, a harbinger of winter.
sentences.chinese: 11月的空气刺痛了我的脸颊，这是冬天要来的先兆。

detailed_translations.english: a sign that something is going to happen soon

sentences.english: dilute hydrochloric acid
sentences.chinese: 稀盐酸

detailed_translations.english: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

sentences.english: The colorless protein aggregation was obtained from pig plasma using coagulant.
sentences.chinese: 使用凝聚剂从猪血浆蛋白质中获得无色蛋白胶。

sentences.english: For further research, the effects of other pollutants in real dyeing wastewater and the practical operation conditions on coagulation should be studied for modification of composite coagulant.
sentences.chinese: 应进一步针对实际印染废水，考察其他污染物以及实际操作条件对混凝效果的影响，以优化改良复合混凝剂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that aids or produces coagulation

sentences.english: And you can be sure that when the referee cheats our boys, I'll be ready to lambaste him.
sentences.chinese: 而且你可以放心，如果裁判对孩子们不公平，我会公开斥责他。

detailed_translations.english: If you lambaste someone, you criticize them severely, usually in public

name: ominous
trans: 预兆的； 不祥的， 不吉的

sentences.english: ‘How long will she be ill?’ he asked. There was an ominous silence.
sentences.chinese: “她的病多久会好？”他问。大家的沉默让人感觉不妙。

sentences.english: The car is making an ominous rattling sound.
sentences.chinese: 汽车在发出一种不妙的咔嗒声。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel that something bad is going to happen

sentences.english: We have total confidence in the veracity of our research.
sentences.chinese: 对我们研究的真实性，我们有绝对的信心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诚实；精确性；老实；说真实话
detailed_translations.english: the fact of being true or correct

name: contract
trans: 缩小， 缩短； 订 ； 感染

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: sluggish
trans: 懒散的； 反应迟钝的

sentences.english: Alex woke late, feeling tired and sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯醒得很晚，感到很倦怠。

sentences.english: Economic recovery has so far been sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的速度目前仍然缓慢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 萧条的；迟钝的；行动迟缓的；懒惰的
detailed_translations.english: moving or reacting more slowly than normal

name: misfortune
trans: 不幸； 灾祸， 灾难

sentences.english: It seems the banks always profit from farmers’ misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 银行似乎总是从农民的不幸中获益。

detailed_translations.english: very bad luck, or something that happens to you as a result of bad luck

sentences.english: In the end, there might be some signs that boorish boys know they're overreaching — and that may be expressed in the level of their braggadocio.
sentences.chinese: 最后，也许有一些粗俗的男人发现自己过了头的迹象——这表现在他们吹牛的程度中。 。

detailed_translations.english: proud talk about something that you claim to own, to have done etc

name: susceptible
trans: 敏感的， 易受感动的， 易受影响的， 易感染的； 可被…的， 可能…的

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

sentences.english: They befriended me when I first arrived in London as a student.
sentences.chinese: 我初到伦敦求学时，他们待我如同朋友。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a friendly way towards someone, especially someone who is younger or needs help

name: countermand
trans: 取消， 撤消； 下反对命令召回

sentences.english: Please countermand our order for same.
sentences.chinese: 对上述订单，请取消。

sentences.english: I can't countermand an order Winger's given.
sentences.chinese: 我无法撤销温格下达的命令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取消，撤消；下反对命令召回
detailed_translations.english: If you countermand an order, you cancel it, usually by giving a different order

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

sentences.english: ...a society which was politically quiescent and above all deferential.
sentences.chinese: ...一个遵循顺从至上及政治上平静的社会。

detailed_translations.chinese: 静止的；不活动的；沉寂的
detailed_translations.english: not developing or doing anything, especially when this is only a temporary state

name: exact
trans: 强求； 急需， 要求

sentences.english: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

sentences.english: What were his exact words?
sentences.chinese: 他的原话是什么？

sentences.english: The timing had to be exact.
sentences.chinese: 对时机的把握必须精确。

sentences.english: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

detailed_translations.english: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

sentences.english: I felt a current of cool air.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉到了一阵凉风。

sentences.english: The water was slightly cooler than a child's bath.
sentences.chinese: 这水比小孩子的洗澡水稍微凉一点。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is cool has a temperature which is low but not very low

name: resourceful
trans: 资源丰富的； 机智的， 多策略的

sentences.english: a woman who is energetic and resourceful
sentences.chinese: 精力充沛且足智多谋的女人

detailed_translations.english: good at finding ways of dealing with practical problems

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: premonition
trans: 预先的警告； 预感， 前兆

sentences.english: He had an unshakable premonition that he would die.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种强烈的预感：他就要死了。

detailed_translations.english: a strange feeling that something, especially something bad, is going to happen

name: cerebral
trans: 脑的， 大脑的； 理智的

sentences.english: a cerebral haemorrhage
sentences.chinese: 脑出[溢]血

detailed_translations.english: relating to or affecting your brain

name: gambol
trans: 欢跳， 雀跃， 嬉戏

sentences.english: ...the sight of newborn lambs gambolling in the fields.
sentences.chinese: …初生羊羔在牧场上跳跃的景象。

detailed_translations.english: If animals or people gambol, they run or jump about in a playful way

sentences.english: Her creativity had been squelched.
sentences.chinese: 她的创造力受到了压制。

detailed_translations.chinese: 消除；镇压；压碎；使…咯吱咯吱的响
detailed_translations.english: to stop something from continuing to develop or spread

detailed_translations.chinese: 噪声控制；嘎吱声；压倒对方的反驳；压碎的一堆

sentences.english: The light of the setting sun suffused the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 落日的霞光映红了云层。

sentences.english: Hot colour suffused her cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸涨得又红又烫。

detailed_translations.english: if warmth, colour, liquid etc suffuses something or someone, it covers or spreads through them

name: caprice
trans: 反复无常； 任性； 怪念头

sentences.english: the caprices of a spoilt child
sentences.chinese: 一个被宠坏的孩子的任性行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 奇思怪想， 反复无常， 任性
detailed_translations.english: a sudden and unreasonable change of mind or behaviour

sentences.english: From that time onwards he continued his life as a vagabond mainly as what he himself calls a ‘soldier of fortune’.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，他继续着流浪的生活，正如他自己对自己所称呼的那样“命运战士”。

sentences.english: They had to live a kind of bohemian life, the life of a vagabond; that was the only possibility for them to be creative.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须去过一种波西米亚式的生活方式，一种流浪汉的生活方式，那是他们获得创造性的唯一可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 流浪的；流浪者的；浪荡的；漂泊的

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no home and travels from place to place

sentences.english: the debacle of the 1994 elections
sentences.chinese: 1994年大选的惨败

detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that is a complete failure

sentences.english: ...his research in electricity and magnetism.
sentences.chinese: …他在电、磁领域的研究。

sentences.english: his personal magnetism
sentences.chinese: 他的个人魅力

detailed_translations.english: the physical force that makes two metal objects pull towards each other or push each other apart

sentences.english: He accused me of slandering him and trying to undermine his position.
sentences.chinese: 他指控我诽谤他并想削弱他的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to say false things about someone in order to damage other people’s good opinion of them
a false spoken statement about someone, intended to damage the good opinion that people have of that person

name: sedentary
trans: 久坐不动的； 定居一处的

sentences.english: a sedentary people living north of the Danube
sentences.chinese: 多瑙河北面的一个定居民族

detailed_translations.chinese: 久坐的；坐惯的；定栖的；静坐的
detailed_translations.english: spending a lot of time sitting down, and not moving or exercising very much

sentences.english: He had been chosen by a cabal of fellow senators.
sentences.chinese: 他被参议员同伴们选入了一个政治阴谋小集团。

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴谋（尤指政治上的）；阴谋集团
detailed_translations.english: a small group of people who make secret plans, especially in order to have political power

sentences.english: a baleful look
sentences.chinese: 恶狠狠的目光

detailed_translations.english: expressing anger, hatred, or a wish to harm someone

sentences.english: Smear some aloe vera gel on the blister and cover it with a bandage to help it heal.
sentences.chinese: 在水泡上涂一些芦荟凝胶并用绷带包起来以帮助它恢复到健康状态。

sentences.english: We would want to put an antiretroviral agent in the gel, to act as another level of protection, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “我们希望在这种凝胶中放入一种抗逆转录病毒制剂，从而起到另一层的保护作用。” 他说。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid gels, it becomes firmer or thicker
a thick wet substance that is used in beauty or cleaning products

name: eminence
trans: 卓越， 显赫， 著名

sentences.english: Many of the pilots were to achieve eminence in the aeronautical world.
sentences.chinese: 其中的很多飞行员后来在航空界都取得了显赫的声名。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being famous and important

name: virulent
trans: 有剧毒的； 致命的； 敌意的， 痛恨的， 恶毒的

sentences.english: a particularly virulent form of influenza
sentences.chinese: 特别凶猛的一种流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 剧毒的；恶性的；有恶意的
detailed_translations.english: a poison, disease etc that is virulent is very dangerous and affects people very quickly

sentences.english: What if you could predetermine the genetics of your newborn baby?
sentences.chinese: 要是你能预先设定新生宝宝的基因，你会怎么办？

sentences.english: The applications predetermine queue names, messages, and message formats, just like two network applications agree on socket numbers.
sentences.chinese: 应用程序预先确定队列名称、消息和消息格式，就像两个网络应用程序就套接字数量达成协议一样。

detailed_translations.english: to determine beforehand

sentences.english: To be an exact divisor of.
sentences.chinese: 以…来除成为…的精确除数。

sentences.english: The value of the divider or divisor.
sentences.chinese: 被除以的值，或除数。

sentences.english: The divisor is subtracted from the dividend.
sentences.chinese: 从被除数中减去除数。

detailed_translations.english: the number by which another number is to be divided

sentences.english: A transcript of this PBS programme is available through our website, pbs.com.
sentences.chinese: 这个公共广播公司节目的文字本可通过我们的网址查阅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成绩单；抄本，副本；文字记录
detailed_translations.english: a written or printed copy of a speech, conversation etc

sentences.english: I needed to be with people who admired my long hair and troubadour credentials, you see.
sentences.chinese: 因为我想要与赞赏我的长头发的人在一起，然后让他们看到我真的是一位有实力的行呤歌手。

detailed_translations.english: a type of singer and poet who travelled around the  palaces  and castles of Southern Europe in the 12th and 13th cen-turies

sentences.english: ...a rectangular table.
sentences.chinese: …一张长方形的桌子。

detailed_translations.english: having the shape of a rectangle

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

sentences.english: The place at once enraptured me.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方立刻把我迷住了。

sentences.english: The 20,000-strong audience listened, enraptured.
sentences.chinese: 两万多名观众听得入了迷。

sentences.english: ...an enraptured audience.
sentences.chinese: ...一场观众如痴如醉。

detailed_translations.english: If something or someone enraptures you, you think they are wonderful or fascinating

name: ulterior
trans: 隐秘的， 别有用心的

sentences.english: He’s just being nice. I don’t think he has any ulterior motives.
sentences.chinese: 他就是好心，我不认为他别有用心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 将来的，较远的；在那边的；隐秘不明的

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

name: infuse
trans: 输入， 注入； 浸泡

sentences.english: All those lives maintained in the rarefied air of the absurd could not persevere without some profound and constant thought to infuse its strength into them.
sentences.chinese: 没有某种深邃的思想一成不变地为之输入力量，所有这些在荒谬的稀薄空气中维持的生命都无法继续。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality

sentences.english: The loser’s name has been consigned to oblivion (= completely forgotten ).
sentences.chinese: 失败者的姓名已湮没无闻。

detailed_translations.english: when something is completely forgotten or no longer important

sentences.english: The prisoners were ill and emaciated.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯们疾病缠身，骨瘦如柴。

detailed_translations.english: extremely thin from lack of food or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 憔悴；消瘦下去（emaciate的过去分词）

sentences.english: What's the depth of the water here?
sentences.chinese: 这儿的水有多深？

sentences.english: the depth of her love
sentences.chinese: 她那爱之深

sentences.english: Astronomers may one day travel to the depths of space.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家也许有一天可以到太空深处去。

detailed_translations.english: the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of sth

sentences.english: Add the mint and allow the flavours to mingle.
sentences.chinese: 加入薄荷，把各种味道混合起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 混合起来， 相混合； 相交往， 相往来
detailed_translations.english: if two feelings, sounds, smells etc mingle, they mix together with each other
if two feelings, sounds, smells etc mingle, they mix together with each other

name: edible
trans: 可以吃的， 可食用的

sentences.english: These berries are edible, but those are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 这些浆果可以吃，但那些有毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可以吃的， 可食用的
detailed_translations.english: something that is edible can be eaten

name: inscrutable
trans: 难以理解的； 高深莫测的

sentences.english: He stood silent and inscrutable.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地站着，让人难以捉摸。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的；不可理解的；不能预测的；不可思议的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is inscrutable shows no emotion or reaction in the expression on their face so that it is impossible to know what they are feeling or thinking

name: antediluvian
trans: 大洪水前的； 上古的， 古风的

sentences.english: antediluvian ideas about women
sentences.chinese: 关于女性的陈旧观念

detailed_translations.chinese: 大洪水前的；远古的；陈旧的；旧式的
detailed_translations.english: very old-fashioned

detailed_translations.chinese: 大洪水以前的人；年迈的人；不合时宜的人

name: unyielding
trans: 坚定的， 不能弯曲的； 不屈的

sentences.english: an unyielding resistance to change
sentences.chinese: 固执己见，不愿改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 不屈的；坚强的；[材] 不易弯曲的
detailed_translations.english: not willing to change your ideas or beliefs

sentences.english: Egotism is the anesthetic that dulls the pain of stupidity.
sentences.chinese: 自负是为了麻痹因为愚蠢带来痛楚的麻醉剂。

sentences.english: The acceptance of cocaine as a local anesthetic was immediate, and in this way the history of local anesthesia differs sharply from that of general anesthesia.
sentences.chinese: 可卡因很快被公认为是一种局部麻药，就这点看来，局部麻醉的历史和全身麻醉的发展史有明显的区别。

sentences.english: The injection itself may include local anesthetic and/or saline along with the steroid medication to give immediate pain relief and flush the area of inflammatory agents.
sentences.chinese: 注射药物本身包括局部麻醉剂和和/或生理盐水以及激素类药物，达到迅速止痛并冲洗局部炎性介质的作用。

name: reveal
trans: 泄露， 显露， 揭露

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

sentences.english: the company’s distribution depot
sentences.chinese: 公司的发货仓库

sentences.english: a fuel storage depot
sentences.chinese: 燃料储存仓库

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are stored until they are needed

sentences.english: A degree is more of a hindrance than a help in British industry.
sentences.chinese: 在英国工业界，学位反倒是个累赘。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that makes it difficult for you to do something

sentences.english: The research involves collecting data from two random samples.
sentences.chinese: 该项研究需要从两个随机样本里收集资料。

detailed_translations.english: information or facts
information or facts

sentences.english: These findings have both theoretical and practical applications.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.english: In this process, an interaction of theoretical study with practical work . should be strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中，要加强理论的探讨和工作推进的互动作用。

sentences.english: Researchers have tossed around theoretical calculations of using just aluminum and water for rocket propellant in the past.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

sentences.english: George sat at the head of the table, in his rightful place as their leader.
sentences.chinese: 乔治坐在桌子上首，作为他们的领导，这是他理所当然的位子。

sentences.english: I’ll return the money to its rightful owner .
sentences.chinese: 我会把钱还给其合法的主人。

sentences.english: the rightful heir to the throne
sentences.chinese: 王位的合法继承人

detailed_translations.chinese: 合法的；正当的；公正的；正直的
detailed_translations.english: according to what is correct or what should be done legally or morally

sentences.english: a sound understanding of money and banking systems
sentences.chinese: 对货币和银行业体制的透彻理解

sentences.english: a sound knowledge of English
sentences.chinese: 扎实的英语知识

sentences.english: He has sound grasp of European history.
sentences.chinese: 他对欧洲历史有着透彻的理解。

detailed_translations.english: complete and thorough

name: hospitable
trans: 好客的； 招待周到的；  宜人的；  易接受的

sentences.english: The local people were very kind and hospitable.
sentences.chinese: 当地人非常友好热情。

detailed_translations.english: friendly, welcoming, and generous to visitors

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

sentences.english: They hope to revitalize the neighborhood by providing better housing.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望通过提供更好的住房条件使这个社区恢复活力。

sentences.english: a revitalizing massage
sentences.chinese: 让人恢复精神的按摩

detailed_translations.english: to put new strength or power into something

sentences.english: It would be discourteous to ignore his request.
sentences.chinese: 忽视他的请求是失礼的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 失礼的，无礼貌的；粗鲁的
detailed_translations.english: not polite, and not showing respect for other people

name: bight
trans: 海岸线  的宽缓弯曲； 海湾

detailed_translations.english: a slight bend or curve in a coast

name: recalcitrant
trans: 反抗的， 顽强的； 不顺从的

sentences.english: a recalcitrant pupil
sentences.chinese: 一名不服管教的学生

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

sentences.english: He could be a bit of a nuisance when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉时会是一个有点令人讨厌的人。

detailed_translations.english: a person, thing, or situation that annoys you or causes problems

sentences.english: Neither side should delude itself that it can avoid the harm caused by an increased mutual antagonism;
sentences.chinese: 任何一方都不应迷惑他自己，认为增长的相互对立所带来的伤害是可以避免；

sentences.english: Neither side should delude itself that it can avoid the harm caused by an increased mutual antagonism; both should understand that a crisis in one country can hurt the other.
sentences.chinese: 任何一方都不应迷惑他自己，认为增长的相互对立所带来的伤害是可以避免；双方都应认识到，一国的危机可以伤害到另一国。

name: drub
trans: 敲打； 猛烈批评； 彻底打败

detailed_translations.english: to beat as with a stick; cudgel; club

name: tyro
trans: 生手； 初学者； 新手

sentences.english: The scrutiny of investors, directors, regulators and media, may find out these tyro corporate leaders before they can do much damage.
sentences.chinese: 股东、董事、监管机构和媒体的仔细审视，或许会在这些新手企业领袖造成重大损害前发现问题。

sentences.english: Only the ineducable tyro can fail to sense the presence or absence of wolves, or the fact that mountains have a secret opinion about them.
sentences.chinese: 只有最不堪造就的新手，才感觉不到狼的存在与否，才不晓得大山对狼有着隐秘的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a novice or beginner

sentences.english: The fission of the cell could be inhibited with certain chemicals.
sentences.chinese: 细胞的裂变可以通过某些化学药品加以抑制。

sentences.english: Essentially, all the neutrons and part of the gamma rays are emitted in the actual fission process .
sentences.chinese: 从根本上说，所有的中子和一部分射线都是在裂变实际的过程中放射出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the process of splitting an atom to produce large amounts of energy or an explosion

sentences.english: Suppose the width of a rectangle is x metres.
sentences.chinese: 设长方形的宽是 x 米。

detailed_translations.english: a shape that has four straight sides, two of which are usually longer than the other two, and four 90˚ angles at the corners

sentences.english: ...a man of great sagacity and immense experience.
sentences.chinese: ...一个极为睿智且经验丰富的男人。

detailed_translations.english: good judgment and understanding

sentences.english: Children become fractious when they are tired.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子累了就容易发脾气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易怒的；倔强的，难以对待的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fractious becomes angry very easily

name: ancestry
trans: 祖先  ； 家系， 血统

sentences.english: Most people of European or African ancestry have the "wet" kind: thick and sticky.
sentences.chinese: 大多数欧洲或者非洲血统的人耳垢是湿的，厚的，有粘性的。

sentences.english: Martin has shown that, of the eukaryotic genes whose ancestry can be traced, 75 per cent or more came from bacteria rather than the host cell.
sentences.chinese: 马丁揭示，在哪些可以追溯到祖先的线粒体基因上，有75%或更多的成分来自当时外来的细菌而非宿主细胞。

sentences.english: You can only explain this by evolutionary common ancestry.
sentences.chinese: 你只能通过存在“进化上的共同祖先”来解释。

detailed_translations.english: the members of your family who lived a long time ago

name: abridge
trans: 删节， 削减， 精简

sentences.english: The time is limited, so he abridge his composition.
sentences.chinese: 时间有限，他缩短了他的作文。

sentences.english: She decided to abridge her stay in campus since she wants to hunt for a job immediately.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到她想要马上找工作，他决定缩短在校园里逗留的时间。

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

sentences.english: Draw a straight line across the top of the page.
sentences.chinese: 在这一页的上方画一条直线。

sentences.english: Sign your name on the dotted line (= line made up of a series of dots ).
sentences.chinese: 在虚线上签名。

sentences.english: The edges of the pitch are marked by white lines.
sentences.chinese: 球场的四边画着白线。

sentences.english: The goalkeeper just managed to stop the ball going over the line.
sentences.chinese: 守门员刚好把球截住，没有让它越过球门线。

sentences.english: He raced towards the finishing line.
sentences.chinese: 他朝终点线冲刺。

sentences.english: The four men were standing in a line on the other side of the table.
sentences.chinese: 那四个男人在桌子的另一边站成一排。

sentences.english: Light travels in a straight line.
sentences.chinese: 光沿直线传播。

sentences.english: A boat came into my line of vision (= direction I was looking in ).
sentences.chinese: 一艘船进入了我的视线。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin mark on a piece of paper, the ground, or another surface

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

sentences.english: Lefkas has an abundance of lush green vegetation.
sentences.chinese: 莱夫卡斯有葱郁茂盛的植被。

detailed_translations.chinese: 植被；植物，草木；呆板单调的生活
detailed_translations.english: plants in general

sentences.english: At the dinner table, my father would go on and on, showing off, aggrandizing himself.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭时我父亲总是不停地夸耀和吹嘘自己。

sentences.english: ...plans to aggrandize the building.
sentences.chinese: ...使建筑物更加壮观的计划。

detailed_translations.english: To aggrandize someone means to make them seem richer, more powerful, and more important than they really are. To aggrandize a building means to make it more impressive.

name: jingoism
trans: 沙文主义， 侵略主义

sentences.english: a mood of warlike jingoism
sentences.chinese: 好战的沙文主义情绪

detailed_translations.chinese: 侵略主义；沙文主义；武力外交政策
detailed_translations.english: a strong belief that your own country is better than others – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Over time, developers subdivided the land.
sentences.chinese: 开发商们渐渐地把这块土地进行了再分割。

sentences.english: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

sentences.english: an insidious trend towards censorship of the press
sentences.chinese: 实行新闻审查的潜在趋势

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴险的；隐伏的；暗中为害的；狡猾的
detailed_translations.english: an insidious change or problem spreads gradually without being noticed, and causes serious harm

sentences.english: The extremely salty, alkali lake holds little life, but its waters are a favorite spot for wading birds.
sentences.chinese: 其味极咸，碱湖保存了湖中的小生命，但其水域仍为涉水鸟所喜欢的地方。

sentences.english: To get similar characteristics from composites, the carbon fibres are first chemically treated with an alkali which creates lots of tiny pits on their surface.
sentences.chinese: 为了在复合碳材料上获取与电容器相似的性质，这种碳纤维首先经过碱化学处理以令其表面生成许多细微的凹点。

sentences.english: After seeing how this air makes the ugly sagebrush and the patches of alkali and brown earth a feast to the eye, one can understand how the light of heaven may make the ugliest faces beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这儿的空气能使丑陋的灌木和斑驳的盐碱地、褐色的泥土变成视觉盛宴。 只要见过这些，你就明白为什么说天堂的圣光能让最丑的脸变得美好。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that forms a chemical salt when combined with an acid

sentences.english: The meeting with Jack was fortuitous.
sentences.chinese: 遇到杰克是机缘巧合。

detailed_translations.english: happening by chance, especially in a way that has a good result

sentences.english: He was not slothful: he had been busy all night.
sentences.chinese: 他可没偷懒：他忙了整整一夜。

detailed_translations.english: lazy or not active

name: antiquarian
trans: 古文物研究者， 收集古文物者

sentences.english: ...an antiquarian bookseller.
sentences.chinese: ...一位古董书商。

sentences.english: ...antiquarian and secondhand books.
sentences.chinese: ...古旧和二手书。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古文物研究的；古文物的
detailed_translations.english: Antiquarian means concerned with old and rare objects

detailed_translations.chinese: 古文物研究者；[古] 古文物收藏家

name: fervent
trans: 热心的， 热烈的， 强烈的

sentences.english: a fervent appeal for peace
sentences.chinese: 对和平的强烈呼吁

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的；强烈的；炽热的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: believing or feeling something very strongly and sincerely

sentences.english: His manner was sly and deceitful.
sentences.chinese: 他的态度诡诈而又不老实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗的；欺诈的；谎言的；虚伪的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is deceitful tells lies in order to get what they want

name: pervert
trans: 使堕落， 诱惑； 使反常

sentences.english: TV violence perverts the minds of young children.
sentences.chinese: 电视暴力腐蚀了孩子们的心灵。

detailed_translations.english: to influence someone so that they begin to think or behave in an immoral way

detailed_translations.chinese: 堕落者；行为反常者；性欲反常者；变态
detailed_translations.english: someone whose sexual behaviour is considered unnatural and unacceptable

sentences.english: Let me adduce more evidence.
sentences.chinese: 让我举出更多的证据。

sentences.english: Can you adduce any reason for His strange behavior?
sentences.chinese: 你是否能举出任何理由来说明他的奇特行为？

sentences.english: When you adduce evidence of this nature, you must be sure of your sources.
sentences.chinese: 你必须引用许多例证来证明你的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to give facts or reasons in order to prove that something is true

sentences.english: ...an audition for a Broadway musical.
sentences.chinese: …一部百老汇歌舞剧的试演。

detailed_translations.english: An audition is a short performance given by an actor, dancer, or musician so that a director or conductor can decide if they are good enough to be in a play, film, or orchestra
to take part in an audition

sentences.english: They damage female strobili during the interval between pollination and fertilization.
sentences.chinese: 在传粉与受精的间隔期间，他们毁坏了雌球花。

sentences.english: The problem occurs because plants need to transfer pollen by wind and insect to fertilization and reproduce.
sentences.chinese: 发生这样的问题是因为植物需要通过风和昆虫传递花粉进行受精繁殖。

sentences.english: The kernel of that message was that peace must not be a source of advantage or disadvantage for anyone.
sentences.chinese: 那一信息的核心是和平绝不应该成为对任何人有利或不利的根源。

detailed_translations.chinese: 核心，要点；[计] 内核；仁；麦粒，谷粒；精髓
detailed_translations.english: the part of a nut or seed inside the shell, or the part inside the stone of some fruits

sentences.english: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 她很小气，不愿捐钱行善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的
detailed_translations.english: not generous, especially with money

sentences.english: So the left electrode will be the cathode as I have configured it, and the right electrode will be anode.
sentences.chinese: 因此左边电极就成了阴极,正如我原来设定的一样，右边的电极就是阳极。

sentences.english: Second, they are "activating" some of the inactive components, by freeing lithium from the inactive material so that it can move between the cathode and the anode.
sentences.chinese: 其次，他们是“激活”消极的一些组件，通过释放从非活动的材料，以便可以移动它们之间的阴极和阳极锂。

sentences.english: The kit comes with an anode, a cathode, and an LED light.
sentences.chinese: 这种套装电池包括一根阳极、一根阴极和一颗LED灯。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a  battery  that collects  electron s  , often a wire or piece of metal with the sign (+)

name: excavate
trans: 挖掘， 开凿； 挖洞

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

name: subtle
trans: 敏锐的； 精细的， 微妙的

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

name: unsavoury
trans: 声名狼藉的， 寡廉鲜耻的； 难吃的

sentences.english: The club has an unsavoury reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这家俱乐部名声很臭。

sentences.english: There were a lot of unsavoury characters(= unpleasant people ) around the station.
sentences.chinese: 车站周围有许多不三不四的人。

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or morally unacceptable

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: impartial
trans: 公平的， 不偏不倚的

sentences.english: We offer impartial advice on tax and insurance.
sentences.chinese: 我们就税收和保险问题提供公充的建议。

sentences.english: an impartial inquiry into the deaths
sentences.chinese: 对死亡事件的公正调查

sentences.english: an impartial observer
sentences.chinese: 公正的观察员

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平的，公正的；不偏不倚的
detailed_translations.english: not involved in a particular situation, and therefore able to give a fair opinion or piece of advice

name: consultant
trans: 会诊医师， 顾问医生； 顾问

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 管理顾问

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to give advice on a particular subject

name: indisputable
trans: 无争论之余地的， 明白的

sentences.english: It is indisputable that birds are harbouring this illness.
sentences.chinese: 无可争辩的是，鸟类携带着这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明白的；无争论之余地的
detailed_translations.english: If you say that something is indisputable, you are emphasizing that it is true and cannot be shown to be untrue

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

detailed_translations.english: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

sentences.english: The issues are complex and multi-faceted.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题很复杂，涉及诸多方面。

detailed_translations.english: one of several parts of someone’s character, a situation etc

sentences.english: He further rationalized his activity by convincing himself that he was actually promoting peace.
sentences.chinese: 他通过说服自己确实是在促进和平来进一步使自己的行为合理化。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使……合理化；使……有理化；为……找借口
detailed_translations.english: If you try to rationalize attitudes or actions that are difficult to accept, you think of reasons to justify or explain them

sentences.english: a novel by Jane Austen
sentences.chinese: 简·奥斯丁的小说

sentences.english: What a novel idea!.
sentences.chinese: 多么新奇的想法呀！

detailed_translations.english: a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary
not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

sentences.english: He came to prominence during the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 他在该世界杯期间一举成名。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being important and well known

name: liberal
trans: 慷慨的， 大方的； 丰富的， 富足的； 自由的， 思想开明的

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

sentences.english: a genial smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的
detailed_translations.english: friendly and happy

sentences.english: She looked the epitome of elegance.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去像是优雅的典范。

sentences.english: He was the very epitome of evil.
sentences.chinese: 他是邪恶的典型。

detailed_translations.english: the best possible example of something

name: obdurate
trans: 冷酷无情的； 顽固的， 执拗的

sentences.english: They argued, but he remained obdurate.
sentences.chinese: 他们发生了争论，但他还是固执己见。

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的，执拗的；冷酷无情的
detailed_translations.english: very determined not to change your beliefs, actions, or feelings, in a way that seems unreasonable

sentences.english: He challenged the political orthodoxy of his time.
sentences.chinese: 他对同时代的正统政治观念提出了质疑。

sentences.english: These ideas have now become part of educational orthodoxy.
sentences.chinese: 这些观点现已成为正统教育理念的一部分。

detailed_translations.english: an idea or set of ideas that is accepted by most people to be correct and right

name: imitate
trans: 模仿， 仿效； 仿造， 伪造

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

name: dominate
trans: 支配， 统治， 控制； 占优势

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

sentences.english: She set about rearranging the furniture in the living room.
sentences.chinese: 她开始重新摆放起居室的家具。

detailed_translations.english: to change the position or order of things

name: impalpable
trans: 感触不到的， 摸不到的

sentences.english: To the untrue man, the whole universe is false- it is impalpable- it shrinks to nothing within his grasp.
sentences.chinese: 对那个不真实的人来说，整个宇宙都是虚伪的——都是难以触摸的，在他的把握之中化为子虚乌有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感触不到的；难理解的；无形的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to touch or feel physically

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: torpid
trans: 麻木的； 迟钝的；  冬眠的

sentences.english: a torpid mind
sentences.chinese: 迟钝的头脑

detailed_translations.chinese: 迟钝的，迟缓的；不活泼的；麻痹的；[生物] 蛰伏的
detailed_translations.english: not active because you are lazy or sleepy

name: avert
trans: 防止， 避免； 转移

sentences.english: The tragedy could have been averted if the crew had followed safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 如果乘务人员按照安全规则操作，这场悲剧是可以避免的。

sentences.english: Henry averted his eyes as she undressed.
sentences.chinese: 她脱衣服的时候，亨利把目光转向别处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 防止，避免；转移(目光、注意力等)
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something unpleasant from happening

name: callous
trans: 无情的； 冷淡的； 硬结的； 起老茧的

sentences.english: We were shocked at the callous disregard for human life.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这种无视人类生命的冷漠感到震惊。

sentences.english: a callous attitude
sentences.chinese: 冷漠的态度

sentences.english: the callous slaughter of seals
sentences.chinese: 对海豹的无情残杀

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；麻木的；硬结的；起老茧的
detailed_translations.english: not caring that other people are suffering

detailed_translations.chinese: 使冷酷无情；使硬结；使生茧

name: grievance
trans: 委屈， 冤情， 不平

sentences.english: anyone who has a legitimate grievance against the company
sentences.chinese: 凡是有正当理由对公司感到不满的人

sentences.english: a means of overcoming genuine grievances
sentences.chinese: 化解委屈的一个办法

sentences.english: There must be an opportunity for both sides to air their grievances .
sentences.chinese: 一定要有一个机会让双方都说出心中的不满。

sentences.english: The teachers’ contract established a grievance procedure .
sentences.chinese: 教师合同建立了一个申诉程序。

sentences.english: the sense of grievance which characterized him as a young man
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时惯有的不满情绪

detailed_translations.english: a belief that you have been treated unfairly, or an unfair situation or event that affects and upsets you

sentences.english: benefit claimants
sentences.chinese: 救济金申请人

detailed_translations.chinese: 原告；[贸易] 索赔人；提出要求者
detailed_translations.english: someone who claims something, especially money, from the government, a court etc because they think they have a right to it

sentences.english: Only cheeses made in this area may be labelled ‘Roquefort.’
sentences.chinese: 只有这个地区出产的干酪才能被称作“罗克福尔干酪”。

sentences.english: Crime rates are much higher in urban areas.
sentences.chinese: 城镇地区的犯罪率要高很多。

sentences.english: an area of 2,000 square miles
sentences.chinese: 2,000平方英里的面积

sentences.english: The course covers three main subject areas.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程涵盖三大学科领域。

detailed_translations.english: a particular part of a country, town etc

sentences.english: the abolition of the monarchy
sentences.chinese: 君主制的废除

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主政体；君主国；君主政治
detailed_translations.english: the system in which a country is ruled by a king or queen

name: vicious
trans: 恶毒的， 凶残的， 邪恶的

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.english: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

sentences.english: Visibility on the roads is down to 20 metres due to heavy fog.
sentences.chinese: 道路能见度因浓雾降至20米。

detailed_translations.english: the distance it is possible to see, especially when this is affected by weather conditions

name: tractable
trans: 易驾驭的， 驯良的； 易处理的

sentences.english: The issues have proved to be less tractable than expected.
sentences.chinese: 结果这些问题比预想的要难以处理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易于管教的；易驾驭的；易处理的；驯良的
detailed_translations.english: easy to control or deal with

sentences.english: a determinate prison sentence of five years
sentences.chinese: 五年有期徒刑

detailed_translations.english: definite or with an exact limit

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

sentences.english: He admitted a lack of motivation and a feeling of sloth.
sentences.chinese: 他承认自己缺乏动力，感觉懒散。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怠惰，懒惰；[脊椎] 树懒
detailed_translations.english: an animal in Central and South America that moves very slowly, has grey fur, and lives in trees

sentences.english: This trick demands sleight of hand.
sentences.chinese: 这套戏法要求手快。

sentences.english: The aching hollowness in sleight of hand.
sentences.chinese: 还有我灵巧戏法背后阵阵作痛的空虚。

detailed_translations.english: skill; dexterity

name: wiry
trans: 金属丝般的； 瘦长结实的

sentences.english: His body is wiry and athletic.
sentences.chinese: 他的身体精瘦结实而且健壮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 金属线制的；金属丝般的；坚硬的；瘦长结实的；（噪音）尖细的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is wiry is thin but has strong muscles

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

sentences.english: You will be remunerated and so will your staff.
sentences.chinese: 你将会得到报酬，你的员工也会。

detailed_translations.english: If you are remunerated for work that you do, you are paid for it

sentences.english: ...the young aspirant to power.
sentences.chinese: ...对权力有抱负的年轻人。

sentences.english: ...aspirant politicians.
sentences.chinese: ...有抱负的政治家们。

detailed_translations.english: Someone who is an aspirant to political power or to an important job has a strong desire to achieve it
Aspirant means the same as

sentences.english: During a war the interests of the state are paramount, and those of the individual come last.
sentences.chinese: 战争时期国家利益是首要的，个人利益置于最后。

sentences.english: Women’s role as mothers is of paramount importance to society.
sentences.chinese: 女性作为母亲的角色对社会至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最重要的，主要的；至高无上的
detailed_translations.english: more important than anything else

sentences.english: Jackson nodded a salutation.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊点头打了个招呼。

detailed_translations.english: a word or phrase used at the beginning of a letter or speech, such as ‘Dear Mr Smith’

sentences.english: If for some reason you don't have or cannot adopt these values, then you should not worry about agility.
sentences.chinese: 如果因为某些原因您没有或者不能采用这些价值，那么您就不需要为敏捷而操心了。
