sentences.english: As for my unlikely allies, I think that I shall allow them a reprieve.
sentences.chinese: 至于我的盟友们，我想我应该给他们一个缓刑的机会。

sentences.english: You will be converted—you will be converted just as soon as every effort to compass pardon, commutation, or reprieve HAS failed—and then!
sentences.chinese: 您会痛悔前非——就在人们为您恳求赦免、申请减刑、或改判缓刑的一切努力统告失败的时候，您会痛悔前非的。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop a prisoner from being killed as a punishment
a delay before something bad happens or continues to happen

name: apostate
trans: 变节者， 背教者， 脱党者

sentences.english: But as Kinzer explains, "For most of Turkey's modern history, the Muslim world has seen [the country] as an apostate," having "no religious legitimacy" and acting "as Washington's lackey.
sentences.chinese: 但作者认为“在土耳其的现代历史中，穆斯林世界将那时的土耳其视为一种变节，一点没有宗教气节，完全是美国的走狗。”

detailed_translations.english: someone who has stopped believing in a religion or supporting a political party

name: astringent
trans: 收敛性的； 止血的； 尖刻的

sentences.english: astringent remarks
sentences.chinese: 尖刻的言辞

detailed_translations.chinese: 涩的；收敛性的；止血的；严厉的
detailed_translations.english: an astringent liquid is able to make your skin less oily or stop a wound from bleeding
a liquid used to make your skin less oily or to stop a wound from bleeding

sentences.english: severe eating disorders such as bulimia and anorexia
sentences.chinese: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

detailed_translations.chinese: 混乱， 杂乱， 骚乱
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a lot of people behave in an uncontrolled, noisy, or violent way in public

name: aggravate
trans: 恶化， 加重， 加剧

sentences.english: Their money problems were further aggravated by a rise in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 由于利率上调，他们的财务问题更加严重。

sentences.english: Building the new road will only aggravate the situation .
sentences.chinese: 建造那条新路只会使情况恶化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation, an illness, or an injury worse

sentences.english: She waived her right to a lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她放弃了请律师的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially that a right, rule etc can be ignored

sentences.english: Every transistor has at least three electrodes.
sentences.chinese: 每个晶体管至少有三个电极。

sentences.english: The transistor became the basis of a new invention called the "computer" which I suspect those of you reading this may be familiar with.
sentences.chinese: 晶体管后来成为了一项叫做“计算机”的新发明的基础，我想正在阅读本文的你对于这个应该比较熟悉吧。

sentences.english: When you got a transistor radio, you could walk around with it, and today you can put your whole record collection in your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 而当你使用晶体管收音机时，你可以带着它到处走动，时至今日你可以把你收集的唱片装进口袋里。

name: persevere
trans: 坚持不懈， 锲而不舍

sentences.english: It can be tricky at first, but persevere.
sentences.chinese: 一开始会有些棘手，不过要坚持。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚持；不屈不挠；固执己见（在辩论中）
detailed_translations.english: to continue trying to do something in a very determined way in spite of difficulties – use this to show approval

name: bowdlerize
trans: 删除  不妥的文句； 删改； 修订

sentences.english: a bowdlerized version of ‘Antony and Cleopatra’
sentences.chinese: 《安东尼和克里奥帕特拉》的删节本

detailed_translations.english: to remove all the parts of a book, play etc that you think might offend someone – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: The statistics are highly questionable.
sentences.chinese: 这个统计数据大有问题。

detailed_translations.english: not likely to be true or correct

sentences.english: Gorky was often the victim of his grandfather’s tyranny.
sentences.chinese: 高尔基经常是他祖父专横管制的受害者。

sentences.english: the fight against tyranny
sentences.chinese: 反对专制的斗争

detailed_translations.chinese: 暴政；专横；严酷；残暴的行为（需用复数）
detailed_translations.english: cruel or unfair control over other people

name: voluminous
trans: 多卷的； 容量大的； 庞大的

sentences.english: He took voluminous notes during the lecture.
sentences.chinese: 他在听课时作了大量笔记。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大量的；多卷的，长篇的；著书多的
detailed_translations.english: voluminous books, documents etc are very long and contain a lot of detail

sentences.english: The chemical industry says BPA is the safest, most effective sealant.
sentences.chinese: 化工行业声称BPA是最安全最有效的密封材料。

sentences.english: Many baskets have a sealant, so you can use a nonabrasive cloth, such as a section of a cloth diaper.
sentences.chinese: 许多篮子有密封剂，所以可以用不粗糙的衣服，像一小块尿布。

sentences.english: The handle on the fridge door had broken off, probably decades ago, but if you pressed your fingers just right into the soft rubber sealant in the crack, you could pry it open.
sentences.chinese: 冰箱门把手已折断，恐怕是几十年前就断了。 但是，如果把手指插进门缝中的密封软胶，还是可以掰开冰箱门的。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the surface of something to protect it from air, water etc

sentences.english: Their relationship hasn’t always been amicable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的关系不是一直都很和睦。

detailed_translations.english: an amicable agreement, relationship etc is one in which people feel friendly towards each other and do not want to quarrel

sentences.english: Some of the best services for the seniors are sponsored by philanthropic organizations.
sentences.chinese: 一些一流老人服务机构是由慈善组织资助的。

detailed_translations.english: a philanthropic person or institution gives money and help to people who are poor or in trouble

name: alleviate
trans: 减轻， 缓解， 缓和

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

name: obscurity
trans: 阴暗， 朦胧； 隐匿， 晦涩

sentences.english: Now, on the eve of the bicentenary of the independence movements, he sets out to rescue San Martín from his relative obscurity.
sentences.chinese: 今天，在那场独立运动二百周年纪念前夕，他再度出手以挽救相对默默无闻的圣·马丁。

sentences.english: At this time he knew nothing of Wells’s and Matthew’s accounts of natural selection; indeed, both accounts languished in obscurity until after the “Origin” was published.
sentences.chinese: 此时他对马修和威尔士关于自然选择的阐述一无所知；事实上，直到《物种的起源》发表这两人一直默默无闻。

sentences.english: The obscurity of JTS is in some sense due to its own success: because it hides the details of transaction management so effectively, we don't hear or say very much about it.
sentences.chinese: 在某种意义上，JTS 的默默无闻恰恰是它的成功：因为它非常有效地隐藏了事务管理的很多细节，因此，我们没有听说过或者谈论过很多关于它的内容。

detailed_translations.english: the state of not being known or remembered

sentences.english: One of the boats had been set afire .
sentences.chinese: 其中有一艘船遭人纵火。

detailed_translations.english: burning

name: condescending
trans: 谦逊的， 故意屈尊的

sentences.english: Professor Hutter’s manner is extremely conde-scending.
sentences.chinese: 赫特教授的态度极为傲慢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现出优越感的；居高临下的
detailed_translations.english: behaving as though you think you are better, more intelligent, or more important than other people – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: a shy woman who shunned publicity
sentences.chinese: 不爱抛头露面的羞怯女子

sentences.english: Victims of the disease found themselves shunned by society.
sentences.chinese: 患这种病的人发现，社会上的人都躲着 他们。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid someone or something

sentences.english: amount of desiccant must be used to offset the wooden bracing if placed inside of the barrier
sentences.chinese: 经常在屏蔽袋外部使用木制支架。 合适数量的干燥剂必须使用在木制支架内。

sentences.english: A patent-pending University of Maryland student design, the liquid desiccant waterfall is arranged into the wall and helps provide high-efficiency humidity control.
sentences.chinese: 由马里兰大学学生设计、正在申请专利的液态干燥剂水幕被设置在墙体中，以提供高效的湿度控制。

sentences.english: It is a low-tech version of the “Do Not Eat” desiccant packets that may have been packed in the box the phone came in, to keep moisture away from the circuitry during shipping and storage.
sentences.chinese: 这是“禁止食用”干燥剂的低技术版。 和那些手机盒子里为了在运输和贮藏过程中防潮的小包有同样功效。

detailed_translations.english: desiccating or drying
a substance, such as calcium oxide, that absorbs water and is used to remove moisture; a drying agent

sentences.english: Valerian is a safe and effective sedative with reliable results for most kids.
sentences.chinese: 缬草是安全有效的镇静剂，对大多数儿童很有效。

sentences.english: And as a doctor who swore to do no harm, I guess I just still don't understand how you could give this clearly troubled person this powerful sedative in a non-hospital setting?
sentences.chinese: 而作为一位曾发誓救人的医生，我想我还是不了解你能出乎医德考虑之外给这位显然陷入困境的人这种强大的镇静剂?。

sentences.english: After taking a sedative she was able to get to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 服用了镇静剂后，她能够入睡了。

detailed_translations.english: a drug used to make someone calm or go to sleep

name: factual
trans: 事实的； 事实上的， 实际的

sentences.english: Try to keep your account of events as factual as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你要尽量如实地说明情况。

detailed_translations.english: based on facts or relating to facts

name: negotiate
trans: 谈判， 交涉， 商议

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

sentences.english: Her poems are modishly experimental in style and recondite in subject matter.
sentences.chinese: 她的诗在风格上时尚朦胧，在主题上深奥难懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 深奥的；隐藏的；默默无闻的
detailed_translations.english: recondite facts or subjects are not known about or understood by many people

name: supposition
trans: 假定， 想象； 推测， 推想

sentences.english: His version of events is pure supposition .
sentences.chinese: 他对事情的说法纯属推测。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true, even though you are not certain and cannot prove it

sentences.english: I could simply not be heard in the tumult.
sentences.chinese: 一片嘈杂声中别人根本听不到我说话。

detailed_translations.english: a confused, noisy, and excited situation, often caused by a large crowd

name: exigent
trans: 紧急的， 迫切的； 苛求的， 要求很高的

sentences.english: To explain the current tense physician-patient relationship is an exigent social problem.
sentences.chinese: 解读目前紧张的医患关系是一个迫切的社会课题。

sentences.english: Along with advance of space and time resolution and betterment of physical process in the modeling pattern, the need for a high precision, high speed module of radiation grows more and more exigent.
sentences.chinese: 随着模式空间和时间分辨率的增加和物理过程的改进，气候模拟对一个高精度、高速度的辐射模块的需求显得越来越迫切。

detailed_translations.english: an exigent situation is urgent, so that you must deal with it very quickly

name: shatter
trans: 打碎， 使散开； 粉碎， 破坏

sentences.english: The explosion shattered the building.
sentences.chinese: 这次爆炸把大楼炸成一片废墟。

sentences.english: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
sentences.chinese: 一场不幸的意外事故使她获得奥运奖牌的梦想破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

name: vaudeville
trans: 歌舞杂耍； 综合演出

sentences.english: For the next fifteen years she sang and danced in both Broadway and vaudeville shows.
sentences.chinese: 在此后的十五年中，她分别在百老汇和歌舞杂耍中演出。

sentences.english: Target girl is a term sometimes used in circus and vaudeville to denote a female assistant in "impalement" acts such as knife throwing, archery or sharpshooting.
sentences.chinese: 标靶女郎是有时用于马戏团和杂耍的一个词语，指的是在飞刀，射箭或飞镖之类“飞刺”节目中的女助手。

sentences.english: If the euro zone wants its currency to survive, it must stem the panic and make Italy’s vaudeville politics credible.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧元区希望它们的货币幸存，它必须遏制恐慌并使得意大利的杂耍般的政治变得可信。

detailed_translations.english: a type of theatre entertainment, popular from the 1880s to the 1950s, in which there were many short performances of different kinds, including singing, dancing, jokes etc

sentences.english: a resurrection of old jealousies
sentences.chinese: 昔日嫉妒心的再次出现

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which something old or forgotten returns or becomes important again

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

name: transfer
trans: 转移， 调动， 转职； 转车； 转业， 转学； 转让， 过户

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

sentences.english: an equally efficacious method of treatment
sentences.chinese: 同样有效的治疗方法

detailed_translations.english: working in the way you intended

name: diversion
trans: 转向， 转移， 变更

sentences.english: ...the illegal diversion of profits from secret arms sales.
sentences.chinese: …销售秘密武器所得收益的非法转移。

sentences.english: The party will make a pleasant diversion.
sentences.chinese: 晚会会是一个很不错的消遣。

detailed_translations.english: a change in the direction or use of something, or the act of changing it

name: affluence
trans: 富裕； 大量， 丰富

sentences.english: The postwar era was one of new affluence for the working class.
sentences.chinese: 战后时期是工人阶级新富期。

detailed_translations.english: Affluence is the state of having a lot of money or a high standard of living

sentences.english: If you test by the triangle's angles, possible types are right, acute, obtuse, or equiangular.
sentences.chinese: 如果您用三角形的角度进行测试，那么可能的类型是直角、锐角、钝角或等角三角形。

sentences.english: Microwave absorbing properties of the composites containing the planar equiangular spiral antenna arrays were investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究了含平面等角螺旋天线阵列吸波复合材料的微波吸收特性。

sentences.english: The author introduces the principle and properties of FI two-arms equiangular spiral antenna and Lp(logarithmically periodic)antenna.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了非频变特性的双臂等角平面螺旋天线和对数周期天线的工作原理和特性。

detailed_translations.english: having all angles equal

name: unscrupulous
trans: 肆无忌惮的， 无道德的； 不谨慎的

sentences.english: unscrupulous employers
sentences.chinese: 无耻的雇主

detailed_translations.chinese: 肆无忌惮的；寡廉鲜耻的；不讲道德的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unfair or dishonest way

sentences.english: The trip was made all the worse by Frankie’s morbid fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗基对坐飞机有种病态的恐惧，使得旅途变得更加糟糕。

sentences.english: His head was full of morbid thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑袋里全是不健康的思想。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病态的；由病引起的；恐怖的；病变部位的
detailed_translations.english: with a strong and unhealthy interest in unpleasant subjects, especially death

sentences.english: an autopsy report
sentences.chinese: 验尸报告

detailed_translations.chinese: 验尸；[病理][特医] 尸体解剖；[病理][特医] 尸体剖检
detailed_translations.english: an examination of a dead body to discover the cause of death

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

sentences.english: a nuclear limitation treaty
sentences.chinese: 核限制条约

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制， 限度； 局限
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

sentences.english: Physical education in the western regions lags behind that in the east, which mainly is a destitution of an innovation of sports culture.
sentences.chinese: 我国西部体育落后于东部地区，从根本上说，是缺乏体育文化创新。

sentences.english: Thanks to welfare schemes and unemployment benefits, many of which have their origins in those dark days, joblessness no longer plunges people into destitution, at least in the developed world.
sentences.chinese: 很多福利计划和失业救济金方案都发轫于那些灰暗的失业时期； 受惠于这些计划，至少发达国家的人们不再因为失业而陷入穷困。

detailed_translations.english: Destitution is the state of having no money or possessions

sentences.english: Her husband’s violence terrified her.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫的暴力行为让她感到害怕。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone extremely afraid

sentences.english: people who denigrate their own country
sentences.chinese: 贬损自己国家的人

detailed_translations.english: to say things to make someone or something seem less important or good

sentences.english: White House officials attempted to downplay the President’s role in the affair.
sentences.chinese: 白宫官员试图为总统在这一事件中的责任开脱。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem less important than it really is

name: inspiration
trans: 吸入， 吸气； 鼓舞， 激动； 灵感

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

name: alto
trans: 女低音； 女低音歌手

sentences.english: What are you, a soprano, an alto, or.
sentences.chinese: 你唱什么的， 女高音， 女低音，还是。

sentences.english: The four parts in singing are soprano , alto, tenor and bass.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌的四个声部是女高音、 女低音、 男高音和男低音。

sentences.english: It is a combination of the tenor and the alto.
sentences.chinese: 这是男高音和女低音的组合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女低音； 女低音歌手
detailed_translations.english: a singing voice that is lower than a  soprano  , or a singer with a voice like this
someone who watches students in an examination to make sure that they do not cheat
to invigilate (an examination)

sentences.english: a leading economic theorist
sentences.chinese: 重要经济学理论家

detailed_translations.english: someone who develops ideas within a particular subject that explain why particular things happen or are true

name: highlight
trans: 光线最强处； 最精彩的部分， 最重要的事件

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

sentences.english: On Friday the company's administrators sought permission from a Melbourne court to keep operating.
sentences.chinese: 在星期五，该公司的管理人员们从一家墨尔本法院取得了继续经营的许可。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job involves managing the work of a company or organization

sentences.english: The final cost could be as much as one billion dollars.
sentences.chinese: 最后的费用可能高达十亿美元。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1,000,000,000

name: sheer
trans: 全然的， 纯粹的； 绝对的， 彻底的； 极其薄的， 透明的； 峻峭的

sentences.english: cliffs which rose sheer from the sea
sentences.chinese: 从海面垂直拔起的悬崖

detailed_translations.english: straight up or down in an almost vertical line
to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的，十足的；陡峭的，垂直的；极薄的，透明的
detailed_translations.english: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical

name: compliment
trans: 称赞， 褒扬， 恭维

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: veracious
trans: 说真话的， 可靠的； 真实的， 正确的

sentences.english: With the rapid development of network and communication technologies, there comes an urgent and higher requirement on the verification, which should be more veracious, safe and practicable.
sentences.chinese: 随着网络技术与通信技术的飞速发展，现代社会对个人身份识别的准确性、安全性与实用性提出了更高的要求。

detailed_translations.english: habitually truthful or honest

name: sequester
trans: 使隐退； 使隔绝； 扣

sentences.english: The jury were sequestered during the trial.
sentences.chinese: 审判期间，陪审团被隔离开来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使隔绝；使隐退；没收，扣押
detailed_translations.english: to keep a person or a group of people away from other people

sentences.english: She will phrase a fugue of Bach's in these days.
sentences.chinese: 这几天她将把巴赫的赋格曲分成旋律分句。

sentences.english: The final movement, a robust and often dissonant fugue, is a precursor to Beethoven’s startling, gritty “Grosse Fuge,” composed as the final movement of his Opus 130 String Quartet.
sentences.chinese: 不协调的和音、爆裂刺耳的强音复调表现曲式是贝多芬大赋格曲的序奏部分。 他在弦乐四重奏作品130号也以此风格作为最后一个乐章。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of music with a tune that is repeated regularly in different  keys  by different voices or instruments

name: subvert
trans: 推翻； 搅乱， 暗中破坏

sentences.english: an attempt to subvert the democratic process
sentences.chinese: 颠覆民主进程的企图

detailed_translations.english: to try to destroy the power and influence of a government or the established system

sentences.english: Please pay the full amount (=  of money  ) by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 请在月底前全额付清。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

name: original
trans: 最初的，原始的，原文的；新颖的，有独创性的
原物， 原作， 原文

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

sentences.english: The leaves, bark and sap are also common ingredients of local herbal remedies.
sentences.chinese: 树叶、树皮和树液也是当地草药疗法的常用药材。

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 树液；精力，元气；活力；坑道
detailed_translations.english: the watery substance that carries food through a plant

detailed_translations.chinese: 使衰竭，使伤元气；挖掘以破坏基础

sentences.english: a photograph album
sentences.chinese: 相册

detailed_translations.chinese: 相簿；唱片集；集邮簿；签名纪念册
detailed_translations.english: a book that you put photographs, stamps etc in

name: adherence
trans: 黏着； 坚持； 忠诚

sentences.english: Holdbrooks has more in common with his former colleagues than he realises: their allegiance to the army is matched by his adherence to faith.
sentences.chinese: 霍德布鲁克与昔日同僚的相似之处比他意识到的还要多：他们对军队的效忠就好比他对信仰的坚持。

detailed_translations.english: when someone behaves according to a particular rule, belief, principle etc

name: arrant
trans: 彻头彻尾的； 声名狼藉的， 极恶的

sentences.english: What arrant nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 一派胡言！

detailed_translations.chinese: 极恶的；声名狼藉的；彻头彻尾的
detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how bad something is

sentences.english: The sauce was glutinous and tasted artificial.
sentences.chinese: 这种粘酱尝起来感觉不自然。

sentences.english: ...soft and glutinous mud.
sentences.chinese: ...柔软粘稠的泥巴。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is glutinous is very sticky

sentences.english: I was the first to go before the prosecutor.
sentences.chinese: 我是第一个被带到检察官面前的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 检察官； 起诉人， 原告
detailed_translations.english: In some countries, a prosecutor is a lawyer or official who brings charges against someone or tries to prove in a trial that they are guilty

sentences.english: the feudal system
sentences.chinese: 封建制度

sentences.english: feudal society
sentences.chinese: 封建社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 封建制度的；领地的；世仇的
detailed_translations.english: relating to feudalism

sentences.english: There is the source of the recurring pestilence .
sentences.chinese: 那里是一再发生瘟疫的策源地。

sentences.english: They were crazed by the famine and pestilence of that bitter winter .
sentences.chinese: 他们被那年严冬的饥荒与瘟疫逼疯了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that spreads quickly and kills a lot of people

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

name: facetious
trans: 幽默的， 滑稽的； 喜开玩笑的

sentences.english: Don’t be so facetious!
sentences.chinese: 别这么乱开玩笑！

sentences.english: facetious comments
sentences.chinese: 不当的戏谑评论

detailed_translations.chinese: 诙谐的；爱开玩笑的；滑稽的；(尤指在不合适的时候)开玩笑的
detailed_translations.english: saying things that are intended to be clever and funny but are really silly and annoying

sentences.english: He wanted to affiliate with a U.S. firm because he needed expert advice in legal affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他想成为一家美国公司的会员，因为他需要法律事务方面的专家意见。

detailed_translations.english: if a group or organization affiliates to or with another larger one, it forms a close connection with it
a company, organization etc that is connected with or controlled by a larger one

sentences.english: New genes emerge as dominant, no longer recessive or latent, and organisms change.
sentences.chinese: 新的基因出现并支配，不在隐性潜伏，然后生物就突变了。

sentences.english: Eye colour is inherited, however brown eyes are dominant across the world while blue eyes are a recessive trait.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛的颜色是天生的，世界上褐色眼睛占主导地位，而蓝色眼睛是一种隐性特征。

sentences.english: The reports said blond hair was caused by a recessive gene, so both sides of the family have to have it to extend the shade into the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 报道中说金发是由一种隐性基因造成，因此只有在家庭中的双方都携带这种基因的情况下这种发色才能遗传给下一代。

detailed_translations.english: a recessive  gene  is passed to children from their parents only if both parents have the gene

sentences.english: It is a big airline with a large fleet of planes.
sentences.chinese: 这是一家大航空公司，拥有庞大的机群。

sentences.english: It’s much quicker to go by plane.
sentences.chinese: 乘飞机去会快很多。

sentences.english: She slept on the plane.
sentences.chinese: 她在飞机上睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that flies in the air and has wings and at least one engine

name: equivalent
trans: 相等的，等价的，等值的；等面积的；等体积的
相等物， 等价物， 等值物

sentences.english: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

sentences.english: There was a momentary pause.
sentences.chinese: 停顿了片刻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬间的；短暂的；随时会发生的
detailed_translations.english: continuing for a very short time

sentences.english: It would be hypocritical to say I travel at 70 mph simply because that is the law.
sentences.chinese: 如果仅仅因为法律规定的时速是70英里我就说自己的行驶时速是70英里，那就太虚伪了。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is different from what you claim to believe – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Don't gloat,the same misfortune may happen to you one day.
sentences.chinese: 不要幸灾乐祸，说不定同样的不幸会落到你的头上。

sentences.english: Yet, in announcing the news to the United States and the world, Obama was careful not to gloat, as his predecessor George W Bush might well have done had the killing taken place under his watch.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在向美国和世界宣布这个消息时，奥巴马却显的小心谨慎，没有表现出一点幸灾乐祸，因为他的前任乔治·布什任期内没有完成的事情被他完成了。

sentences.english: It is easy to gloat when the cool jock with the hot girlfriend wrecks his sweet car, especially if he seems kind of smug.
sentences.chinese: 当酷酷的大学运动员和热辣的女友坐他的爱车失事后，特别是这人有些自以为是，那么幸灾乐祸的想法是很自然会产生的。

sentences.english: She was christened Sarah.
sentences.chinese: 她在受洗时取名萨拉。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give a child its name at a Christian religious ceremony

detailed_translations.chinese: (Christen)人名；(法、德、西、丹、挪)克里斯滕；(英)克里森

name: sensational
trans: 轰动性的， 引起哗然的

sentences.english: a sensational discovery
sentences.chinese: 引起轰动的发现

sentences.english: The show was a sensational success.
sentences.chinese: 这次演出取得了轰动性的成功。

sentences.english: a sensational 6-0 victory
sentences.chinese: 轰动性的6比0大胜

detailed_translations.chinese: 轰动的；耸人听闻的；非常好的；使人感动的
detailed_translations.english: very interesting, exciting, and surprising

name: depraved
trans: 堕落的， 颓废的； 邪恶的

sentences.english: a killer’s depraved mind
sentences.chinese: 凶手邪恶的内心世界

detailed_translations.english: completely evil or morally unacceptable

detailed_translations.chinese: 使腐化（deprave的过去式和过去分词）

name: facile
trans: 易做到的， 易得到的； 熟练的， 流畅的；  柔顺的， 温和的

sentences.english: facile generalizations
sentences.chinese: 肤浅的概括

detailed_translations.english: a facile remark, argument etc is too simple and shows a lack of careful thought or understanding

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

sentences.english: Their feet will trample on the dead bodies of their perfidious aggressors.
sentences.chinese: 他们将从背信弃义的侵略者的尸体上踏过。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is perfidious is not loyal and cannot be trusted

name: plague
trans: 祸患， 瘟疫， 灾害

sentences.english: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
sentences.chinese: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

detailed_translations.english: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

sentences.english: In retrospect, I wonder if we should have done more.
sentences.chinese: 回过头看，我在想我们是否应该做得更多些。

detailed_translations.english: thinking back to a time in the past, especially with the advantage of knowing more now than you did then

sentences.english: Smoking is banned in the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

name: canon
trans: 教规；  正典， 经典圣经；  真作集

sentences.english: the Shakespearean canon
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚真作集

detailed_translations.english: a list of books or pieces of music that are officially recognized as being the work of a certain writer

sentences.english: Being apposition of human being and the way of human being, history and practice are present in the state of the mutual objective existence of each other and create each other in their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 历史与实践是人类存在和存在方式的同位语，两者互为对象性而存在着并在其相互作用中互相创造。

detailed_translations.english: in grammar, an occasion when a simple sentence contains two or more noun phrases that describe the same thing or person, appearing one after the other without a word such as ‘and’ or ‘or’ between them. For example, in the sentence ‘The defendant, a woman of thirty, denies kicking the policeman’ the two phrases ‘the defendant’ and ‘a woman of thirty’ are in apposition.

name: fascinate
trans: 使着迷； 使神魂颠倒

sentences.english: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.
sentences.chinese: 政治让富兰克林的父亲着迷。

detailed_translations.english: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

name: diplomatic
trans: 外交的， 老练的； 策略的， 有手腕的

sentences.english: Diplomatic efforts to end the fighting began on October 25.
sentences.chinese: 停战的外交努力于10月25日开始。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the work of diplomats

sentences.english: ...a slide projector.
sentences.chinese: …幻灯机。

detailed_translations.chinese: [仪] 投影仪；放映机；探照灯；设计者
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a film or picture appear on a screen or flat surface

name: importunate
trans: 不断要求的， 急切的

sentences.english: importunate demands
sentences.chinese: 无理的要求

detailed_translations.english: continuously asking for things in an annoying or unreasonable way

name: percipient
trans: 感知的； 有觉察力的

sentences.english: For music and clothing i have special percipient.
sentences.chinese: 我对音乐和服装都有独特的鉴赏力。

sentences.english: Its theme decorates the expression of the hobby that is domestic host and appeal, it has very big effect to the promotion of interior edify and percipient .
sentences.chinese: 其主题装饰就是家庭主人的爱好和情趣的表现，它对心灵陶冶和鉴赏力的提升有很大作用。

detailed_translations.chinese: 目光敏锐的；有洞察力的
detailed_translations.english: quick to notice and understand things
a person or thing that perceives

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

sentences.english: He is not allowed solid food yet, only fluids.
sentences.chinese: 他还不能吃固体食物，只能进流食。

sentences.english: a powerful cleaning fluid
sentences.chinese: 一种强力清洁液

detailed_translations.english: a liquid
fluid movements are smooth, relaxed, and graceful

sentences.english: Drowning is the process of experiencing respiratory impairment from submersion/immersion in liquid; outcomes are classified as death, morbidity and no morbidity.
sentences.chinese: 溺水是因淹没/浸入在液体中造成呼吸受阻的过程；其结果分为死亡、发病和安然无恙。

sentences.english: A new type of rice that can survive total submersion for more than two weeks has passed its field tests with "flying colours, " say researchers, and is now close to official release.
sentences.chinese: 科学家说，一种可以耐受完全淹没达两星期以上的新型水稻品种“大获全胜”，通过了大田试验并正在接近正式释放。

sentences.english: The second variation formula of vertical energy functional for a submersion between Riemannian manifolds is calculated with a simple and direct manner.
sentences.chinese: 对于黎曼流形的浸没建立了垂直能量泛函的二阶变分公式，研究强垂直调和映射的稳定性。

detailed_translations.english: the action of going under water, or the state of being completely covered in liquid

sentences.english: The bass guitar began to thump so loudly that it resonated in my head.
sentences.chinese: 低音吉他开始砰然作响，震得我的脑袋嗡嗡的。

detailed_translations.english: if something such as an event or a message resonates, it seems important or good to people, or continues to do this

sentences.english: a political pamphlet
sentences.chinese: 政治宣传册

detailed_translations.english: a very thin book with paper covers, that gives information about something

sentences.english: Several writers have posited the idea of a universal consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 几个作者都假设一种普遍意识的思想。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that a particular idea should be accepted as a fact

name: ornate
trans: 装饰的， 华丽的；  绚丽的

sentences.english: an ornate gold mirror
sentences.chinese: 华丽的金镜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的
detailed_translations.english: covered with a lot of decoration

sentences.english: The preparation process consists of pretreatment , acid hydrolysis, neutralization , decoloration and concentration.
sentences.chinese: 其制备工艺包括原料的预处理、酸水解、中和、脱色和浓缩。

sentences.english: By means of comparison, the superiority of ultrafiltration process and neutralization/condensation/precipitation process is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 同时对膜污染的机理进行了探讨，通过对比，分析了超滤法较中和凝聚沉淀法的优势。

sentences.english: The absorption device of neutralization tail gas is improved by phosphoric acid absorbing gas ammonia in neutralization tail gas and circulation absorption fluid returning to acid mixing unit.
sentences.chinese: 对传统中和尾气吸收装置进行改造，利用磷酸吸收中和尾气中的气氨，循环吸收液重新返回混酸系统使用。

name: proliferate
trans: 繁殖， 繁衍； 激增

sentences.english: Computer courses continue to proliferate.
sentences.chinese: 计算机课程层出不穷。

detailed_translations.english: if something proliferates, it increases quickly and spreads to many different places

name: disclaim
trans: 放弃， 弃权； 拒绝

sentences.english: She disclaims any knowledge of her husband's business.
sentences.chinese: 她声称自己对她丈夫的生意一无所知。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否认，拒绝；放弃，弃权；拒绝承认
detailed_translations.english: to state, especially officially, that you are not responsible for something, that you do not know about it, or that you are not involved with it

sentences.english: In some churches, they speak Latin, but in others they use the vernacular.
sentences.chinese: 在一些教堂中，人们讲拉丁语，但在其他一些教堂中，人们使用本地话。

sentences.english: The common speech of a people; the vernacular.
sentences.chinese: 本国语，不规范语一个民族普通的语言；地方话。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本国话；方言；土语；民间风格
detailed_translations.english: a form of a language that ordinary people use, especially one that is not the official language

name: hazardous
trans: 危险的， 冒险的； 碰运气的

sentences.english: the disposal of hazardous waste
sentences.chinese: 有害废弃物的处理

detailed_translations.english: dangerous, especially to people’s health or safety

sentences.english: Of, like, or in an artery or arteries.
sentences.chinese: 动脉的动脉的，似动脉的，或在动脉里的。

sentences.english: When they are found, doctors pass a tube with a balloon into the narrowed area and inflate the balloon to compress plaque deposits against the side of the artery.
sentences.chinese: 当它们被发现后，医生通过一个软管把一个小气球进入狭小的区域并且膨胀这个气球去压缩动脉边沉淀下来的血小板。

sentences.english: This term is used to describe a condition in which the blood supply to part of the brain is suddenly and critically impaired by a blood clot or when a ruptured artery leaks blood into the brain.
sentences.chinese: 该术语是用来形容如下的一种情况：提供给大脑部分的血液突然地削弱，这种削弱是由于血液的凝固或由于动脉割裂导致血液漏到大脑里面。

detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body

sentences.english: Jacobs was a stout, florid man.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布斯是个身材结实，脸色红润的男人。

sentences.english: a plastic spoon
sentences.chinese: 塑料汤匙

sentences.english: plastic bags
sentences.chinese: 塑料袋

detailed_translations.english: made of plastic

name: transient
trans: 短促的， 片刻的， 一瞬间的； 暂住的， 临时的

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

sentences.english: When she had an affair with her friend's husband, she wittingly set off a chain of crises.
sentences.chinese: 她和她朋友的丈夫私通，故意激起了一连串危机。

detailed_translations.english: If you do something wittingly, you are fully aware of what you are doing and what its consequences will be

sentences.english: He faces six charges of bringing the game into disrepute .
sentences.chinese: 他面临六项破坏这项运动声誉的指控。

sentences.english: This theory fell into disrepute in the fifties.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论在50年代时声誉尽失。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people no longer admire or trust someone or something

name: sonorous
trans: 洪亮的， 响亮的； 能发出响亮的声音的 		【记】	词根记忆： son  + orous → 声音洪亮的

sentences.english: a sonorous voice
sentences.chinese: 洪亮的嗓音

detailed_translations.chinese: 响亮的；作响的；能发出响亮声音的
detailed_translations.english: having a pleasantly deep loud sound

sentences.english: a canny political advisor
sentences.chinese: 精明的政治顾问

detailed_translations.english: clever, careful, and not easily deceived, especially in business or politics

name: hesitation
trans: 踌躇， 含糊； 口吃， 停顿

sentences.english: After some hesitation one of them began to speak.
sentences.chinese: 犹豫了一会儿之后，他们中有一个人开口了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone hesitates

name: neophyte
trans: 新入修道院者； 新信徒

sentences.english: ...the self-proclaimed political neophyte Ross Perot.
sentences.chinese: ...一个自命为政治新手的叫罗斯·佩罗的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新信徒；新入教者；初学者
detailed_translations.english: someone who has just started to learn a particular skill, art, job etc

sentences.english: Ted loves everything about books. He is a real bibliophile.
sentences.chinese: 泰德喜爱所有与书籍有关的事物。他真是一个爱书人。

sentences.english: They brought about a lot of valuable books that to a great extent made Qian Qianyi the greatest bibliophile at that time.
sentences.chinese: 这些书贾带来大量珍本、秘本，为钱谦益成为当时最大的藏书家做出了不容低估的贡献。

sentences.english: Dating a book nerd is serious business, and only a fellow bibliophile can keep pace with the obscure Jane Austen references or the conversation sprinkled with the witticism of Oscar Wilde.
sentences.chinese: 和一个书呆子约会是严肃的事情，只有一个藏书家才能听懂晦涩的简奥斯丁引语或与奥斯卡·王尔德的俏皮话并驾齐驱。

detailed_translations.english: someone who likes books

sentences.english: Study and investigation of this strange idiom lead to the mysterious point of intersection of regular society with society which is accursed.
sentences.chinese: 对这种奇特语言深入的钻研能把人引向正常社会和那被诅咒的社会幽奥的交叉点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 被诅咒的；讨厌的；可憎的
detailed_translations.english: used to show that something makes you very angry

name: insulate
trans: 隔离， 孤立； 使绝缘， 使绝热

sentences.english: an insulated attic
sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.english: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

sentences.english: ...an ever increasing scarcity of water.
sentences.chinese: …越来越匮乏的水资源。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is not enough of something

name: icon
trans: 图标； 偶像； 雕像

sentences.english: To open a new file, click on the icon.
sentences.chinese: 要打开新文档，点击该图标。

detailed_translations.chinese: 图标；偶像；肖像，画像；圣像
detailed_translations.english: a small sign or picture on a computer screen that is used to start a particular operation

name: onerous
trans: 繁重的； 麻烦的； 负有法律责任的

sentences.english: an onerous task
sentences.chinese: 艰巨的任务

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁重的；麻烦的；负有义务的；负有法律责任的
detailed_translations.english: work or a responsibility that is onerous is difficult and worrying or makes you tired

name: fervid
trans: 热烈的， 热情的， 激烈的

sentences.english: It assailed her with all the violence of her fervid imagination.
sentences.chinese: 它以那种她热情想象的全部猛力袭击着她。

sentences.english: Has a girl of fourteen a heart large enough, vigorous enough, to hold the swelling spring of pure, full, fervid eloquence?
sentences.chinese: 一个十四岁的女孩有这样活跃、这样宽大的胸怀，装得下这纯洁、充盈、炽热的雄辩之泉么？

detailed_translations.english: believing or feeling something too strongly

sentences.english: Two of her toes were amputated because of frostbite.
sentences.chinese: 她的两个脚趾因为冻伤被截掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to cut off someone’s arm, leg, finger etc during a medical operation

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

sentences.english: This is the only effectual way to secure our present and future happiness.
sentences.chinese: 这是确保我们现在和未来幸福的唯一有效途径。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奏效的；会应验的；有法律效力的
detailed_translations.english: producing the result that was wanted or intended

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

sentences.english: subsequent pages of the book
sentences.chinese: 接下去的书页

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming after something else

name: omission
trans: 省略， 忽略， 疏忽

sentences.english: Copies of the lists were posted so that omissions could be corrected.
sentences.chinese: 多份名单被张贴出来，以便更正遗漏之处。

detailed_translations.english: when you do not include or do not do something

name: metabolic
trans: 变化的； 新陈代谢的

sentences.english: Exercise can increase your metabolic rate.
sentences.chinese: 运动可以提高新陈代谢率。

sentences.english: the metabolic activity of the brain
sentences.chinese: 大脑的新陈代谢活动

detailed_translations.chinese: 代谢作用的， 新陈代谢的
detailed_translations.english: relating to your body’s metabolism

sentences.english: News of 160 lay-offs had sent tremors through the community.
sentences.chinese: 裁员160人的消息在社区中引起了波动。

detailed_translations.english: If an event causes a tremor in a group or organization, it threatens to make the group or organization less strong or stable

sentences.english: House prices have plummeted down.
sentences.chinese: 房价已经暴跌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 垂直落下；（价格、水平等）骤然下跌
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly and quickly decrease in value or amount

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

name: punctuate
trans: 加标点于； 不时打断； 强调

sentences.english: The silence was occasionally punctuated by laughter.
sentences.chinese: 寂静间或被笑声打破。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不时打断；强调；加标点于
detailed_translations.english: to divide written work into sentences, phrases etc using  comma s  ,  full stop s  etc

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

sentences.english: The savage civil war there could be a portent of what's to come in the rest of the region.
sentences.chinese: 那里的野蛮战争可能预示着该地区将要发生什么事情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 前兆；预示；迹象；异常之物
detailed_translations.english: a sign or warning that something is going to happen

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

sentences.english: ...recent biographies of Stalin.
sentences.chinese: …近年的斯大林传记。

detailed_translations.english: a book that tells what has happened in someone’s life, written by someone else

name: integrate
trans: 成为一体，  结合在一起，  合并

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

sentences.english: Privately, Zarich was piqued that his offer was rejected.
sentences.chinese: 提议遭到拒绝，扎里克私下里很气愤。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or upset, especially by ignoring them or making them look stupid
a feeling of being annoyed or upset, especially because someone has ignored you or insulted you

name: pompous
trans: 华而不实的； 自命不凡的； 浮华的

sentences.english: He seems rather pompous.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去相当自负。

sentences.english: the book’s pompous style
sentences.chinese: 该书浮夸的文风

detailed_translations.chinese: 自大的；浮夸的；华而不实的；爱炫耀的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is pompous thinks that they are important, and shows this by being very formal and using long words – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: It may be tempting for some to decry incentives as nothing but a poisonous fruit of Con-Lib responsibility thinking.
sentences.chinese: 对一些人谴责激励机制只是作为“新政治”责任思考的毒果这样的结论本身是很冒险的。

sentences.english: I know ‘tis the season to decry all things materialistic, but just as we’re inspired by people we are also inspired by things.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是谴责所有事情物质化的时候了，然而正如我们被人所激励一样，我们也受事物的激励。

sentences.english: All of that is grist for the mill for the Russian media, which is popular in the east of the country and uses every opportunity to decry "fascism" in Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都像谷物被放进研磨机中一样，被俄国媒体粉碎，后者在这个国家的东部地区广受欢迎，并利用一切机会谴责乌克兰国内的“法西斯主义”。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that you do not approve of something

sentences.english: So that satisfies the definition of validity.
sentences.chinese: 所以这满足了有效性的定义。

sentences.english: Does this argument satisfy the definition of validity or does it not?
sentences.chinese: 这个论点满足有效性的定义吗？,还是不满足？

sentences.english: While each of these might have some validity, in many cases the same general comments may also apply to many of the other projects you work on.
sentences.chinese: 尽管其中每个问题可能具有某些正确性，但是在许多情况下，一般性评论还可能适用于您从事的其他项目。

name: earnest
trans: 热心的， 诚挚的， 认真的

sentences.english: a rather earnest young man
sentences.chinese: 相当认真的一个年轻人

sentences.english: Matthews was in earnest conversation with a young girl.
sentences.chinese: 马修斯在和一个年轻姑娘认真地谈话。

sentences.english: an earnest desire to offer something useful to society
sentences.chinese: 为社会做贡献的真诚愿望

detailed_translations.english: very serious and sincere
if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before

sentences.english: Pollution led to a shrinkage of grasslands.
sentences.chinese: 污染导致草原面积缩小。

detailed_translations.english: the act of shrinking, or the amount that something shrinks

sentences.english: Do you think that the spider can web anything?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得这蜘蛛能用网捕住什么吗?

sentences.english: Why not hold spider of the week contests in your home throughout this season?
sentences.chinese: 在这整个蜘蛛出没的季节里，为什么不在你家里举行蜘蛛周竞赛？

sentences.english: Likewise, by these investigators’ logic, male arachnophobes should get a mild tickle down there whenever they spy a spider scurrying across their desk.
sentences.chinese: 同样的，按这些研究者的逻辑，男性蜘蛛恐惧者每次看到蜘蛛爬过桌子都应该下身瘙痒咯？

detailed_translations.english: a small creature with eight legs, which catches insects using a fine network of sticky threads

sentences.english: They spend an inordinate amount of time talking.
sentences.chinese: 他们聊天时间长得超乎想像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过度的；无节制的；紊乱的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as inordinate, you are emphasizing that it is unusually or excessively great in amount or degree

sentences.english: She could hardly expect her employer to provide her with testimonials to her character and ability.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎不指望老板会给她写证明她的人品和能力的证明书。

detailed_translations.english: a formal written statement describing someone’s character and abilities

name: precede
trans: 领先 ， 在  前； 优先， 先于

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.english: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

sentences.english: I hate to disillusion you, but I don’t think she’s coming back.
sentences.chinese: 我真不愿意让你失望，但我想她是不会回来了。

sentences.english: There is disillusion with established political parties.
sentences.chinese: 对各个确立的政党有幻灭感。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone realize that something which they thought was true or good is not really true or good
Disillusion is the same as

sentences.english: humorous stories
sentences.chinese: 诙谐的故事

sentences.english: The film has some mildly humorous moments.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影中有些略显幽默的片段。

detailed_translations.english: funny and enjoyable

sentences.english: You shouldn’t deride their efforts.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该嘲笑他们的努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make remarks or jokes that show you think someone or something is silly or useless

name: vehement
trans: 激烈的， 猛烈的；  热烈的

sentences.english: She suddenly became very vehement and agitated, jumping around and shouting.
sentences.chinese: 她突然变得十分激动和不安，四处暴跳并大喊大叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感情强烈的；热烈的；(人)有强烈感情的
detailed_translations.english: showing very strong feelings or opinions

name: differentiate
trans: 区分， 区别；  不同

sentences.english: What differentiates these two periods of history?
sentences.chinese: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

detailed_translations.chinese: 区分， 区别； 使不同， 使有差异
detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

sentences.english: She is so reticent about her achievements.
sentences.chinese: 她对于自己的成就如此缄默。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉默的；有保留的；谨慎的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is reticent does not tell people about things

sentences.english: The study has also been cited as compelling evidence for screening by the patient advocacy group Lung Cancer Alliance.
sentences.chinese: 此研究已经被肺癌联盟的拥护此筛查方案的病人群体作为一种强有力的证据所引用。

detailed_translations.english: public support for a course of action or way of doing things

sentences.english: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.english: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

detailed_translations.english: communication with a person, organization, country etc
to write to or telephone someone

name: discharge
trans: 正式准许〔某人〕离开〔尤指让病人出院或让军人退伍等〕；通知〔病人〕出院；开除〔士兵〕军籍

sentences.english: Sewage is discharged directly into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 污水被直接排放到海里。

sentences.english: the discharge of toxic waste into the sea
sentences.chinese: 有毒废物向海里的排放

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, liquid, smoke etc, or to allow it to escape
when gas, liquid, smoke etc is sent out, or the substance that is sent out

sentences.english: Her telephone number differs from mine by one digit.
sentences.chinese: 她的电话号码跟我的差一个数字。

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；手指或足趾；一指宽
detailed_translations.english: one of the written signs that represent the numbers 0 to 9

name: disadvantage
trans: 不便， 不利， 不利的情况；  损害， 损失

sentences.english: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

detailed_translations.english: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective

name: suspicious
trans: 可疑的， 令人怀疑的

sentences.english: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
sentences.chinese: 他不愿回答我的问题，这引起我的怀疑。

sentences.english: She gave him a suspicious glance.
sentences.chinese: 她向他投去怀疑的一瞥。

sentences.english: You’ve got a very suspicious mind!
sentences.chinese: 你真是疑心太重！

detailed_translations.english: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

sentences.english: ...his zeal for teaching.
sentences.chinese: …他对教学的热衷。

detailed_translations.english: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

name: polygamy
trans: 一夫多妻制， 一妻多夫制

sentences.english: Abuse and coercion are only the most obvious dangers of polygamy .
sentences.chinese: 滥交和强迫性行为只是一夫多妻制最显见的危害所在。

sentences.english: The sect, which broke from the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints more than a century ago, believes polygamy brings glorification in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 这个教派，原本是一个多世纪以前从摩门教末世圣徒教会分离出来的，相信一夫多妻制可以升上天堂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一夫多妻制， 一妻多夫制
detailed_translations.english: the practice of having more than one husband or wife at the same time

sentences.english: His epitaph for himself would have well suited man as he wanted him to be.
sentences.chinese: 他为自己写的墓志铭非常适合像他所期望成为的那种人。

sentences.english: No shockwave swept through the Arab world as news of Bin Laden's death spread, and that is perhaps the most fitting epitaph.
sentences.chinese: 拉登死讯的传播并未形成席卷阿拉伯世界的冲击波，也许这个作为墓志铭是再合适不过的了。

sentences.english: I would say that all of those ways of reading the epitaph are consistent with hermeneutics.
sentences.chinese: 可以说所有这些解读这条墓志铭的方法,都和现代阐释学相一致。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of writing on the stone over someone’s grave(= place in the ground where someone is buried )

name: renovate
trans: 革新； 刷新， 修复

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

name: crepuscular
trans: 朦胧的； 拂晓的； 黄昏的

sentences.english: ...peering through the crepuscular gloom.
sentences.chinese: ...透过昏暗的暮色凝视。

detailed_translations.english: Crepuscular means relating to

sentences.english: As a mediator, America could work to prevent what the reportcalls violence created from insecurity in Southeast Asia and the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个调停者，美国可以做一些工作，去防止该份报告认为的在东南亚和中东地区的不稳定引发的暴力行为。

sentences.english: All proposals were rejected by the mediator.
sentences.chinese: 所有的建议都被仲裁人驳回。

detailed_translations.english: a person or organization that tries to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc by discussion

sentences.english: You must write in a clear and lucid style.
sentences.chinese: 你的写作风格一定要清楚易懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明晰的；透明的；易懂的；头脑清楚的
detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand

name: invidious
trans: 易招嫉妒的， 有害的； 诽谤的

sentences.english: By innocently lying to detectives, she’d put herselfinaninvidious position.
sentences.chinese: 由于无意间向侦探撒了谎，她把自己置于一个尴尬的境地。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诽谤的；不公平的；引起反感的；易招嫉妒的
detailed_translations.english: unpleasant, especially because it is likely to offend people or make you unpopular

name: humane
trans: 有人性的， 有同情心的

sentences.english: the campaign for the humane treatment of criminals
sentences.chinese: 提倡人道地对待罪犯的运动

sentences.english: a better, more humane world
sentences.chinese: 更美好、更人道的社会

detailed_translations.english: treating people or animals in a way that is not cruel and causes them as little suffering as possible

sentences.english: a perpendicular line
sentences.chinese: 垂直线

sentences.english: a perpendicular wall of rock
sentences.chinese: 直立的石壁

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

sentences.chinese: 模型和卫星传感器都使用红外能量来进行云的估算。

sentences.english: It didn’t trouble me unduly.
sentences.chinese: 这事并没有让我太烦恼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过度地；不适当地；不正当地
detailed_translations.english: more than is normal or reasonable

sentences.english: an insolent tone of voice
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的语气

sentences.english: You insolent child!
sentences.chinese: 你这个没礼貌的孩子！

detailed_translations.chinese: 无礼的；傲慢的；粗野的；无耻的
detailed_translations.english: rude and not showing any respect

sentences.english: With a little guile she might get what she wanted.
sentences.chinese: 她略施小计，也许就能得到自己想要的东西。

detailed_translations.english: the use of clever but dishonest methods to deceive someone

sentences.english: Automatic logoff feature helps alleviate such risks by automatically disabling the session using recommended time-out values for dormancy.
sentences.chinese: 自动下线特性通过对休眠使用推荐的超时值，可以帮助降低此类风险。

sentences.english: All nine were put in dimensional locks, essentially powered down into energetic dormancy through the technology of the Alliance. Many other magnificent Temple Crystals were lost.
sentences.chinese: 这 九个水晶都放置着维度锁，基本上经由(外星)联盟的技术将其能量降至休眠的状态 。

sentences.english: After a 20-year period of dormancy, the volcanobegan to erupt once more.
sentences.chinese: 在20年的休眠后，这座火山又再一次肆虐。

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

sentences.english: You are well advised to buy your car through a reputable dealer.
sentences.chinese: 你通过一个声誉好的经销商来买车是明智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声誉好的；受尊敬的；卓越的
detailed_translations.english: respected for being honest or for doing good work

sentences.english: There is no mention of betrothal or marriage rings in this or any other edition of the bible.
sentences.chinese: 在这本圣经以及其他版本的圣经中都没有提及订婚戒指或是结婚戒指。

sentences.english: It should be noted that the betrothal of a marriage can happen at any time, and often will occur at birth.
sentences.chinese: 应当注意到，在印度，婚约是任何时候都可以确定的，而且经常发生在约定的对象刚出生时。

sentences.english: Conventionally, the ring is presented as a betrothal gift by a man to his prospective spouse while he proposes marriage or directly after she accepts his marriage proposal.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，男方会在向女方求婚或者女方答应求婚后将戒指作为礼物在订婚仪式上送给女方。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement that two people will be married

sentences.english: For me, it represents a potent adjunct to antidepressant medications and, for some patients, it’s something you can take in lieu of pills.
sentences.chinese: 对于我，它是一个抗抑郁剂曾用药物的强有力的助手，对一些病人来说，它是能够代替药丸的东西。

sentences.english: " Lyte urges caution as well."It MAY, in really big capitals, prove to be an adjunct to therapy, but there are a number of steps that need to be done.
sentences.chinese: 我们在花费了大量的人力物力之后，也许，也许证明它可以成为一种附属的治疗手段，但是我们仍然有大量的工作要做。

detailed_translations.english: something that is added or joined to something that is bigger or more important

sentences.english: Were his motives entirely altruistic?
sentences.chinese: 他的动机是完全无私的吗？

detailed_translations.english: altruistic behaviour shows that you care about and will help other people, even though this brings no advantage for yourself

sentences.english: I don’t drink alcohol anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我不再喝酒了。

sentences.english: alcohol abuse
sentences.chinese: 酗酒

sentences.english: people with alcohol problems
sentences.chinese: 有酗酒问题的人

detailed_translations.english: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

name: sycophant
trans: 拍马屁的人， 谄媚者， 奉承者

sentences.english: a dictator surrounded by sycophants
sentences.chinese: 被阿谀奉承者包围的独裁者

detailed_translations.english: someone who praises powerful people too much because they want to get something from them – used in order to show disapproval

sentences.english: Speaking through an interpreter (= using an interpreter ), Ahmed said, ‘I’m very worried about my wife and children.’
sentences.chinese: 艾哈迈德通过口译者说:“我很担心我的妻子和孩子们。”

detailed_translations.english: someone who changes spoken words from one language into an-other, especially as their job

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: exculpate
trans: 开脱； 申明  无罪

sentences.english: These causes, however, never served to exculpate "ordinary Germans" who shared in the guilt either for participating in or not resisting Nazi rule in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 但这些原因，都不足以证明所谓“德国平民”是无罪的，因为他们有些也参与了这场罪行，至少并没有反抗纳粹在德国的统治。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开脱； 申明无罪， 证明无罪
detailed_translations.english: to prove that someone is not guilty of something

sentences.english: Sorry, I miscounted – we need ten copies, not nine.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我数错了——我们需要十份复印件，不是九份。

sentences.english: The votes were deliberately miscounted.
sentences.chinese: 选票被故意数错了。

detailed_translations.english: to count wrongly
a false count or calculation

name: secondary
trans: 第二的； 间接的， 非原始的

sentences.english: the novel’s secondary characters
sentences.chinese: 这本小说中的次要人物

detailed_translations.chinese: 第二的；中等的；次要的；中级的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as something else
to shake or move up and down slightly, or to make something move in this way
the act of joggling

name: transgenic animals
trans: [遗] 转基因动物，转化的动物

sentences.english: From todays progress of transgenic animals, we can know there is great prospect of application in biological reactor and human apparatus transplant.
sentences.chinese: 从目前的发展来看，转基因动物在生物发生器、人类器官移植等方面有广阔的应用前景。

detailed_translations.chinese: [遗] 转基因动物，转化的动物

sentences.english: a remorseless murderer
sentences.chinese: 一个冷酷的杀手

detailed_translations.chinese: 冷酷的；不知过错的；坚持不懈的；不屈不挠的
detailed_translations.english: cruel, and not caring how much other people are hurt

sentences.english: The guards hustled Harry out of the car.
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们把哈里从车子里拉了出来。

detailed_translations.english: If you hustle someone, you try to make them go somewhere or do something quickly, for example by pulling or pushing them along
busy and noisy activity

name: affront
trans: 公开侮辱， 冒犯； 面对

sentences.english: He stepped back, affronted by the question.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得这个问题语带冒犯，退后了几步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冒犯，有意冒犯；面对；公开侮辱
detailed_translations.english: to offend or insult someone, especially by not showing respect
a remark or action that offends or insults someone

detailed_translations.chinese: 注意的；深切注意的；深切留心的

sentences.english: an electric motor
sentences.chinese: 电动马达

sentences.english: That’s a nice motor you’ve got, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 你这车不错啊，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

name: sermonize
trans: 讲道， 布道； 对…说教

sentences.english: Never try to sermonize her.
sentences.chinese: 千万别对她进行说教。

sentences.english: The film attempts neither to dramatize nor sermonize.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影既不企图使用戏剧化的手法也不企图进行说教。

sentences.english: Wang Tai never sermonize but his students learn a lot from him.
sentences.chinese: 王骀从不说教，可是到他那学东西的人都是满载而归。

detailed_translations.english: to give a lot of moral advice to someone when they do not want it – used to show disapproval

name: access
trans: 接近，进入；入口，通道；接近的方法

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: primitive
trans: 原始的， 远古的， 早期的； 粗糙的， 简单的

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: a primitive nomadic tribe
sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.english: the tools used by primitive man
sentences.chinese: 原始人所用的工具

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
sentences.chinese: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 原始的；简单的；简单的，简陋的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

name: overcome
trans: 战胜， 克服， 胜过； 征服

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

name: obliterate
trans: 消灭， 冲刷 ； 忘却； 涂抹， 遮蔽； 擦去

sentences.english: Nothing could obliterate the memory of those tragic events.
sentences.chinese: 那些悲惨事件的记忆是无法抹去的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a thought, feeling, or memory from someone’s mind

sentences.english: The ruling obligates airlines to release information about their flight delays.
sentences.chinese: 这一裁决迫使航空公司公布航班晚点信息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使负义务；强使，强迫；对…施以恩惠
detailed_translations.english: to make someone have to do something, because it is the law, their duty, or the right thing to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 有责任的，有义务的；必需的

name: ken
trans: 视野； 知识领域， 见地

sentences.english: mysteries beyond our ken
sentences.chinese: 我们无法理解的神秘事物

detailed_translations.chinese: 视野范围，见地，知识范围
detailed_translations.english: if something is beyond your ken, you have no knowledge or understanding of it

name: transpire
trans: 发生； 使蒸发； 使排出； 泄露

sentences.english: It now transpires that he kept all the money for himself.
sentences.chinese: 事实已经清楚，他把所有的钱都据为己有了。

detailed_translations.english: if it transpires that something is true, you discover that it is true

sentences.english: " Cornett's attorney, Jack Johnston, said the tooth "looks like it would be from a herbivorous rodent of some type.
sentences.chinese: 科内特的律师杰克·约翰斯顿说，这颗牙“看起来像是某种食草的啮齿类动物的牙。”

sentences.english: 'Chewing is a property which no large herbivorous terrestrial mammal has got rid of, ' said Professor Martin Sander, from Bonn University.
sentences.chinese: “现在，没有大型陆生食草哺乳动物是不需要咀嚼的，”波恩大学的马丁·桑德教授说。

sentences.english: The camel is a herbivorous animal.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼是一种食草动物。

detailed_translations.english: Herbivorous animals only eat plants

sentences.english: I made the then heretical suggestion that it might be cheaper to design new machines.
sentences.chinese: 我提出了当时被当做旁门左道的建议，说设计新机器或许更省钱。

detailed_translations.english: A belief or action that is heretical is one that most people think is wrong because it disagrees with beliefs that are generally accepted

sentences.english: A bunch of keys hung from his belt.
sentences.chinese: 他的皮带上挂着一串钥匙。

sentences.english: Press the ‘Escape’ key to exit.
sentences.chinese: 按退出键退出。

sentences.english: Check your answers in the key at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 用书后的解答核对答案。

detailed_translations.english: a small specially shaped piece of metal that you put into a lock and turn in order to lock or unlock a door, start a car etc

name: misanthropy
trans: 厌世； 不愿与人来往

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌恶人类；厌世，愤世嫉俗
detailed_translations.english: Misanthropy is a general dislike of people

sentences.english: He was a natural politician, a gifted orator who knew how to work a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是位天生的政治家，是位有天赋且知道如何凝集民众的演说家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演说者；演讲者；雄辩家；原告
detailed_translations.english: someone who is good at making speeches and persuading people

sentences.english: Raised on a hog farm in Hunan Province, she laughs off the penurious ways of her parents and grandparents.
sentences.chinese: 她笑着说起在湖南养猪的父母的吝啬的生活方式。

detailed_translations.english: niggardly with money

sentences.english: Her eyes sparkled with merriment.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼里闪现出愉快的神情。

sentences.english: the sounds of merriment
sentences.chinese: 嬉闹的声音

detailed_translations.english: laughter, fun, and enjoyment

name: nondescript
trans: 难以区别的； 无特征的

sentences.english: a rather nondescript suburban house
sentences.chinese: 很普通的郊区房子

detailed_translations.chinese: 平凡的，没有特色的；难以区别的；莫可名状的
detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is nondescript looks very ordinary and is not at all interesting or unusual

detailed_translations.chinese: 不属任何类型的人；难以形容的人或物

name: understate
trans: 保守地说， 有意轻描淡写

sentences.english: The press have tended to understate the extent of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 媒体想淡化问题的严重程度。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少说，少报；保守地说；有意轻描淡写
detailed_translations.english: to describe something in a way that makes it seem less important or serious than it really is

sentences.english: When Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking for help.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长前来求助。

sentences.english: When Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking for help.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长进前来，求他说。

sentences.english: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长进前来，求他说。

detailed_translations.english: an army officer of ancient Rome, who was in charge of about 100 soldiers

sentences.english: The return of the disequilibrated organ systems of the body to steady states or dynamic stability is known as homeostasis.
sentences.chinese: 人们身体里失调的器官系统恢复到稳定的或动态稳定状态的过程被称为体内平衡。

sentences.english: In order to maintain this homeostasis, the brain deploys motivations such as pain, hunger, thirst and fear, as well the complementary pleasures of food, water, sex and safety.
sentences.chinese: 为了保持这种体内平衡，大脑对我们会施加如疼痛、饥渴和恐惧等刺激，同样也会在得到食物、水、性满足和安全感时发出喜悦的信号。

detailed_translations.chinese: [生理] 体内平衡；[自] 内稳态

sentences.english: There’s a nasty bug going round (=  that a lot of people have caught  ) .
sentences.chinese: 现在流行着一种很烦人的传染病。

sentences.english: a 24-hour flu bug
sentences.chinese: 一天即愈的流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫子；小病；故障，缺陷；窃听器
detailed_translations.english: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but is not very serious

detailed_translations.chinese: 烦扰， 纠缠； 在…装窃听器
detailed_translations.english: to put a  bug (=  small piece of electronic equipment  )  somewhere secretly in order to listen to conversations

sentences.english: I was forced to attempt a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫尝试一次骑马疾驰。

detailed_translations.english: a very fast speed

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
detailed_translations.english: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

sentences.english: ...an eerily prescient comedy about a populist multimillionaire political candidate.
sentences.chinese: ...围绕一位身价数百万的民粹主义政治候选人的一部喜剧，其预见性近乎诡异。

detailed_translations.english: able to imagine or know what will happen in the future

sentences.english: His tone was censorious.
sentences.chinese: 他语气苛刻。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑剔的；受批判的（名词censoriousness，副词censoriously）
detailed_translations.english: criticizing and expressing disapproval

sentences.english: He lay quiet, somnolent after the day’s exertions.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地躺着，劳累了一天之后感到十分困倦。

detailed_translations.english: almost starting to sleep

name: intervene
trans: 干涉， 干预； 插入， 介入； 指  介于其间

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

sentences.english: There are some dissenting voices (= people who do not agree ) among the undergraduates.
sentences.chinese: 大学生中有一些反对的呼声。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion
refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion

sentences.english: The driver might allocate a larger buffer after this point, or you might need to reduce your vertex count.
sentences.chinese: 在这点之后，驱动可能会分配一个更大的缓存，或者你可能需要降低你的顶点数量。

sentences.english: Definition of a sphere a vertex is not allowed to enter. This allows collision against the animated cloth.
sentences.chinese: 定义一个球体的一个顶点不允许进入。这允许反向碰撞动画布料。

detailed_translations.english: the point where two lines meet to form an angle, especially the point of a triangle

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

sentences.english: The control relationship between the auricle and the body.
sentences.chinese: 根据耳廓与人体控制关系。

sentences.english: Also known as the auricle, it works like a funnel, directing sounds into the ear canal.
sentences.chinese: 耳廓也被称为外耳，能起到漏斗一样功用，将声音导入耳道。

sentences.english: Firm elevation of the auricle in reconstruction of microtia with a retroauricular fascial flap wrap-ping an autogenous cartilage wedge.
sentences.chinese: 在重建小耳症时以耳后筋膜皮瓣包覆一自体锲形软骨达成稳定的耳廓立起。

detailed_translations.english: a small sac in the atrium of the heart

sentences.english: Draw me not aside to indolence and pride.
sentences.chinese: 不要使我偏离到懒惰和骄傲。

sentences.english: Human is always indolence, we must beat our nature .
sentences.chinese: 人总是懒惰，我们必须击败我们的本性。

sentences.english: The difficulties in the SALL is persevering it all the time. Human is always indolence, we must beat our nature . Persist to get the desired results.
sentences.chinese: 在自主学习的困难是坚持它的所有时间。人总是懒惰，我们必须击败我们的本性。坚持得到想要的结果。

detailed_translations.english: Indolence means laziness

sentences.english: Then you put that ovum into a different female's stomach.
sentences.chinese: 然后，将那个卵细胞放到一个不同的雌性腹中。

detailed_translations.english: an egg, especially one that develops inside the mother’s body

name: excoriate
trans: 擦伤  ， 磨掉  ； 痛斥， 责骂

sentences.english: He proceeded to excoriate me in front of the nurses.
sentences.chinese: 他继续在这些护士们面前指责我。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严厉的责难；擦破的皮肤
detailed_translations.english: To excoriate a person or organization means to criticize them severely, usually in public

name: garner
trans: 收藏， 储藏； 取得， 获得

sentences.english: Durham had garnered three times as many votes as Carey.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’
