sentences.chinese: 数字密码

sentences.english: The home team tried to utilize their numerical advantage (= the fact that they had more players than the other team ).
sentences.chinese: 主队试图利用他们在人数上的优势。

sentences.english: Make sure the files are organized in numerical order.
sentences.chinese: 务必把这些档案按数字顺序排列。

detailed_translations.english: expressed or considered in numbers

sentences.english: It takes time to readjust after a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 离婚后需要时间重新适应。

detailed_translations.english: to get used to a new situation, job, or way of life

name: eligible
trans: 符合条件的， 合格的；  合适的， 合意的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: endurable
trans: 可忍受的， 能忍耐的

sentences.english: The smallest courtesies along the rough roads of life are like the little birds that sing to us all winter long, and make that season of ice and snow more endurable.
sentences.chinese: 在坎坷的生活道路上，最细小的礼貌犹如在漫长的冬天为我们歌唱的小鸟，那歌声使冰天雪地的寒冬变得较易忍受。

sentences.english: The smallest courtesies along the rough roads of life are like the little birds that sing to us all winter long, and make that season of ice and snow more endurable.
sentences.chinese: 在坎坷的生活道路上，最细小的礼貌犹如在漫长的冬天为歌唱的小鸟，那歌声使冰 天雪地的寒冷变得较易忍受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可忍受的， 能忍耐的
detailed_translations.english: if a bad situation is endurable, you can accept it, even though it is difficult or painful

sentences.english: He has accused local people of trying to besmirch his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他指责当地人企图败坏他的名誉。

detailed_translations.english: If you besmirch someone or their reputation, you say that they are a bad person or that they have done something wrong, usually when this is not true

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

sentences.english: The club gave him an ultimatum – either he apologized, or he would be expelled from the team.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部给他下了最后通牒——要么道歉，要么等着被开除出队。

sentences.english: The army issued an ultimatum for all weapons in the city to be surrendered on October 26th.
sentences.chinese: 军队发出最后通牒，必须于 10 月 26 日交出该市的全部武器。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最后通牒；最后结论；基本原理
detailed_translations.english: a threat saying that if someone does not do what you want by a particular time, you will do something to punish them

sentences.english: He filched a bottle of wine from the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 他从地窖里偷了一瓶酒。

detailed_translations.english: to steal something small or not very valuable

name: illustrious
trans: 杰出的， 著名的， 光荣的； 辉煌的， 灿烂的

sentences.english: She has had an illustrious career.
sentences.chinese: 她已经有了辉煌的事业。

sentences.english: Wagner was just one of many illustrious visitors to the town.
sentences.chinese: 瓦格纳只是到访过这座小镇的众多名人中的一位。

detailed_translations.english: famous and admired because of what you have achieved

name: unconscious
trans: 无意识的， 失去知觉的； 不知道的， 没觉察到

sentences.english: She was found alive but unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 她被找到时还活着，但已不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

sentences.english: Mr Bush is a convert to an evangelical Christianity that emphasises emotion—particularly the intensely emotional experience of being born again—over ratiocination.
sentences.chinese: 布什皈依基督教福音派，该派强调主观情绪，尤其是狂热的再生体验，要凌驾于推理之上。

sentences.english: Reasonable ratiocination is a important method gaining mathematical discovery, author introduces concept of the ratiocination, function and way. Quoted example is fascinating and valuable.
sentences.chinese: 合情推理是数学发现的重要方法，本文介绍了合情推理的概念、作用、途径。所论及的内容对数学教学有参考价值。

name: idle
trans: 空闲的，闲置的；无用的，无效的；懒散的

sentences.english: I cannot afford to leave the land lying idle.
sentences.chinese: 我不能让土地闲置。

sentences.english: The whole team stood idle, waiting for the mechanic.
sentences.chinese: 整队人干站着等技工来。

sentences.english: The workers have been idle for the last six months.
sentences.chinese: 最近六个月工人们都很闲。

detailed_translations.english: not working or producing anything

sentences.english: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
sentences.chinese: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

sentences.english: The earthworm is a useful animal. On the ground it is food for other animals. Under the ground, it makes rich soil for fields and gardens.
sentences.chinese: 蚯蚓是一种有益的动物。在地面上它是其他动物的食物。在地下，它为田园和花园制造肥沃的土壤。

sentences.english: But when genetic characterization of the contents of beetle guts gave some unexpected results, the researchers decided to take a closer look at earthworm DNA.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当甲虫背脊骨包容的遗传特性显示出一些意想不到的结果时，这些研究人员决定仔细查明蚯蚓的DNA。

sentences.english: Germination is complicated with the bursting forth of a meteor and with the peck of a swallow cracking its egg, and it places on one level the birth of an earthworm and the advent of Socrates.
sentences.chinese: 万物的化育是复杂的，有风云雷电诸天象，有破壳而出的乳燕，一条蚯蚓的出生和苏格拉底的来临同属于化育之列。

detailed_translations.english: a common type of long thin brown worm that lives in soil

sentences.english: The hot sun enervated her to the point of collapse.
sentences.chinese: 热辣辣的太阳把她晒得快要晕过去了。

detailed_translations.english: to deprive of strength or vitality; weaken physically or mentally; debilitate
deprived of strength or vitality; weakened

sentences.english: It's the passage from Spenser's cave of Mammon canto that describes this same scene of violation, the violation of mother earth.
sentences.chinese: 这是斯潘塞笔下描写贪神之洞的长诗的篇章,它描述了对于大地母亲粗暴冒犯的场景。

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts into which a very long poem is divided

sentences.english: a blithe disregard for the facts
sentences.chinese: 对事实的漠视

detailed_translations.english: happy and having no worries

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

sentences.english: Recent medical studies confirm the efficacy of a healthier lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 近来的医学研究证实了更健康的生活方式的功效。

detailed_translations.english: the ability of something to produce the right result

name: nauseous
trans: 令人作呕的； 使人厌恶的

sentences.english: I felt slightly nauseous.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得有点恶心。

sentences.english: The taste made me nauseous.
sentences.chinese: 那味道让我恶心。

detailed_translations.english: feeling that you are going to vomit

sentences.english: The train arrived betimes.
sentences.chinese: 火车及时到达了。

detailed_translations.english: in good time; early

sentences.english: The company divested itself of its oil interests.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司从石油生意中抽身。

detailed_translations.english: If you divest yourself of something that you own or are responsible for, you get rid of it or stop being responsible for it

name: oblivious
trans: 遗忘的， 忘却的； 茫然的， 不自觉的

sentences.english: She lay motionless where she was, oblivious to pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一动不动地躺在原地，感觉不到疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: If you are oblivious to something or oblivious of it, you are not aware of it

name: informal
trans: 不正式的； 不拘礼节的

sentences.english: The atmosphere at work is fairly informal.
sentences.chinese: 工作气氛相当轻松。

sentences.english: The two groups met for informal talks.
sentences.chinese: 两个团体会面举行非正式会谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非正式的；不拘礼节的；随便的；通俗的；日常使用的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and friendly without being restricted by rules of correct behaviour
